32.Hamid S. Aziz: Strike out for them a Similitude: Two men, unto one of whom We have assigned two gardens of grapes, and surrounded them both with date-palms, and put corn-fields (or tilled fields) between the two

33.Hamid S. Aziz: Each of the two gardens brought forth its fruit and withheld naught thereof. And We caused a river to gush forth therein

34.Hamid S. Aziz: And he had abundant fruit, and he said unto his neighbour (or companion) in the course of mutual discussion (or argument), "I am much wealthier than you, and mightier in men (with more honour and power)."

35.Hamid S. Aziz: And he went in unto his garden, having thus wronged himself: said he, "I do not think that all this will ever perish

36.Hamid S. Aziz: And I think not that the Hour (of Judgment) will ever come; and even if I be sent back unto my Lord, I shall surely find something even better in exchange."

37.Hamid S. Aziz: His neighbour, while he disputed with him, exclaimed, "Disbelieve you in Him who created you from dust, and then from a drop, then fashioned you into a man

38.Hamid S. Aziz: But He is Allah, my Lord; and I associate no partner with my Lord

39.Hamid S. Aziz: "Why could you not have said when you did enter into your garden, ´As Allah pleases! (Or It is Allah´s will or Allah´s will always comes to pass). There is no power save in Allah!´. Though you see me as less than you in wealt

40.Hamid S. Aziz: "It may be that my Lord will give me something better than your garden, and will send upon it a bolt from heaven, and it shall be but bare slippery mud on the morrow

41.Hamid S. Aziz: "Or some morning the water thereof will be deeply sunk in the earth so that you can not get thereat."

42.Hamid S. Aziz: And his fruits were beset (with ruin). Then began he to wring his hands for all that he had spent thereon, for now it had crumbled down to its foundations. And he said, "Would that I had ascribed no partner with my Lord!"

43.Hamid S. Aziz: And he had no troop of men to help him against Allah, nor could he save himself

44.Hamid S. Aziz: In such a case the patronage is Allah´s alone, the True; He is best at rewarding and best for consequences (or success)

45.Hamid S. Aziz: Strike out for them, also, a similitude of the life of this world; like water, which We send down from the sky, and the vegetation of the earth absorbs it; but on the morrow (or soon) it is dried up, and the winds scatter it; for Allah is powerful over a

46.Hamid S. Aziz: Wealth and children are an ornament of the life of this world; but good works which endure are better with your Lord, for recompense, and better for hope

47.Hamid S. Aziz: And (think about) the Day when We will remove the mountains, and you shall see the whole earth emerging (or laid level); and We will gather them all, leaving out none

48.Hamid S. Aziz: Then shall they be presented to your Lord in ranks - Now have you come to Us (bare) as We created you at first! Aye, but you thought that We would never fulfil Our appointment (with you)

49.Hamid S. Aziz: And the Book (of Deeds) shall be placed, and you shall see the sinners in fear of what is recorded therein; and they will say, "Alas, for us! What a Book is this, it leaves out neither small nor great things, without numbering them?" And they s

50.Hamid S. Aziz: And (remember) when We said to the angels, "Fall prostrate in obeisance before Adam," they fell prostrate in obeisance, save only Iblis, who was of the Jinn, and who revolted against the command of his Lord. What! Will you then take him and his

51.Hamid S. Aziz: I made them not witnesses of the creation of the heavens and the earth, nor of the creation of themselves, nor did I take for My helpers those who lead astray

52.Hamid S. Aziz: (Be mindful) Of the day when He shall say, "Call you upon My pretend partners" and they shall call on them, but they shall not answer them; and We will set the vale of perdition between them

53.Hamid S. Aziz: And the guilty shall see the Fire, and shall know that they are about to fall therein, and shall find no escape there from

54.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, We have displayed in this Quran for men all kinds of similitudes (parables); but man is ever contentious

55.Hamid S. Aziz: Naught prevented men from believing when the guidance came to them, or from asking pardon of their Lord, except the coming on them of the judgment of the people of olden days, or the coming of the doom before their own eyes

56.Hamid S. Aziz: We sent not prophets save as heralds of glad tidings and as Warners; but those who disbelieve wrangle with vain speech to make void the truth therewith; and they take My revelations and warnings as a jest

57.Hamid S. Aziz: Who is more unjust than he who, being reminded of the revelations of his Lord, turns away there from, and forgets what his hands have sent forward? Verily, We have placed veils upon their heart lest they should understand, and deafness in their ears! And

58.Hamid S. Aziz: But your Lord is Forgiving, endowed with Mercy; were He to punish them for what they have earned He would have hastened for them the doom. Nay rather, they have their appointed term from which they have no escape

59.Hamid S. Aziz: Such were the populations; We destroyed them when they were unjust (iniquitous); and for their destruction We set an appointed time

60.Hamid S. Aziz: And when Moses said to his servant, "I will not cease until I reach the confluence of the two seas, though I go on for years."

61.Hamid S. Aziz: But when they reached the confluence of the two they forgot their Fish, and it took its way in the sea with a free course

62.Hamid S. Aziz: And when they had gone further, he said to his servant, "Bring us our breakfast, for we have suffered much fatigue on this journey."

63.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "What think you? When we resorted to the rock, then, verily, I forgot the fish, but it was only Satan, who made me forget it, and I forgot to tell you; and it took its way in the sea in a marvellous way."

64.Hamid S. Aziz: Moses said, "This is what we were searching for." So they retraced their steps again

65.Hamid S. Aziz: Then they found a servant of Ours, to whom We had given mercy from Ourselves, and had taught him knowledge from Our Presence

66.Hamid S. Aziz: Said Moses to him, "May I follow you, so that you may teach me of the (Higher) Truth which you have been taught?"

67.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "Verily, you can never bear it

68.Hamid S. Aziz: How can you be patient about what you can compass no knowledge (you cannot understand)?"

69.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "Allah willing, you will find me patient; nor will I rebel against your bidding."

70.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "Well then, if you follow me, ask me not about anything until I myself begin to mention it."

71.Hamid S. Aziz: So they set out until when they were in the boat, he made a hole therein and scuttled it. (Moses) Said, "Have you made a hole therein to drown the people therein? You have done a dreadful thing."

72.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "Did I not tell you, truly, you can never bear with me?"

73.Hamid S. Aziz: Moses said (pleaded), "Rebuke me not for forgetting, and be not hard on me."

74.Hamid S. Aziz: So they set out until they met a boy, and he killed him. Moses said, "What! Have you killed an innocent soul who has killed no one? Verily, you have done a foul (evil) deed."

75.Hamid S. Aziz: He answered, "Did I not tell you, truly, you can not bear with me?"

76.Hamid S. Aziz: Said Moses, "If ever I ask you about anything after this, keep me not in your company. Now have you received a promise from me."

77.Hamid S. Aziz: So they set out until when they came to the people of a city; and they asked the people thereof for food; but they refused to entertain them. And they found therein a wall which was about to fall into ruins, and he repaired it. Said Moses, "Had you

78.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "This is the parting between me and you. I will give you the interpretation of that with which you could not bear with me

79.Hamid S. Aziz: As for the boat, it belonged to poor people, who toiled on the sea (or river), and I wished to damage it, for behind it was a king who seized on every boat by force

80.Hamid S. Aziz: And as for the youth, his parents were believers, and we feared lest he should oppress them with rebellion and disbelief

81.Hamid S. Aziz: So we desired that their Lord would give them in exchange a better one than him in purity, and nearer in filial affection

82.Hamid S. Aziz: And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan youths in the city, and beneath it was a treasure belonging to them both, and their father was a righteous man, and their Lord desired that they should reach maturity, and then take out their treasure as a m

83.Hamid S. Aziz: And they will ask you about Zul´qarneyn (The Two-horned one, perhaps an ancient Persian Emperor). Say, "I will recite to you a remembrance of him

84.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, We established him firmly in the land, and We gave him a way to everything

85.Hamid S. Aziz: And he followed a way

86.Hamid S. Aziz: Until when he reached the setting of the sun (furthest West), he found it setting in a black muddy spring and he found thereat a people. We said, "O Zul´qarneyn! You have authority either to torment these people, or treat them kindly."

87.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "As for him who does wrong, I will punish him, then shall he be sent back to his Lord, and He will punish him with an unheard-of torment

88.Hamid S. Aziz: But as for him who believes and acts aright, for him is an excellent reward, and we will give him our easy command."

89.Hamid S. Aziz: Then he followed another way

90.Hamid S. Aziz: Until when he reached the rising of the sun (furthest East), he found it rising upon a people to whom We had given no shelter there from

91.Hamid S. Aziz: He left them as they were. And We comprehended fully the forces before him

92.Hamid S. Aziz: Then he followed still another way

93.Hamid S. Aziz: Until when he reached the point between the two mountains, he found below them a people who could scarcely under-stand speech

94.Hamid S. Aziz: They said, "O Zul´qarneyn! Verily, Yagug and Magug (Gog and Magog) are doing great evil in the land. Shall we then pay you tribute, that you set between us and them a barrier?"

95.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "The power my Lord hath established me in is better than tribute; help me, therefore, with strength (labour), and I will set a barrier between you and them

96.Hamid S. Aziz: "Bring me blocks of iron. When they had filled up the space between the two mountain-sides, he said, "Blow (with your bellows)". When he had made it red with fire, he said, "Bring me, that I may pour over it, molten lead."

97.Hamid S. Aziz: Thus were they made powerless to scale it, and to tunnel through it

98.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "This is a mercy from my Lord; but when the promise of my Lord comes to pass, He will make it as dust, for the promise of my Lord is true."

99.Hamid S. Aziz: And on that Day We shall leave them to surge like waves over one another; and the trumpet will be blown, and We will gather them all together

100.Hamid S. Aziz: And We will set forth Hell on that day before the disbelievers

101.Hamid S. Aziz: Whose eyes were veiled from My Remembrance, and who were unable to hear

102.Hamid S. Aziz: What! Did those who disbelieve reckon that they could take My servants for patrons beside Me? Verily, We have prepared Hell for the disbelievers for their entertainment

103.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Shall we inform you of those who lose most by their works

104.Hamid S. Aziz: Those who erred in their endeavours in the life of this world, and who thought they were acquiring good by their deeds."

105.Hamid S. Aziz: They are those who disbelieve in the signs of their Lord and in their meeting Him; vain are their works; and We will not give them any weight on the Day of Judgment

106.Hamid S. Aziz: That is their reward - Hell! Because that they disbelieved and took My revelations and My Messengers as a jest

107.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, those who believe and act righteously, for them are Gardens of Paradis

108.Hamid S. Aziz: Wherein they shall dwell, and they shall crave no change there from

109.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Were the oceans ink for the Words of my Lord, the ocean would surely fail before the Words of my Lord fail; aye, though We brought as much ink again

110.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "I am only a mortal like yourselves; I am inspired that your God is only one God. Then let him who hopes to meet his Lord work righteous acts, and join none with Him in the service of his Lord."

1.Hamid S. Aziz: KAF HA YA AIN SAD

2.Hamid S. Aziz: A mention of your Lord´s mercy to His servant Zachariah

3.Hamid S. Aziz: When he called on his Lord in secret

4.Hamid S. Aziz: Praying, "My Lord! Verily, my bones are weak, and my head shines with grey hair; but I never was unfortunate in my prayers to Thee, my Lord

5.Hamid S. Aziz: But I fear my kinsfolk after me, since my wife is barren; then grant me from Thy presence a successor

6.Hamid S. Aziz: To be my heir (or true representative) and the heir (or true representative) of the family of Jacob, and make him, my Lord, one with whom you are well-pleased."

7.Hamid S. Aziz: (The answer came), "O Zachariah! Verily, We give you glad tidings of a son, whose name shall be John. None by that name have We distinguished before."

8.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "My Lord! How can I have a son, when my wife is barren, and I have become decrepit through old age?"

9.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "Thus it will be. Your Lord says, ´It is easy for Me, for I created you at first when yet you were nothing.´"

10.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "O my Lord! Give me a sign." He said, "Your sign is that you shall not speak to any man for three nights, though you are sound."

11.Hamid S. Aziz: Then he went forth unto his people from the chamber, and he made signs to them, "Glorify your Lord at break of day and fall of night."

12.Hamid S. Aziz: (And it was said to his son) " O John! Hold fast the Book", and We gave him Wisdom even as a boy

13.Hamid S. Aziz: And compassion from Our Presence, and purity; and he was devout (pious, righteous)

14.Hamid S. Aziz: And kind to his parents, and was not arrogant and rebellious

15.Hamid S. Aziz: So peace upon him the day he was born, and the day he died, and the day he shall be raised up to life again

16.Hamid S. Aziz: And mention Mary in the Book; when she retired from her family into an eastern chamber

17.Hamid S. Aziz: And she took a veil (to screen herself) from them; and We sent unto her Our Angel (or spirit); and he assumed for her the semblance of a perfect man

18.Hamid S. Aziz: Said she, "Verily, I take refuge in the Merciful One from you, if you are god-fearing."

19.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "I am only a messenger of your Lord to bestow on you a pure son."

20.Hamid S. Aziz: Said she, "How can I have a boy when no mortal has touched me, and when I am no harlot?"

21.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "Thus says your Lord, ´It is easy for Me! And We will make him a revelation unto mankind, and a mercy from Us; for it is a thing ordained (or decreed)."

22.Hamid S. Aziz: So she conceived him, and she retired with him into a remote place

23.Hamid S. Aziz: And the labour pains came upon her at the trunk of a palm tree, and she said, "O that I had died before this, and become a thing of naught, forgotten!"

24.Hamid S. Aziz: Then one called to her from beneath her "Grieve not, for your Lord has placed a stream beneath your feet

25.Hamid S. Aziz: And shake towards you the trunk of the palm tree, it will drop upon you fresh ripe dates

26.Hamid S. Aziz: So eat, and drink, and be consoled; and if you should see any mortal say, "Verily, I have vowed to the Beneficent One a fast, and I will not speak to-day to any mortal."

27.Hamid S. Aziz: Then she brought him (her son) to her people, carrying it. Said they, "O Mary! You have done an amazing (abominable) thing

28.Hamid S. Aziz: "O sister of Aaron! Your father was not a bad man, nor was your mother a harlot!"

29.Hamid S. Aziz: Then she pointed to him, and they said, "How are we to speak with one who is a baby in the cradle?"

30.Hamid S. Aziz: He (the baby) said, "Verily, I am a servant of Allah; He has brought me the Book (revelation), and He has made me a prophet

31.Hamid S. Aziz: "And He has made me blessed wherever I am; and He has required of me prayer and charity as long as I live

32.Hamid S. Aziz: And has made me kind towards my mother, and not arrogant (tyrannical) and miserable

33.Hamid S. Aziz: And peace upon me the day I was born, and the day I die, and the day I shall be raised up alive."

34.Hamid S. Aziz: Such was Jesus, the son of Mary. This is the statement of truth concerning which they doubt (or dispute)

35.Hamid S. Aziz: It befits not the Majesty of Allah that he should beget a son. Glory be to Him! When He decrees a matter He only says to it, "BE," and it is

36.Hamid S. Aziz: And, lo! Allah is my Lord and your Lord (see John 20:17), so worship Him; this is the Straight Way

37.Hamid S. Aziz: And the sects among them disagree, but woe to those who disbelieve from the meeting of the mighty Day

38.Hamid S. Aziz: How plainly will they see and hear on the day when they shall come to Us; but today the evildoers are in manifest error

39.Hamid S. Aziz: And warn them of the Day of Sighs (Anguish, Regret, Distress) when the matter is determined. Now they are heedless, and believe not

40.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, We will inherit the earth and all who are upon it, and unto Us shall they return

41.Hamid S. Aziz: And mention Abraham in the Book; verily, he was a saint (a man of truth, a true witness), a prophet

42.Hamid S. Aziz: When he said to his father, "O my sire! Why do you worship what can neither hear nor see nor avail you aught

43.Hamid S. Aziz: "O my Sire! Verily, to me has come knowledge which has not come to you; so follow me, and I will guide you to a Straight and Level Way

44.Hamid S. Aziz: "O my Sire! Serve not Satan; verily, Satan is ever a rebel against the Beneficent One

45.Hamid S. Aziz: "O my Sire! Verily, I fear that there may afflict you punishment from the Beneficent One, and that you may be a comrade (or client) of Satan."

46.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "What! Do you reject (or hate) my gods, O Abraham? Verily, if you do not desist I will certainly stone you; but get you gone from me for a long time!"

47.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "Peace be upon you! I will ask forgiveness for you from my Lord. Verily, He is to me most gracious

48.Hamid S. Aziz: "I will part from you and what you call on beside Allah, and will pray unto my Lord. It may be that in my prayer unto my Lord, I shall not be unblest."

49.Hamid S. Aziz: And when he had parted from them and what they served beside Allah, We granted him Isaac and Jacob, and each of them We made a prophet

50.Hamid S. Aziz: And We bestowed on them of Our Mercy, and We granted them lofty honour on (or from) the tongue of truth

51.Hamid S. Aziz: And mention Moses in the Book; verily, he was chosen, and was a Messenger, a prophet

52.Hamid S. Aziz: We called him from the right side of the Mount (Sinai); and We made him draw nigh unto Us to commune with him

53.Hamid S. Aziz: And We granted him out of Our Mercy, his brother Aaron also a prophet

54.Hamid S. Aziz: And mention Ishmael in the Book; verily, he was true to his promise, and was a messenger and a prophet

55.Hamid S. Aziz: He used to enjoin on his people prayers and charity, and was most acceptable (sacrifice) in the sight of his Lord

56.Hamid S. Aziz: And mention, in the Book, Idris (Enoch?); verily, he was a saint and a prophet

57.Hamid S. Aziz: And We raised him to a lofty place

58.Hamid S. Aziz: These are those to whom Allah has been gracious, of the prophets of the seed of Adam, and of those whom We carried with Noah, and of the seed of Abraham and Israel, and of those We guided and elected. When the revelations of the Beneficent were recited u

59.Hamid S. Aziz: But there succeeded after them a later generation who have ruined worship and have followed lusts (prejudices, fantasies, greed, self-interest, superstition), but they shall at length face deception (or failure, destruction)

60.Hamid S. Aziz: Save such as repent and believe and act right; for these shall enter the Garden and shall not be wronged in aught

61.Hamid S. Aziz: Gardens of Eden, which the Beneficent has promised to His servants in the Unseen; verily, His promise ever comes to pass

62.Hamid S. Aziz: They shall hear no empty (vain) talk therein, but only Peace; and there they shall have their provision morning and evening

63.Hamid S. Aziz: Such is the Garden which We will give for an inheritance to those of our servants who are devout

64.Hamid S. Aziz: (The angels say), "We descend not save at the command of your Lord; His is what is before us, and what is behind us, and what is between these; for your Lord is never forgetful

65.Hamid S. Aziz: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth, and of what is between the two; so serve (worship) Him and persevere in His service. Do you know of any worthy of His Name

66.Hamid S. Aziz: Man will say, "What! When I have died shall I then come forth alive?"

67.Hamid S. Aziz: But then does not man remember that We created him before when he was naught

68.Hamid S. Aziz: And by your Lord! We will, without doubt, gather them together, and the devils (or evil ones) too; then will We surely bring them forth on their knees round about Hell

69.Hamid S. Aziz: Then shall We certainly drag, out from every sect, whichever of them has been most obstinately rebellious against the Beneficent

70.Hamid S. Aziz: And surely We are best aware of those who are most deserving to be broiled therein

71.Hamid S. Aziz: There is not one of you who will not go down to it (the Fire), that is a fixed Decree of your Lord

72.Hamid S. Aziz: Then We will save those who fear Us; but We will leave the evildoers therein on their knees

73.Hamid S. Aziz: And when Our clear revelations are recited to them, those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Which of the two parties (your s or mine) is best placed and in the best company?"

74.Hamid S. Aziz: And how many generations before them have We destroyed who were better off in property and outward appearance

75.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Whoever is in error, the Beneficent will extend to him until they see what they are threatened with, whether it be the torment in this world or whether it be the Hour (of Doom in the Hereafter), then they shall know who is worse placed and wea

76.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who seek guidance, Allah will increase their guidance. And enduring good works are best with your Lord for a reward, and best for restoration (or eventual returns)

77.Hamid S. Aziz: Have you seen him who disbelieves in Our signs, and says, "I shall surely be given wealth and children?"

78.Hamid S. Aziz: Has he become acquainted with the Unseen, or has he made a pact with the Beneficent

79.Hamid S. Aziz: Not so! We will write down what he says, and We will extend for him a span of torment

80.Hamid S. Aziz: And We will make him inherit that whereof he spoke, and he shall come to Us alone

81.Hamid S. Aziz: They take other gods besides Allah to be their source of power

82.Hamid S. Aziz: Not so! They shall deny their worship of them, and shall become their opponents

83.Hamid S. Aziz: Do you not see that We have sent the devils against the disbelievers, to confound them with confusion

84.Hamid S. Aziz: So be not you hasty with them. Verily, We do but number them a sum (of days)

85.Hamid S. Aziz: On the Day when We will gather the righteous unto the Beneficent, honoured as a goodly company

86.Hamid S. Aziz: We will drive the guilty into hell, like thirsty herds to water

87.Hamid S. Aziz: They shall have no power of intercession, save him who has taken a covenant with his Lord

88.Hamid S. Aziz: They say, "The Beneficent has taken to Himself a son."

89.Hamid S. Aziz: Assuredly, you have brought a monstrous thing

90.Hamid S. Aziz: Whereby the heavens are almost torn asunder, and the earth is riven, and the mountains fall in ruin

91.Hamid S. Aziz: That you attribute to the Beneficent a son

92.Hamid S. Aziz: When it is not becoming to the majesty of the Beneficent that he take to Himself a son

93.Hamid S. Aziz: There is none in the heavens or the earth but comes to the Beneficent as a servant

94.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, He knows them and numbers them exactly

95.Hamid S. Aziz: And each one of them come unto Him on the Day of Resurrection, alon

96.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, those who believe and act aright, on them the Beneficent bestows love

97.Hamid S. Aziz: We have made the Scripture easy on your tongue, only that you may thereby give glad tidings unto those who ward of evil, and warn thereby a contentious people

98.Hamid S. Aziz: How many a generation before them have We destroyed? Can you find any one of them, or hear a whisper of them

1.Hamid S. Aziz: TA HA

2.Hamid S. Aziz: We have not sent down this Quran to you that you should be distressed

3.Hamid S. Aziz: But only as a reminder to him who fears (or is in awe of Allah or fears doing wrong)

4.Hamid S. Aziz: Descending (as a revelation) from Him who created the earth and the high heavens

5.Hamid S. Aziz: The most Beneficent is firmly settled on the Throne (of Authority)

6.Hamid S. Aziz: To Him belongs what is in the heavens, and what is in the earth, and all that which is between the two, and all that which is beneath the ground

7.Hamid S. Aziz: And if you pronounce the words loudly (or publicly), yet, verily, he knows the secret and the even more hidden

8.Hamid S. Aziz: Allah! There is no God but He! To Him belong the Most Beautiful Names

9.Hamid S. Aziz: Has the story of Moses come to you

10.Hamid S. Aziz: Behold, he saw a fire: and said to his folk, "Tarry ye; verily, I perceive a fire far off. Perhaps I may bring you there from a brand, or may find some guidance (news, information) by the fire."

11.Hamid S. Aziz: And when he came to it he was addressed, "O Moses

12.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, I am your Lord, so take off your sandals; verily, you are in the holy valley Tuwa

13.Hamid S. Aziz: And I have chosen you. So listen to what is inspired in you

14.Hamid S. Aziz: "Verily, I am Allah; there is no God but Me! So serve Me, and be steadfast in prayer to remember Me

15.Hamid S. Aziz: "Verily, the hour is coming, but I will to keep it hidden (but make it known), that every soul may be recompensed for its efforts

16.Hamid S. Aziz: "Let not then him who believes not therein and follows his lusts (prejudices, fantasies, superstitions) ever turn you away there from, lest you be ruined

17.Hamid S. Aziz: "What is that in your right hand, O Moses?"

18.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "It is my staff on which I lean, and wherewith I beat down leaves for my flocks, and for which I have other uses."

19.Hamid S. Aziz: Allah said, "Throw it down, O Moses!"

20.Hamid S. Aziz: And he threw it down, and behold! It was a snake, moving (alive)

21.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "Take hold of it and fear not; We will restore it to its former state

22.Hamid S. Aziz: "But press your hand to your side, it shall come forth white without harm, as another sign

23.Hamid S. Aziz: To show you of Our greater signs

24.Hamid S. Aziz: "Go unto Pharaoh. Verily, he is outrageous (he has transgressed beyond bounds)"

25.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "My Lord! Expand for me my breast (relieve my mind from tension)

26.Hamid S. Aziz: "And ease my task for me

27.Hamid S. Aziz: And loosen the knot from my tongue

28.Hamid S. Aziz: "That they may understand my saying

29.Hamid S. Aziz: "Appoint for me a minister from my people

30.Hamid S. Aziz: "Aaron, my brother

31.Hamid S. Aziz: "Gird up my loins through him

32.Hamid S. Aziz: "And let him share my task

33.Hamid S. Aziz: "That we may glorify Thee much

34.Hamid S. Aziz: "And much remember Thee

35.Hamid S. Aziz: "Verily, Thou art He who is ever Seeing of us!"

36.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "You are granted your request, O Moses

37.Hamid S. Aziz: "And We have already shown favours unto you at another time

38.Hamid S. Aziz: "When We inspired your mother with the message

39.Hamid S. Aziz: "´Put him into the ark, and put it into the river. The river shall cast him on the shore, and an enemy of Mine and of his shall take him.´ And on you have I cast love from Me, that you may be trained according to My will

40.Hamid S. Aziz: When your sister walked on and said, "Shall I guide you to one who will nurse him? And We restored you to your mother, that her eye might be cheered and that she should not grieve. And you did slay a man and We saved you from the resulting trouble,

41.Hamid S. Aziz: "And I have prepared you for Myself

42.Hamid S. Aziz: "Go, you and your brother, with my Signs (revelations), and be not remiss in remembering Me

43.Hamid S. Aziz: "Go you both to Pharaoh. Verily, he is outrageous (transgresses beyond bounds)

44.Hamid S. Aziz: And speak to him a gentle speech, that per chance (or possibly) he may be mindful or fear."

45.Hamid S. Aziz: They two said, "Our Lord! Verily, we fear that he may be beforehand with us (hasty in arrogance before we can accomplish our mission), or that he may be outrageous (transgressing all bounds or tyrannous)."

46.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "Fear not. Verily, I am with you twain, Hearing and Seeing

47.Hamid S. Aziz: "So go you to him and say, ´Verily, we are the messengers of your Lord; Let the children of Israel go with us, and torment them not. We bring you a sign from your Lord, and peace will be upon him who follows the right guidance

48.Hamid S. Aziz: "´Verily, it has been revealed unto us that the torment will surely come upon him who denies us and turns away.´"

49.Hamid S. Aziz: Pharaoh said, "And who is your Lord, O Moses?"

50.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "Our Lord is He who gave everything its form, nature and existence, then guided it right."

51.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he (Pharaoh), "And what of the former generations?"

52.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "The knowledge of them is with my Lord in a Book (or Record); my Lord neither errs nor forgets

53.Hamid S. Aziz: "Who made for you the earth a bed; and has traced for you paths therein; and has sent down from the sky water." We have brought forth thereby divers classes of vegetation

54.Hamid S. Aziz: Eat and pasture your cattle there from. Verily, in this are signs to those endowed with intelligence (minds or understanding)

55.Hamid S. Aziz: From it have We created you and into it will We return you, and from it will We bring you forth again."

56.Hamid S. Aziz: We did show him Our signs, all of them, but he called them lies and refused

57.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "Have you come to us, to turn us out of our land with your magic, O Moses

58.Hamid S. Aziz: "Then we will bring you magic like it; and we will make between us and you an appointment which we shall not fail to keep - neither we nor you - at a fair place (convenient to both or one where both have an equal chance)."

59.Hamid S. Aziz: Moses said, "Let your appointment be for the day of the festival, and let the people assemble when the sun is high (noon)."

60.Hamid S. Aziz: Then Pharaoh gathered his strength (being disconcerted), and returned (having formed a plot)

61.Hamid S. Aziz: Said Moses to him, "Woe to you! Forge you not against Allah a lie; lest He destroy you by punishment. The forger must ever suffer disappointment (or failure)."

62.Hamid S. Aziz: And they argued the matter among themselves, but they kept their counsel secret

63.Hamid S. Aziz: Said they, "These two are certainly two expert magicians, who wish to turn you out of (authority in) the land by their magic, and to remove your most cherished (or exemplary) traditions (doctrines, institutions)

64.Hamid S. Aziz: Collect, therefore, your tricks (or lay your plans), and then form a row (or battle line); for he who has the upper-hand this day will be successful indeed."

65.Hamid S. Aziz: Said they, "O Moses! Either you must throw first, or let us throw first."

66.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "Nay, you throw first!" And lo! Their ropes and their staves appeared to move along

67.Hamid S. Aziz: And Moses felt a secret fear within his soul

68.Hamid S. Aziz: Said We, "Fear not! You shall have the upper hand

69.Hamid S. Aziz: "Throw what is in your right hand; and it shall devour what they have made. Verily, that which they have made is but a magician´s trick; and no magician shall prosper whatever skill he has."

70.Hamid S. Aziz: And then the magicians were cast down in prostration (obeisance), saying, "We believe in the Lord of Aaron and of Moses!"

71.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he (Pharaoh), "Do you believe in Him before I give you leave? Verily, he is your master who taught you magic! Therefore will I surely cut off your hands and feet on alternate sides, and I will surely crucify you on the trunks of palm trees; and

72.Hamid S. Aziz: Said they, "We will never prefer you to what has come to us as Manifest Signs, and to Him who originated us. Decree then whatever you desire to decree; for you can only decree about the life of this world

73.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, we believe in our Lord. May He pardon us our sins, and the magic you have forced us to use; and Allah is better and more lasting!"

74.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, he who comes to his Lord guilty, verily, for him is hell; he shall therein neither die nor live

75.Hamid S. Aziz: But he who comes to Him a believer who has done right, for them are the highest ranks

76.Hamid S. Aziz: Gardens of Eden beneath which rivers flow, to dwell therein for ever. That is the reward for him who grows (or purifies himself)

77.Hamid S. Aziz: And We inspired Moses, saying, "Journey by night with my servants, and strike out for them a dry road in the sea. Fear not pursuit, nor be afraid!"

78.Hamid S. Aziz: Then Pharaoh followed them with his armies, and the sea overwhelmed them and covered them up completely

79.Hamid S. Aziz: Pharaoh had led his people astray instead of guiding them right

80.Hamid S. Aziz: O Children of Israel! We delivered you from your enemy; and We made a covenant with you on the side of the mount; and We sent down upon you the manna and the quails

81.Hamid S. Aziz: Saying, "Eat of the good things We have provided you with, but do not commit excesses therein, lest My wrath justly descend upon you; for on whomsoever My wrath descends they perish indeed

82.Hamid S. Aziz: "Yet am I also He who forgives unto him who repents and believes and does right, and then is guided

83.Hamid S. Aziz: "But what has hastened you on away from your people, O Moses?"

84.Hamid S. Aziz: Moses said, "They are here close behind, and I hastened to Thee, my Lord, to please Thee."

85.Hamid S. Aziz: Said He, "Verily, We have tested your people in your absence, and As-Samiri has led them astray."

86.Hamid S. Aziz: And Moses returned to his people, wrathful, grieving! Said he, "O my people! Did not your Lord make you a goodly promise? Has the time seemed too long for you, or do you desire that wrath should descend on you from your Lord, and so you have broken

87.Hamid S. Aziz: They said, "We have not broken our promise to you of our own accord. But we were made to carry the load of the ornaments of the people, and we hurled them (into the fire). That was what As-Samiri bid us

88.Hamid S. Aziz: Then he brought forth for the people (out of the fire) a corporeal (a statue of a) calf. It seemed to low, and they said, "This is your god and the god of Moses, but he has forgotten!"

89.Hamid S. Aziz: What! Do they not see that it does not answer them in speech, and cannot control for them harm or profit

90.Hamid S. Aziz: Aaron had already, before this, said to them, "O my people! You are only being tried (or seduced) thereby; and, verily, your Lord is the Beneficent, so follow me and obey my bidding."

91.Hamid S. Aziz: They said, "We will not cease to pay devotion to it until Moses return to us."

92.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he (Moses), "O Aaron! What prevented you, when you did see them go astray

93.Hamid S. Aziz: From following me? Have you then rebelled against my bidding

94.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "O son of my mother! Seize me not by my beard, or my head! Verily, I feared lest you should say, ´You have made a division amongst the children of Israel, and have not waited for my word.´"

95.Hamid S. Aziz: (Moses) said, "What was your design, O Samiri?"

96.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "I beheld what they beheld not, and I grasped a handful of dust from the footprint of the messenger and cast it; for thus my soul induced me."

97.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "Then get you gone; verily, it shall be yours in life to say, "Touch me not!" and, verily, for you there is a tryst which you shall surely never break. But look at your god to which you were just now a devout worshipper. We will s

98.Hamid S. Aziz: "Your God is only Allah besides Whom there is no other God. He embraces all things in His knowledge."

99.Hamid S. Aziz: Thus do We narrate to you the history of what has gone before, and We have brought you from Our Presence a reminder

100.Hamid S. Aziz: Whoever turns there from, verily, he shall bear a great burden on the Day of Resurrection

101.Hamid S. Aziz: Abiding under it, an evil burden to bear on the Day of Resurrection

102.Hamid S. Aziz: On the day when the Trumpet shall be blown, and We will gather the guilty on that day white-eyed (with terror)

103.Hamid S. Aziz: They shall whisper to each other, "You have only tarried ten days."

104.Hamid S. Aziz: We know best what they say, when their leaders, best in conduct say, "You have only tarried a day."

105.Hamid S. Aziz: They will ask you about the mountains; say, "My Lord will break them into scattered dust

106.Hamid S. Aziz: "And He will leave them a level plain

107.Hamid S. Aziz: "Wherein you will see no curve or ruggedness (crookedness or unevenness)."

108.Hamid S. Aziz: On that day they shall follow the Caller who deceives not; and the voices shall be hushed before the Beneficent, and you shall hear naught but a shuffling (or tramp of marching feet)

109.Hamid S. Aziz: On that day shall no intercession be of any avail, save from such as the Beneficent permits, and who is acceptable to Him

110.Hamid S. Aziz: He knows what is before them and what is behind them, but they comprehend not His knowledge

111.Hamid S. Aziz: All faces shall be humbled before the Living, the Self-subsisting, Eternal; Hopeless will be indeed the man that carries iniquity on his back

112.Hamid S. Aziz: But he who does righteous acts and has faith, he shall fear neither wrong nor diminution

113.Hamid S. Aziz: Thus have We revealed it in an Arabic Lecture (Quran); and have displayed in it certain threats, that per chance (or possibly) they may fear evil, or it may cause them to take heed

114.Hamid S. Aziz: Exalted then be Allah, the King, the Truth (or the True King)! Hasten not the Quran before its inspiration is completed for you; but say, "O Lord! increase me in knowledge."

115.Hamid S. Aziz: We did make a covenant with Adam of yore, but he forgot it, and We found no firm purpose in him

116.Hamid S. Aziz: And when We said to the angels, "Prostrate yourselves before Adam," they prostrated themselves, save Iblis, who refused

117.Hamid S. Aziz: And We said, "O Adam! Verily, this is a foe to you and to your wife; never then let him drive you twain forth from the garden or you will be wretched

118.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, you have not to be hungry there, nor naked

119.Hamid S. Aziz: And, verily, you shall not thirst therein, nor suffer from the sun´s heat!"

120.Hamid S. Aziz: But Satan whispered to him, saying. "O Adam! shall I guide you to the Tree of Immortality, and a kingdom that wastes not away?"

121.Hamid S. Aziz: And they ate there from, and their shame became apparent to them; and they began to stitch upon themselves some leaves of the garden; and Adam rebelled against his Lord, and went astray

122.Hamid S. Aziz: Then his Lord chose him, and relented towards him, and guided him

123.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "Go down, you twain, there from altogether, some of you foes to the other. And if there should come to you from Me a guidance; then whoever follows My guidance shall neither err nor come to grief

124.Hamid S. Aziz: But he who turns away from Remembrance of Me, verily, for him shall be a narrow life; and I shall bring him blind to the assembly on the Day of Resurrection."

125.Hamid S. Aziz: He shall say, "My Lord! Wherefore have you gathered me blind when I used to see?"

126.Hamid S. Aziz: He shall say, "Our revelations came to you, and you did forget them; In like manner are you forgotten this Day!"

127.Hamid S. Aziz: Thus do We recompense him who is extravagant and believes not in the revelations of his Lord; and the doom of the hereafter is keener and more lasting

128.Hamid S. Aziz: Is it not guidance for them to know how many generations We have destroyed before them, amidst whose dwelling-places they walk? Verily, in that are signs to men of thought (or intelligence)

129.Hamid S. Aziz: But for the decree already passed from your Lord, and a term already fixed, the judgment would have come to them now

130.Hamid S. Aziz: Therefore, bear patiently with what they say, and celebrate the praises of your Lord ere the rising of the sun, and ere its setting, and glorify Him at times in the night and at the two ends of the day, that you may find acceptance

131.Hamid S. Aziz: And do not strain after what We have provided a few of them - the splendours of the life of this world, through which We test them; but the provision of your Lord is better and more lasting

132.Hamid S. Aziz: Bid your people worship, and persevere in it; We do not ask you to provide, it is We Who will provide for you. But the sequel is for righteousness

133.Hamid S. Aziz: They say, "Unless he brings us a sign from his Lord.....". What! Has there not come to them the proof of what was in the former scriptures

134.Hamid S. Aziz: But had We destroyed them with doom before it, they would have said, "If only Thou had sent to us a messenger, that we might follow Thy signs before we were abased and put to shame."

135.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Each one has to wait, so wait you also! But in the end you shall know who it is that is on the straight and level path, and who it is that is guided right."

1.Hamid S. Aziz: Their reckoning draws nigh to men, yet in heedlessness they turn aside

2.Hamid S. Aziz: No new reminder comes to them from their Lord, but they listen to it as in (or while they play (or as a jest)

3.Hamid S. Aziz: Their heart trifling with it (or pre-occupied elsewhere). And those who do wrong discourse secretly, saying, "Is this man aught but a mortal like yourselves? Will you succumb to magic with open eyes?"

4.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "My Lord knows what is said in the heavens and the earth, He is Hearer and Knower."

5.Hamid S. Aziz: "Nay!" they say, "Muddled dreams; nay! He has forged it; nay! He is a poet; but let him bring us a sign as those of yore were sent."

6.Hamid S. Aziz: Of those before them not one of the communities which We destroyed believed, how will these believe

7.Hamid S. Aziz: Nor did We send before them any but men whom We inspired? Ask you the people of the Scriptures if you do not know

8.Hamid S. Aziz: Nor did We give them bodies that ate no food, nor were they immortal

9.Hamid S. Aziz: Yet We made Our promise to them good, and We saved them and whom We pleased; but We destroyed those who committed excesses

10.Hamid S. Aziz: Now have We sent down to you a Book in which is a reminder for you; have you then no sense

11.Hamid S. Aziz: How many a community that had done wrong have We shattered, and raised up after it another people

12.Hamid S. Aziz: And when they perceived Our Might, behold, they tried to flee from it

13.Hamid S. Aziz: "Flee not away, but return to what you delighted in, and to your dwellings, that you may be questioned."

14.Hamid S. Aziz: Said they, "O woe is us! Verily, we were wrong-doers."

15.Hamid S. Aziz: And that ceased not to be their cry until We made them like mown down fields, extinct (or as smouldering ashes)

16.Hamid S. Aziz: We did not create the heaven and the earth and what is between the two in play

17.Hamid S. Aziz: Had We wished to find a pastime, We could have found it in (or nearer) Our Presence, if We would do such a thing

18.Hamid S. Aziz: Nay, We hurl the True against the False and it does break its head, and lo! It vanishes. But woe to you for what you attribute (to Allah)

19.Hamid S. Aziz: Unto Him belongs whoever is in the heavens and the earth, and those who dwell in His Presence are not too proud to serve Him, nor do they weary

20.Hamid S. Aziz: They glorify Him by night and day without intermission

21.Hamid S. Aziz: Or have they chosen gods from the earth who can raise the dead

22.Hamid S. Aziz: Were there in both (heaven and earth) gods beside Allah, both would surely have been disordered. Glorified is Allah, the Lord of the Throne, above all they ascribe unto Him

23.Hamid S. Aziz: He can not be questioned concerning what He does, but They shall be questioned

24.Hamid S. Aziz: Have they chosen gods beside Him? Say, "Bring your proofs. This is the reminder (Message) of those who are with me (Muhammad), and of those who were before me." Nay, most of them know not the truth, so they turn away

25.Hamid S. Aziz: We have not sent any messenger before you, but We inspired him that, "There is no god but Me, so serve you Me."

26.Hamid S. Aziz: And they say, "The Beneficent has taken a son; glorified be He! Nay, but they are honoured servants

27.Hamid S. Aziz: They speak not until He speaks; and they act by His command (John30)

28.Hamid S. Aziz: He knows what is before them, and what is behind them, and they can not intercede except for him whom He accepts; and they shrink through awe of Him

29.Hamid S. Aziz: And whoever of them should say, "Verily, I am God instead of (or besides) Him," such a one We recompense with hell; thus do We repay the wrong-doers

30.Hamid S. Aziz: Do not those who disbelieve see that the heavens and the earth were of one piece, and We parted them; and We made every living thing from water. Will they then not believe

31.Hamid S. Aziz: And We placed on the earth firm mountains lest it should move with them, and He made therein open roads for paths, per chance (or possibly) they may be guided

32.Hamid S. Aziz: And We made the heaven a guarded canopy; yet from our signs they turn aside

33.Hamid S. Aziz: He it is who created the night and the day, and the sun and the moon, they float each in their orbit

34.Hamid S. Aziz: We appointed immortality for no mortal before you. What! If you die, will they live on forever

35.Hamid S. Aziz: Every soul must taste of death. We will test you with evil and with good, as a trial; and unto Us will you be returned

36.Hamid S. Aziz: And when those who disbelieve see you, they only take you for a jest, saying, "Is this he who mentions your gods?" Yet they blaspheme at the mention of the Beneficent

37.Hamid S. Aziz: Man is made of haste. I will show you My signs; but do not ask Me to hasten

38.Hamid S. Aziz: And they say, "When will this threat (come to pass), if you tell the truth?"

39.Hamid S. Aziz: If those who disbelieve but knew the time when they will not be able to ward off the Fire from their faces and from their backs, and they will not be helped

40.Hamid S. Aziz: Nay, it shall come on them unawares, and shall dumbfound them, and they shall not be able to repel it, nor shall they be reprieved

41.Hamid S. Aziz: Prophets before you have been mocked at, but that whereat they jested encompassed those who mocked

42.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Who guards you by night and by day from the Beneficent?" Nay, but they turn away from the mention of their Lord

43.Hamid S. Aziz: Have they gods to defend them against Us? These cannot help themselves, nor can they be defended against Us

44.Hamid S. Aziz: Nay, but We have granted enjoyment to these men and to their fathers until the period grew long for them. Do they not see that We come to the land and shorten its borders? Shall they then prevail

45.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "I only warn you by inspiration;" but the deaf hear not the call when they are warned

46.Hamid S. Aziz: But if a breath of the Wrath of your Lord touches them, they will surely say, "O, woe is us! Verily, we were wrong-doers!"

47.Hamid S. Aziz: We will place a just balance on the Day of Resurrection, and no soul shall be wronged in anything. Even though it is the weight of a grain of mustard seed, We will bring it; for We are sufficient as a reckoner

48.Hamid S. Aziz: In the past We did give to Moses and Aaron the Criterion (or Discrimination), and a Light and a Reminder to those who fear (evil)

49.Hamid S. Aziz: Those who fear their Lord in secret (in thought), and who dread the Hour (of Judgment)

50.Hamid S. Aziz: This is a blessed Reminder which We have sent down (or revealed), will you then reject it

51.Hamid S. Aziz: And We gave Abraham of old his Rectitude of conduct (or proper course, as distinct from Faith); for We were aware of him (his faith)

52.Hamid S. Aziz: When he said to his father and to his people, "What are these images to which you pay devotion?"

53.Hamid S. Aziz: Said they, "We found our fathers worshipping them."

54.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "Verily, both you and your fathers have been in obvious error."

55.Hamid S. Aziz: They said, "Do you come to us with the truth, or are you but of those who jest?"

56.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "Nay, but your Lord is Lord of the heavens and the earth, which He originated (created from nothing); and I am of those who testify unto this

57.Hamid S. Aziz: And, by Allah! I have a plan for your idols after you have gone and turned your backs!"

58.Hamid S. Aziz: So he broke them in pieces, all except their largest, that they might have recourse to it

59.Hamid S. Aziz: Said they, "Who has done this to our gods? Surely, he is of the evil-doers!"

60.Hamid S. Aziz: Others said, "We heard a youth mention them, he is called Abraham."

61.Hamid S. Aziz: Said they, "Then bring him before the eyes of the people, that they may bear witness."

62.Hamid S. Aziz: Said they, "Was it you who did this to our gods, O Abraham?"

63.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "Nay, it was this largest of the idols. But ask them, if they can speak."

64.Hamid S. Aziz: Then they turned to themselves and said, "Surely, you are the ones in the wrong."

65.Hamid S. Aziz: Then were they confounded with shame and said, "You knew well that these cannot speak."

66.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "Will you then worship, beside Allah, that which cannot profit you at all, nor harm you

67.Hamid S. Aziz: "Fie upon you, and what you serve beside Allah! Have you then no sense?"

68.Hamid S. Aziz: They cried, "Burn him, and stand by your gods, if you are going to do anything."

69.Hamid S. Aziz: We said, "O fire! Be you cool and a safety for Abraham!"

70.Hamid S. Aziz: They desired to set a snare for him, but We made them the losers

71.Hamid S. Aziz: And We brought him and Lot safely to the land (Aram or Syria) which We have blessed for all nations (or peoples)

72.Hamid S. Aziz: And We bestowed upon him Isaac, and as an additional gift (a grandson), Jacob and each of them We made righteous

73.Hamid S. Aziz: And We made them Leaders to guide men by Our command, and We sent inspiration to them to do good works, and to be steadfast in prayer, and to practice charity; and they were constant in their service of Us alone

74.Hamid S. Aziz: And Lot, to him We gave judgment and knowledge, and We delivered him safely from the community which practiced abominations; truly, they were a people given to evil lewdness

75.Hamid S. Aziz: And We brought him into Our Mercy; verily, he was of the righteous

76.Hamid S. Aziz: And Noah, of old times, when he called We answered him and saved him and his people from the great affliction

77.Hamid S. Aziz: And We helped him against the people who said Our signs were lies; verily, they were a bad people, therefore did We drown them all

78.Hamid S. Aziz: And David and Solomon, when they gave judgment concerning the field, when some people´s sheep had strayed therein at night; and We were witness to their judgment

79.Hamid S. Aziz: And We gave Solomon right understanding of matters (or cases). To each of them We gave judgment and knowledge; and it was by Our power that the hills and the birds celebrate Our praises with David. It was We who did it

80.Hamid S. Aziz: And We taught him the art of making coats of mail for you, to shield you from each other´s violence; are you then grateful

81.Hamid S. Aziz: And to Solomon We subjected the violent wind, to flow tamely at his bidding to the land which We have blessed - for We are aware of all things

82.Hamid S. Aziz: And some devils (evil ones), who dived for him, and did other works beside, it was We who kept guard over them

83.Hamid S. Aziz: And Job, when he cried to his Lord, saying, "Lo! Adversity has touched me, but you are the most Merciful of the merciful ones."

84.Hamid S. Aziz: And We answered him, and removed from him the distress that was upon him; and We restored to him his people, and doubled their number as a mercy from Us, and as a remembrance to those who serve Us

85.Hamid S. Aziz: And (remember) Ishmael, and Idris (Enoch?), and Zul-Kifl (Ezekiel?), all men of constancy and patient

86.Hamid S. Aziz: And We admitted them into Our Mercy; verily, they were among the righteous

87.Hamid S. Aziz: And remember Zun-nun (the man of the Whale, Jonah), when he went away in wrath and thought that We had no power over him; but he cried out in the darkness, "There is no God but Thou, celebrated be Thy praise! Verily, I was of the wrong!"

88.Hamid S. Aziz: And We answered him, and saved him from the distress. Thus do We deliver those who have faith

89.Hamid S. Aziz: And (remember) Zachariah, when he cried unto his Lord, "O Lord! Leave me not without off-spring, though you are the best of inheritors."

90.Hamid S. Aziz: And We answered him, and bestowed upon him Yahya (John); and We made his wife right for him (cured her barrenness). Verily, they used to vie with one another in good works, and they called unto Us with longing and awe, and were humble (or submissive) bef

91.Hamid S. Aziz: And (remember) her who guarded her chastity, and We breathed into her of Our Spirit, and We made her and her son a sign unto the worlds (or all peoples, or all creatures)

92.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, this your religion (or brotherhood) is a single religion (brotherhood); and I am your Lord, so serve Me

93.Hamid S. Aziz: But they cut up their affairs (religion, politics etc. into fragments) amongst themselves, yet they all shall return unto Us

94.Hamid S. Aziz: And he who acts right and he who is a believer (or has faith), there is no denial of his efforts, for, verily, We record it for him

95.Hamid S. Aziz: There is a ban upon any community which We have destroyed that they shall not return

96.Hamid S. Aziz: Until Yagug and Magug (Gog and Magog, Lawless tribes or Lawlessness itself) are let loose (through every barrier), and they hasten out of every mound (rock, nook and cranny)

97.Hamid S. Aziz: And the True Promise draws nigh, and lo! They are staring, wide-eyed are those who disbelieve, saying, "O, woe is us! We were heedless of this, aye, we were wrong-doers!"

98.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, ye, and what you serve beside Allah, shall be the fuel of hell. Thereto shall you go down

99.Hamid S. Aziz: Had these been gods, they would not have come hither, but all shall dwell therein

100.Hamid S. Aziz: For them therein is groaning, and they shall not be heard

101.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, those for whom the Good from Us has gone before, they will be removed far there from

102.Hamid S. Aziz: They shall not hear the slightest sound of Hell, and they will dwell in what their souls desire

103.Hamid S. Aziz: The Great Terror shall not grieve them; but the angels shall greet them, saying, "This is your day, the one which you were promised!"

104.Hamid S. Aziz: The Day when We will roll up the heavens as a recorder rolls up the scroll. As We produced it at its first creation, We shall repeat it - a promise binding upon Us; verily, We shall do it

105.Hamid S. Aziz: And already have We written in the Psalms after the Reminder (the Message of Moses) that "My righteous servants shall inherit the earth."

106.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, in this is a plain statement for a people who serve Me

107.Hamid S. Aziz: We have sent you not, but as a mercy to the worlds

108.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "I am only inspired that your God is one God; will ye, then, surrender unto Him (become Muslims)?"

109.Hamid S. Aziz: But if they turn their backs, then say, "I have proclaimed the message to you all alike, though I know not if what you are promised be near or far."

110.Hamid S. Aziz: "Verily, He knows what is spoken openly, and that which you hide

111.Hamid S. Aziz: "I know not but that this may be a trial for you, and provision for a season."

112.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "O My Lord! Judge you with truth! Our Lord is the Beneficent Whose aid is to be sought against the blasphemies you utter."

1.Hamid S. Aziz: O mankind! Fear your Lord. Verily, the convulsions of the Hour (of Judgment) will be a thing terrible

2.Hamid S. Aziz: On the day you shall see it, every suckling woman shall be scared away from that to which she gave suck; and every pregnant woman shall drop her load unformed; and you shall see men in drunken riot, though not drunk: but dreadful will be the wrath of All

3.Hamid S. Aziz: And yet amongst men are such who wrangles about Allah without knowledge, and follows every rebellious devil

4.Hamid S. Aziz: Against whom it is written down that whoever turns to him for friendship, verily, He will lead him astray, and will guide him towards the penalty of the blaze

5.Hamid S. Aziz: O Mankind! If you are in doubt about the Resurrection, consider that We created you from earth, then from a seed, then from a clot, then from a little lump of flesh, shaped or shapeless, that We may explain to you. And We make what We please to remain in

6.Hamid S. Aziz: That is because Allah, He is the Truth. Lo! He quickens the dead, and lo! He is Able to do all things

7.Hamid S. Aziz: And because the Hour will come; there is no doubt thereof; and because Allah will raise those who are in the graves

8.Hamid S. Aziz: And yet amongst men are those who wrangles about Allah without knowledge, without guidance, and without a Book of Enlightenment

9.Hamid S. Aziz: Turning his neck from the way of Allah; for him is disgrace in this world, and on the Day of Resurrection We will make him taste the doom of burning

10.Hamid S. Aziz: This is for what your two hands have sent before you, and in this Allah is not an oppressor unto His servants

11.Hamid S. Aziz: And amongst men are those who serve Allah wavering on a brink; so that if there befall him good, he is comforted; but if there befall him a trial, he falls away. He loses both this world and the Hereafter - that is an obvious loss

12.Hamid S. Aziz: He calls, besides Allah, on what can neither harm him nor profit him - that is a wide error

13.Hamid S. Aziz: He calls on him whose harm is nearer than his benefit - verily, an evil patron and an evil comrade

14.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, Allah makes those who believe and do aright enter into Gardens beneath which rivers flow; verily, Allah does what He intends

15.Hamid S. Aziz: He who thinks that Allah will not help him (Muhammad) in this world or in the Hereafter, let him stretch a rope to the ceiling (or heaven) and put an end to himself; and then let him see if his plan will remove that which enrages him

16.Hamid S. Aziz: Thus have We sent down Manifest Signs; for, verily, Allah guides whom He will

17.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, those who believe this Revelation, and those who are Jews, and the Sabaeans, and the Christians, and the Magians, and those who join other gods with Allah, verily, Allah will decide between them on the Day of Resurrection; verily, Allah is witnes

18.Hamid S. Aziz: Do you not see that unto Allah bow down in worship (or submit in service and adoration) whoever is in the heavens and whoever is in the earth, and the sun, and the moon, and the stars, and the mountains, and the trees, and the beasts, and many among mank

19.Hamid S. Aziz: These twain are two opponents who dispute about their Lord. But those who disbelieve, garments (or coverings) of fire will be cut out for them, and on their heads boiling water will be poured down

20.Hamid S. Aziz: Whereby that which is in their bellies and their skins shall be scalded

21.Hamid S. Aziz: And for them are hooks of iron

22.Hamid S. Aziz: Whenever they desire to come forth there from through pain, they will be sent back into it: and (it is said unto them) "Taste you the penalty of the burning!"

23.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, Allah will make those who believe and do right enter into Gardens beneath which rivers flow; they shall be bedecked therein with bracelets of gold and with pearls, and their garments therein shall be of silk

24.Hamid S. Aziz: For they are guided to goodly speech, and they shall be guided to the path of Him who is worthy of all praise (the All-laudable or Glorious One)

25.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, those who disbelieve and bar men from Allah´s path and from the Sacred Place of Worship, which We have appointed for all mankind alike, the dweller therein and the stranger - and he who desires therein profanity or injustice, We will make h

26.Hamid S. Aziz: And when We prepared the site (in Mecca) for Abraham as the place of the Holy House, saying, "Associate naught with Me, but cleanse My House for those who make the rounds, for those who stand to pray, for those who bow, and for those too who prostra

27.Hamid S. Aziz: "And proclaim amongst men the Pilgrimage; they will come to you on foot and on every kind of camel, lean from journeys through distant mountain and deep ravines

28.Hamid S. Aziz: That they may witness things of benefit for them, and that they may mention the name of Allah for (or on) appointed days over the cattle Allah has provided them with (for sacrifice), then eat thereof and feed the distressed ones in want

29.Hamid S. Aziz: Then let them make an end of their self-neglect, and let them pay their vows and go around the ancient House

30.Hamid S. Aziz: That do. And whoever magnifies the sacred things of Allah it is better for him with his Lord. Cattle are lawful for you, except that which has been recited to you. So shun the abomination of idols, and shun lying speech

31.Hamid S. Aziz: Turning unto Allah only, not associating aught with Him; for he who associates aught with Allah, it is as though he had fallen from heaven, and the birds snatch him up, or the wind blows him away into a far distant place

32.Hamid S. Aziz: That is his State. And he who honours the Symbols of Allah (and sacrificial animals), they come (or ought to come) from the piety of heart

33.Hamid S. Aziz: Therein have you benefits for an appointed term. In the end the place for sacrificing them is near the Ancient House (Mina near the Kaaba)

34.Hamid S. Aziz: To every nation have We appointed rites, that they may mention the name of Allah over the sustenance He has provided them from animals fit for food; and your God is one God; to Him then surrender, and give glad tidings to the humble

35.Hamid S. Aziz: To those whose heart, when Allah is mentioned, are filled with awe, and to those who endure patiently all that befalls them, and to those who are steadfast in prayer and who spend of what We have given them

36.Hamid S. Aziz: The camels! We have appointed them for you as one of the symbols of Allah. Therein have you much good; so mention the name of Allah over them as they stand in a row, and when they are down (dead after slaughter) eat of them, and feed the easily contented

37.Hamid S. Aziz: Their meat will never reach to Allah, nor yet their blood, but the piety from you will reach Him. Thus hath He subjected them to you that you may magnify Allah for guiding you: and give you glad tidings to those who do right

38.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, Allah will defend those who are true; verily, Allah loves not any treacherous ingrate (or traitor and ingrate)

39.Hamid S. Aziz: Permission is given to those who fight because they have been wronged, and, indeed, Allah has power to give them victory

40.Hamid S. Aziz: Those who have been driven from their homes unjustly only because they said, "Our Lord is Allah;" - for were it not for Allah repelling some men by means of others, cloisters and churches and synagogues and mosques, wherein the name of Allah is

41.Hamid S. Aziz: Those who, if We establish them in the land, are steadfast in prayer, and give regular charity, and bid what is right, and forbid what is wrong - with Allah rests the end (final outcome) of affairs

42.Hamid S. Aziz: But if they call you liar, even so did the people of Noah, and the tribes of A´ad and Thamud, they denied (My messengers) before you

43.Hamid S. Aziz: And the people of Abraham, and the people of Lot

44.Hamid S. Aziz: And the dweller of Midian; and Moses was called a liar too: but I indulged the disbelievers a long while, and then I seized them, and how terrible was My rejection

45.Hamid S. Aziz: And how many a city (community) have We destroyed while it was guilty (did wrong), and it tumbled down on its roof, lying ruined to this day, and how many a deserted well and lofty palace

46.Hamid S. Aziz: Have they not travelled through the land? And have they not heart wherewith to feel (understand), and ears wherewith to hear? For, indeed, it is not their eyes that are blind, but it is the hearts which are within their breasts that grow blind

47.Hamid S. Aziz: They will bid you to hasten on the torment, but Allah will never fail in his promise; for, verily, a day with your Lord is as a thousand years of what you number

48.Hamid S. Aziz: And to how many a city have I given full range while it yet did wrong! Then I seized it, and unto Me was the return

49.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "O mankind! I am naught but a plain Warner to you

50.Hamid S. Aziz: "And to those who believe and do right, for them is forgiveness and a generous provision

51.Hamid S. Aziz: But those who strive to discredit Our signs, they are rightful owners of the Fire."

52.Hamid S. Aziz: We have not sent before you any messenger or prophet, but that when he formed a desire (or recited the message), Satan introduced not something (evil or vain) into it; but Allah annuls what Satan proposes; then does Allah confirm (establish) His Signs (r

53.Hamid S. Aziz: That He may make that which Satan introduces a trial unto those in whose heart is a disease, and those whose heart are hardened - verily, the wrongdoers are in a wide schism

54.Hamid S. Aziz: And that those who have been given knowledge may know that it is the truth from your Lord, and may believe therein, and that their heart may surrender humbly unto Him. Verily, Allah surely will guide those who believe into the Straight Way

55.Hamid S. Aziz: But those who disbelieve will not cease to be in doubt thereof until the Hour (of Judgment) comes on them suddenly, or there comes on them the torment of the Day of Disaster

56.Hamid S. Aziz: The dominion (or sovereignty) on that day shall be Allah´s, He shall judge between them; and those who believe and do aright shall be in Gardens of Delight

57.Hamid S. Aziz: But those who disbelieve and deny Our revelation, for them is a shameful doom

58.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who flee their homes in the cause of Allah, and then are slain or die, Allah will surely provide them with a goodly provision; for, verily, Allah is the best of providers

59.Hamid S. Aziz: Assuredly, He shall make them enter by an entrance that they will love. For, verily, Allah is Knower, Most-forbearing

60.Hamid S. Aziz: That is so. Whoever retaliates with the like of what He has been made to suffer, and shall then be wronged again, Allah shall surely succour him; verily, Allah blots out sins and is constantly Forgiving

61.Hamid S. Aziz: That is because Allah causes the night to pass into day, and causes the day to pass into night, and because Allah is Hearer, Seer

62.Hamid S. Aziz: That is because Allah, He is the Truth (or Reality), and that whereon they call instead of Him is the False, and because Allah, He is the High, the Great

63.Hamid S. Aziz: See you not how Allah sends down water from the sky, and on the morrow the earth is green? Verily, Allah is Subtile, Aware

64.Hamid S. Aziz: Unto Him belongs all that is in the heavens and that is in the earth; verily, Allah is the Absolute, the Owner of all Praise

65.Hamid S. Aziz: Have you not seen that Allah has subjected for you all that is in the earth, and the ship that runs on in the sea at His bidding, and He holds back the sky from falling on the earth save at His bidding? Verily, Allah to mankind is Gracious, Merciful

66.Hamid S. Aziz: He it is who quickens you, then makes you die, then will He quicken you again; verily, man is indeed ungrateful

67.Hamid S. Aziz: Unto every nation have We given sacred rites which they are to perform; so let them not then dispute about the matter, but summon you unto your Lord; verily, you (Muhammad) indeed follow right guidance

68.Hamid S. Aziz: But if they wrangle with you, say, "Allah best knows what you do

69.Hamid S. Aziz: "Allah shall judge between you on the Day of Resurrection concerning that wherein you differ

70.Hamid S. Aziz: "Did you not know that Allah knows what is in the heavens and the earth? Verily, it is in a Record; verily, it is easy for Allah."

71.Hamid S. Aziz: And they serve beside Allah that for which He has sent down (revealed) no warrant, and that whereof they have no knowledge. For wrongdoers there is no helper

72.Hamid S. Aziz: When Our clear revelations are read to them, you may recognize disdain in the faces of those who disbelieve; they well-nigh attack those who recite Our revelations to them. Say, "Shall I inform you of something worse than that for you? The Fire whic

73.Hamid S. Aziz: O mankind! A similitude is coined for you, so pay heed to it. Verily, those on whom you call beside Allah could never create a fly even if they combine together to do it. And if the fly should snatch something from them they could not rescue it from it.

74.Hamid S. Aziz: They do not value Allah at His true value; verily, Allah is Powerful, Mighty

75.Hamid S. Aziz: Allah chooses from the angels messengers, and also from mankind; verily, Allah is Hearer and Seer

76.Hamid S. Aziz: He knows what is before them and what is behind them; and unto Allah all things return

77.Hamid S. Aziz: O you who believe! Bow down and prostrate yourselves (in obeisance), and serve your Lord, and do good, that per chance (or possibly) you may prosper

78.Hamid S. Aziz: And strive in the cause of Allah, with the effort which is His due. He has chosen you, and has not laid upon you any hardship (or hindrance) in religion - the faith of your father Abraham. He has named you Muslims of old and in this (Scripture), that the

1.Hamid S. Aziz: Successful indeed are the believers (or the believers will eventually win

2.Hamid S. Aziz: Who in their prayers are humble

3.Hamid S. Aziz: And who shun vain talk

4.Hamid S. Aziz: And who are constantly active in charitable works

5.Hamid S. Aziz: And who abstain from sexual immodesty (or guard their modesty or chastity or sexual purity)

6.Hamid S. Aziz: Except for with those joined with them in marriage or the captive whom their right hand possesses, for then, verily, they are free from blame

7.Hamid S. Aziz: But whoever craves aught beyond that, they are the transgressor

8.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who faithfully observe their trusts and covenants

9.Hamid S. Aziz: And who guard well (pay heed to) their prayers

10.Hamid S. Aziz: These will be the heirs

11.Hamid S. Aziz: Who shall inherit Paradise; they shall dwell therein

12.Hamid S. Aziz: We have created man from an extract of clay

13.Hamid S. Aziz: Then We made him a drop (sperm) in a safe depository (the womb)

14.Hamid S. Aziz: Then We made the drop into a clot, and We made the clot into a lump (foetus); then We made the lump into bone, and We clothed the bone with flesh; then We produced from it another creature. Blessed be Allah, the best of Creators

15.Hamid S. Aziz: Then shall you after that surely die

16.Hamid S. Aziz: Then, lo! On the Day of Resurrection shall you surely be raised

17.Hamid S. Aziz: And We have created above you seven paths; and We are never heedless of creation

18.Hamid S. Aziz: And We send down from the heaven water by measure, and We make it rest in the earth; but, verily, We are able to withdraw it

19.Hamid S. Aziz: Then We produce for you thereby gardens of date-palms and grapes wherein you have much fruits, and whereof you eat

20.Hamid S. Aziz: And a tree growing out of Mount Sinai (Olives) which produces oil, and a relish for eaters

21.Hamid S. Aziz: And, verily, you have a lesson in the cattle; We give you to drink of what is in their bodies; and you have therein many uses, and of them you eat

22.Hamid S. Aziz: And on them and on ships you are carried

23.Hamid S. Aziz: We sent Noah unto his people, and he said, "O my people! Serve Allah, you have no God but Him; do you then not fear (evil)?"

24.Hamid S. Aziz: Said the chiefs of those who disbelieved among his people, "This is nothing but a mortal like yourselves who wishes to make himself superior to you. Had Allah pleased He could surely have sent angels. We have not heard of this from our forefathers

25.Hamid S. Aziz: "He is nothing but a man possessed; so watch him for a while."

26.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "My Lord! Help me, for they deny me."

27.Hamid S. Aziz: And We inspired him, saying "Make the ark under Our eyes and Our inspiration; and when the oven (of Allah´s wrath) boils over (or the fountains or springs of the earth are about to gush forth), conduct into it of every kind two spouses, and yo

28.Hamid S. Aziz: "But when you are settled, you and those with you in the ark, say, "Praise belongs to Allah, Who saved us from the unjust people."

29.Hamid S. Aziz: "And say, ´My Lord! Cause me to land on a blessed landing place, for you are the best of all who bring to land.´"

30.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, in this is a sign, and, verily, We are ever trying them (mankind)

31.Hamid S. Aziz: Then We raised up after them another generation

32.Hamid S. Aziz: And We sent amongst them a messenger of their own (or from among them), saying, "Serve Allah, you have no God but He; will you then not fear (evil)?"

33.Hamid S. Aziz: Said the chiefs of the people who disbelieved, and denied the meeting in the Hereafter, and to whom We gave enjoyment in the life of this world, "This is only a mortal like yourselves, who eats of what you eat, and drinks of what you drink

34.Hamid S. Aziz: "If you obey a mortal like yourselves, verily, you will then be surely losers

35.Hamid S. Aziz: "Does he promise you that when you are dead, and have become dust and bones, that then you will be brought forth

36.Hamid S. Aziz: "Be gone, be gone, with that which you are promised (or it is far-fetched)

37.Hamid S. Aziz: "There is only our life in this world. We die and we live, and we shall not be raised again

38.Hamid S. Aziz: "He is only a man who invents a lie about Allah. And we believe him not."

39.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "My Lord! Help me, for they deny me."

40.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "Within a little while they will surely be sorry!"

41.Hamid S. Aziz: Then the blast seized them rightfully; and We made them as rubbish borne by a torrent (of Time); so, away with the wrong-doing people

42.Hamid S. Aziz: Then after them We brought forth other generations

43.Hamid S. Aziz: No nation (or people) can hasten its appointed term, nor delay it

44.Hamid S. Aziz: Then We sent Our messengers one after another. Whenever its messenger came unto any nation they denied him; so We caused them to follow one another (to disaster); and We made them bywords. Away then with a people who believe not

45.Hamid S. Aziz: Then We sent Moses and his brother Aaron with Our signs, and with plain authorit

46.Hamid S. Aziz: To Pharaoh and his chiefs, but they were inflated with pride, and were a despotic people

47.Hamid S. Aziz: And they said, "Shall we believe two mortals like ourselves, and whose people are servile unto us?"

48.Hamid S. Aziz: So they accused them of lying, and became of those who perished

49.Hamid S. Aziz: And We verily gave Moses the Book, that per chance (or possibly) they might be guided

50.Hamid S. Aziz: And We made the son of Mary and his mother a sign; and We gave them both shelter on high, a place of security and springs

51.Hamid S. Aziz: O you messengers! Eat of the good things and do right; verily, I am aware of what you do

52.Hamid S. Aziz: And, verily, this your religion (or brotherhood) is one religion (or brotherhood), and I am your Lord; so keep your duty unto Me

53.Hamid S. Aziz: But they (mankind) have broken their religion (or affair) between them into sects, each sect rejoicing in its own tenets

54.Hamid S. Aziz: So leave them in their confused error (or ignorance) for a time

55.Hamid S. Aziz: Think they that in the wealth and children, wherewith We provide the

56.Hamid S. Aziz: We hasten unto them with good things? Nay, but they perceive not

57.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, those who walk in awe of their Lord

58.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who believe in the revelations of their Lord

59.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who ascribe not partners unto their Lor

60.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who give what they give with heart afraid because they are about to return unto their Lord

61.Hamid S. Aziz: These race to good things, and they shall be the first in the race

62.Hamid S. Aziz: But We will not oblige a soul beyond its capacity; for with us is a Record that utters the truth, and they shall not be wronged

63.Hamid S. Aziz: Nay, their heart are in ignorance of this, and they do deeds beside this which they continue to do

64.Hamid S. Aziz: Until, when We catch the affluent ones amongst them with the punishment, then lo! They cry in supplication

65.Hamid S. Aziz: Supplicate not this day! Assuredly, you will not be helped by (or against) Us

66.Hamid S. Aziz: My revelations were recited to you, but you turned back upon your heels

67.Hamid S. Aziz: In arrogant scorn thereof, raving vain nonsensical tales by night

68.Hamid S. Aziz: Have they not pondered over the words, or has something new come unto them which came not to their forefathers

69.Hamid S. Aziz: Or know they not their messenger that they thus deny him

70.Hamid S. Aziz: Or do they say, "He is possessed"? Nay, but he came to them with the Truth, and most of them are haters of Truth

71.Hamid S. Aziz: But if the truth were to conform to their desires, verily, the heavens and the earth and whoever is therein would be corrupted. Nay, We brought them their Reminder (The Quran), but from their Reminder they now turn away

72.Hamid S. Aziz: Or do you ask them for a tribute? But the bounty of your Lord is better, for He is the best of those who provide

73.Hamid S. Aziz: And, verily, you do call them to the Straight Way

74.Hamid S. Aziz: But, verily, those who believe not in the Hereafter, they are indeed astray from that Way
