75.Hamid S. Aziz: But if We had mercy on them, and relieved their distress, they still would persist in their rebellion, blindly wandering on

76.Hamid S. Aziz: And We caught them with the punishment, but they humble not themselves before their Lord, nor do they pray

77.Hamid S. Aziz: Until, when We open for them the gate of extreme torment, then lo! They are plunged into despair

78.Hamid S. Aziz: He it is who produced for you hearing and sight, and heart (or feelings, understanding, mind). Little thanks give you

79.Hamid S. Aziz: And He it is Who has sown you broadcast in the earth, and unto Him shall you be gathered

80.Hamid S. Aziz: And He it is Who gives you life and death; and His is the alternation of the night and the day; have you then no sense

81.Hamid S. Aziz: Nay, but they say the like of that which those of yore did say

82.Hamid S. Aziz: They said, "What! When we have become earth and bones, are we then going to be raised again

83.Hamid S. Aziz: "We were already promised this, we and our forefathers. Lo! this is naught but old folks´ tales!"

84.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Whose is the earth and those who are therein, if you have knowledge?"

85.Hamid S. Aziz: They will say, "Allah´s." Say, "Will you then not remember?"

86.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Who is Lord of the seven heavens, and Lord of the Mighty Throne?"

87.Hamid S. Aziz: They will say, "Allah." Say, "Will you then not keep your duty unto Him?"

88.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "In whose hand is the dominion over all things; He succours (or protects) but is not succoured (or needs no protection or against whom there is no protection), if you did but know?"

89.Hamid S. Aziz: They will say, "Allah´s". Say, "How then can you be so deluded?"

90.Hamid S. Aziz: Nay, We have brought them the Truth, but, verily, they are Liars

91.Hamid S. Aziz: Allah never took a son, nor was there ever any God with Him; else would each God have assuredly gone off with (or championed, controlled) that which he had created, and some would assuredly have exalted themselves over (or overcome) others. Glorified be

92.Hamid S. Aziz: Knower of the invisible and the visible, exalted be He above what they associate with Him

93.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "My Lord! if you should show me what they are promised

94.Hamid S. Aziz: My Lord! Then place me not amongst the wrong-doing people."

95.Hamid S. Aziz: And verily We are able to show you that which We have promised them

96.Hamid S. Aziz: Repel evil by that which is best. We are best Aware of that which they allege

97.Hamid S. Aziz: And say, "My Lord! I seek refuge in Thee from the suggestions of the devils

98.Hamid S. Aziz: And I seek refuge in Thee from their presence!"

99.Hamid S. Aziz: Until when death comes to any one of them he says, "My Lord! Send me back

100.Hamid S. Aziz: That I may do right in that which I have left behind." Nay! It is but a mere word he speaks; behind them is a barrier until the Day they shall be raised

101.Hamid S. Aziz: And when the trumpet shall be blown, and there shall be no kinship between them on that day, nor will they ask about each other then

102.Hamid S. Aziz: And those whose scales are heavy (with good deeds), they are the successful

103.Hamid S. Aziz: But those whose scales are light, these are they who lose their souls, in hell will they abide

104.Hamid S. Aziz: The fire shall scorch their faces, and they shall curl their lips (in gloom) therein

105.Hamid S. Aziz: (It will be said) "Were not My revelations recited to you? And did you not treat them as falsehoods?"

106.Hamid S. Aziz: They will say, "Our Lord our misfortune overcame us, and we became a people astray

107.Hamid S. Aziz: "Our Lord! Take us out of this, and if we return to evil, then shall we be unjust indeed."

108.Hamid S. Aziz: He will say, "Be gone into it, and speak you not to Me."

109.Hamid S. Aziz: "Verily, there was a sect of My servants who used to pray, "Our Lord! We believe, so forgive us, and have mercy upon us, for Thou art the best of the merciful ones."

110.Hamid S. Aziz: "But you took them for a jest (treated them with ridicule) until you forgot My reminder and did laugh at them

111.Hamid S. Aziz: "Verily, I have rewarded them this day that they were steadfast; verily, they are indeed triumphant, blissful now

112.Hamid S. Aziz: He will say, "How long a number of years did you tarry on earth?"

113.Hamid S. Aziz: They will say, "We tarried but a day or part of a day, but ask those who keep count."

114.Hamid S. Aziz: He will say, "You have only tarried a little, if you but knew

115.Hamid S. Aziz: "Did you then think that We created you for jest (or sport, without purpose), and that you would not be returned to Us?"

116.Hamid S. Aziz: But exalted be Allah, the True King; there is no God but He, the Lord of the Noble Throne (or Throne of Honour)

117.Hamid S. Aziz: He who calls unto any other God along with Allah has no proof thereof; verily, his account is only with his Lord; verily, the disbelievers shall not be successful

118.Hamid S. Aziz: And say, "Lord, Forgive and have mercy, for you are the best of the merciful ones!"

1.Hamid S. Aziz: This is a chapter which We have revealed and ordained. In it We have revealed manifest signs in order that you may take heed

2.Hamid S. Aziz: The man and the woman guilty of adultery (fornication, whoring), scourge each of them with a hundred stripes, and let not compassion for them withhold you from obedience to Allah, if you believe in Allah and the Last Day; and let a party of the believers

3.Hamid S. Aziz: Let no adulterer marry any but an adulteress or an idolatress (or unbeliever), nor let any but such a man or an idolater (or unbeliever) marry such a woman. All this is forbidden to believers

4.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who launch a charge (accusations, imputations) on chaste women, but bring not four witnesses, scourge them with eighty stripes, and never afterwards accept their testimony, for these are, indeed, evil-doers (workers of abomination)

5.Hamid S. Aziz: Except such as repent after that and make amends, for, verily, Allah is Forgiving and Merciful

6.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who cast charges (accusations, imputations) against their wives and have no witnesses except themselves, then the testimony of one of them shall be to testify four times that, by Allah, he is of those who speak the truth

7.Hamid S. Aziz: And a fifth, to invoke the curse of Allah on him if he be of those who lie

8.Hamid S. Aziz: And it shall avert the punishment from her if she bears testimony four times that, by Allah, he is of those who lie

9.Hamid S. Aziz: And the fifth that the wrath of Allah shall be on her if he be of those who speak the truth

10.Hamid S. Aziz: And were it not for the grace of Allah upon you and His mercy unto you, and that Allah is Relenting, Wise (he would have been ruined)

11.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, those who spread the slander are a gang among you. Deem it not as an evil for you. Nay, it is good for you. Every man of them shall have what he has earned of sin; and he among them who had the greater share (took the lead), for him is an awful d

12.Hamid S. Aziz: Why did not, when you heard it, the believers, men and women, think good of their own folk, and say, "This is an obvious lie?"

13.Hamid S. Aziz: Why did they not bring four witnesses to it? But since they did not bring witnesses, then verily they stand forth as liars in the sight of Allah

14.Hamid S. Aziz: And but for the grace of Allah upon you, and His mercy in this world and the Hereafter, an awful doom would have seized you, for that which you glibly and hastily spread abroad

15.Hamid S. Aziz: Behold, you received it with your tongues, and spoke with your mouths what you had no knowledge of, and deemed it a light thing, while it was most grave in the sight of Allah

16.Hamid S. Aziz: And why, when you heard it, did you not say, "It is not for us to speak of this? Glory be to Thee, O Allah, this is an awful slander!"

17.Hamid S. Aziz: Allah admonishes you that you return not to the like of it ever, if you be believers

18.Hamid S. Aziz: And He expounds to you His revelations, for Allah is Knower, Wise

19.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, those who love to see slander (or scandal) broadcast amongst the believers, for them is grievous woe in this world and the Hereafter; Allah knows, but you know not

20.Hamid S. Aziz: And but for the grace of Allah upon you, and His mercy, and that Allah is kind and compassionate...

21.Hamid S. Aziz: O you who believe! Follow not the footsteps of Satan, for he who follows the footsteps of Satan, verily, he bids you filth (the shameful) and wrong. Had it not been for the grace of Allah upon you and His mercy unto you, not one of you would have grown p

22.Hamid S. Aziz: And let not those amongst you who have plenty (dignity and ease and ample means) swear that they will not give aught to their kinsman and the needy and those who are fugitives from their homes in the cause of Allah, but let them forgive and show indulgen

23.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, those who slander (cast aspersions) on virtuous (or chaste) women who have been careless (indiscreet) but believing, shall be cursed in this world and the Hereafter; theirs will be an awful doo

24.Hamid S. Aziz: On the day when their tongues and hands and feet shall testify against them as to what they used to do

25.Hamid S. Aziz: On that day Allah will pay them their just due; and they shall know that Allah, He is the Manifest Truth

26.Hamid S. Aziz: Vile (impure) women are for vile (impure) men, and vile men for vile women. Good women are for good men, and good men for good women, such are innocent of what people they say; for them is forgiveness and a noble provision

27.Hamid S. Aziz: O you who believe! Enter not into houses which are not your own, until you have asked permission (announced your presence) and saluted (invoked peace on) the people thereof. That is better for you; per chance (or possibly) you may be mindful

28.Hamid S. Aziz: And if you find no one therein, then enter not until permission is given you, and if it be said unto you, "Go away." then go away, for it is purer for you; Allah knows what you do

29.Hamid S. Aziz: It is no crime against you that you enter uninhabited houses, wherein is comfort for you; but Allah knows what you proclaim and what you hide

30.Hamid S. Aziz: Say to the believing men that they cast down their looks and guard their modesty; that is purer for them; verily, Allah is well aware of what they do

31.Hamid S. Aziz: And say to the believing women that they cast down their looks and guard their modesty, and display not their ornaments, except those which are obvious from the outside; and let them pull their veils over their bosoms and not display their ornaments (and beauty) save to their husbands and fathers, or the fathers of their husbands, or their sons, or the sons of their husbands, or their brothers, or their brothers´ sons, or their sisters´ sons, or their women, or what their right hands possess (slaves), or their male attendants who are incapable (eunuchs or old men), or to children who do not note women´s nakedness; and that they beat not with their feet to draw attention to their hidden ornaments; but turn you all to Allah, O you believers, in order that you may succeed (or prosper or attain bliss)

32.Hamid S. Aziz: And marry the single amongst you, and the righteous among your slaves and your handmaidens. If they be poor, Allah will enrich them of His grace, for Allah encompasses all and knows all

33.Hamid S. Aziz: And let those who cannot find a match keep chaste until Allah gives them means from His grace. And if any of your slaves asks for a Deed in writing (an agreement to purchase their freedom), write it for them if you know any good in them; yea, give them s

34.Hamid S. Aziz: Now have We sent down to you clear revelations, and the example of those who have passed away before you, and as an admonition to those who fear (avoid) evil

35.Hamid S. Aziz: Allah is the light of the heavens and the earth; The similitude of His light is as a niche in which is a lamp, and the lamp is in a glass, the glass is as though it were a brilliant star; it is lit from a blessed tree, an olive neither of the east nor of

36.Hamid S. Aziz: (This lamp is found, or the light is lit) In the houses which Allah has permitted to be exalted and that His name shall be remembered (or mentioned) therein. His praises are celebrated therein mornings and evenings

37.Hamid S. Aziz: By men whom neither merchandise nor selling (commerce) divert from the remembrance of Allah and steadfastness in prayer and charity, who are in awe of the day when heart and eyes shall be transformed

38.Hamid S. Aziz: That Allah may reward them for the best of that which they have done, and give them increase of His bounty; for Allah gives blessings without stint to whom He will

39.Hamid S. Aziz: But those who disbelieve, their works are like the mirage in a desert, the thirsty suppose it to be water till when he comes to it he finds nothing, but he finds, instead, Allah is with him; and He will pay him his account, for Allah is quick to take acc

40.Hamid S. Aziz: Or like darkness on a deep sea. There covers it a wave above which is another wave, above which is a cloud, layers of darkness upon darkness; when he puts out his hand he can scarcely see it; for him to whom Allah has given no light, he has no light

41.Hamid S. Aziz: Have you not seen that Allah, He it is whom praise all who are in the heavens and the earth, and the birds in their flight? Each one knows its worship and its praise, and Allah is aware of what they do

42.Hamid S. Aziz: And unto Allah belongs the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth, and unto Allah is the journeying

43.Hamid S. Aziz: Have you not seen how Allah drives the clouds gently, and then gathers them together, then heaps them up (or layers them)? Then you may see the rain coming forth from their midst; and He sends down from the sky mountainous masses wherein is hail; He smit

44.Hamid S. Aziz: Allah alternates the night and the day. Verily, in all these things is a lesson to those endowed with vision

45.Hamid S. Aziz: And Allah created every beast from water, and of them are some that creep upon their bellies, and some that walk upon two legs, and some walk upon four. Allah creates what He wills; verily, Allah has power over all things

46.Hamid S. Aziz: We have, indeed, sent down revelations which make things (hidden) manifest, and Allah guides whom He pleases unto the Straight Way

47.Hamid S. Aziz: They say, "We believe in Allah and in the Messenger, and we obey." But after that some of them turn their backs; they are not really believers

48.Hamid S. Aziz: And when they appeal to Allah and His Messenger to judge between them, lo! A section of them is averse

49.Hamid S. Aziz: But had the right been on their side they would have come unto Him willingly enough

50.Hamid S. Aziz: Is there in their heart a disease, or do they doubt, or do they fear lest Allah and His Messenger should deal unjustly by them?- Nay, it is they who do wrong (or are unjust)

51.Hamid S. Aziz: The speech of the believers, when they appeal unto Allah and His Messenger to judge between them, is only to say, "We hear and we obey;" and such are the successful

52.Hamid S. Aziz: He who obeys Allah and His Messenger and fears Allah and keeps his duty to Him, such indeed are the victorious

53.Hamid S. Aziz: They swear by Allah with their most solemn oath that had you ordered them they would surely go forth. Say, "Swear not; obedience is more reasonable; verily, Allah is Informed of what you do."

54.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Obey Allah and obey the Messenger; but if you turn away then it is for him to do only that wherewith he has been charged, and for you to do only that wherewith you have been charged. If you obey him, you are rightly guided. But the Messenger h

55.Hamid S. Aziz: Allah promises those of you who believe and do right that He will give them the succession (or make them inheritors to the present rulers), in the earth even as He gave the succession to those before them; and that He will surely establish for them their

56.Hamid S. Aziz: Establish regular worship and regularly pay the Zakah (the poor-tax) and obey the Messenger, in order that you may obtain mercy

57.Hamid S. Aziz: Think not that those who disbelieve can frustrate (the plan of Allah) on earth; their resort is the Fire, and it is indeed an ill destination

58.Hamid S. Aziz: O you who believe! Let those whom your right hands possess (slaves), and the children amongst you who have not reached puberty, ask leave of you on three occasions (before coming into your presence) - before the prayer of dawn, and when you put off your

59.Hamid S. Aziz: And when your children reach puberty let them ask leave as those before them asked leave. Thus does Allah explain to you His revelations, for Allah is Knower, Wise

60.Hamid S. Aziz: And women past childbearing, who have no hope of marriage, it is no crime for them if they discard their outer garments in such a way as not to display their adornments. But to refrain is better for them, for Allah is Hearer, Knower

61.Hamid S. Aziz: There is no blame upon the blind, nor blame upon the lame, nor blame upon the sick nor on yourselves if you eat from your houses, or the houses of your fathers, or the houses of your mothers, or the houses of your brothers, or the houses of your sisters,

62.Hamid S. Aziz: Only those are believers who believe in Allah and His Messenger, and when they are with him (the Messenger) upon some common business, go not away until they have asked leave of him. Verily, those who ask your leave they it is who believe in Allah and Hi

63.Hamid S. Aziz: Make not the calling (or summons) of the Messenger among you like your calling (or summons) one to the other. Allah knows those of you who steal away, hiding themselves. And let those who conspire to evade his orders beware lest grief or painful punishme

64.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, to Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and the earth. He knows their condition, and the Day when they shall be returned unto Him so that He may inform them of what they did. Allah is Knower of all things

1.Hamid S. Aziz: Blessed is He Who has revealed unto His servants the Discrimination (or Criterion) that it may be an admonition to all peoples

2.Hamid S. Aziz: He unto Whom belongs the sovereignty of the heavens and the earth, He has chosen no son nor has He any partner in the sovereignty. He has created everything, and then given it its measure (proportions)

3.Hamid S. Aziz: Yet they take beside Him other gods who create not aught, but are themselves created, and cannot control harm or profit for themselves, and can control neither death, nor life, nor resurrection

4.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who disbelieve say, "This is nothing but a lie which he has invented, and another people hath helped him with it;" But, in truth, it is they who have wrought an injustice and a falsehood

5.Hamid S. Aziz: And they say, "Old folks´ tales, which he has written down while they are dictated to him morning and evening."

6.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "He Who knows the secret of the heavens and the earth, He has revealed it; verily, He is ever Forgiving, Merciful!"

7.Hamid S. Aziz: And they say, "What ails this messenger that he eats food and walks in the markets? Why is not an angel sent down unto him, to be a Warner with him...

8.Hamid S. Aziz: Or a treasure thrown down unto him, or why has he not a garden to eat from....?" And the unjust say, "You  only follow a man bewitched (or obsessed)."

9.Hamid S. Aziz: See how they coin similitudes for you, so that they are all astray and cannot find a way

10.Hamid S. Aziz: Blessed is He Who, if He will, can make for you better than all that - Gardens beneath which rivers flow - and can make for you castles (mansions, palaces)

11.Hamid S. Aziz: Nay, but they deny the coming of the Hour, and for those who deny the Hour We have prepared a blaze

12.Hamid S. Aziz: When it sees them from a far place, they shall hear its raging and roaring

13.Hamid S. Aziz: And when they are thrown into a narrow place thereof, chained together, they shall pray for destruction there

14.Hamid S. Aziz: Pray not that day for one destruction, but pray for many destructions

15.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Is that better or the Garden of Eternity (Immortality) which is promised unto those who fear (ward off evil), which is ever a reward and a goal

16.Hamid S. Aziz: Therein abiding, they shall have all that they desire. It is for your Lord a promise that must be fulfiled

17.Hamid S. Aziz: And on the day when He will gather them and that which they served beside Allah, He will say, "Was it you who misled these my servants or did they themselves wander from the way?"

18.Hamid S. Aziz: They will say, "Be you glorified! It was not befitting for us to take any patrons besides Thee; but Thou didst give them and their fathers ease until they forgot the Reminder and became a lost people!"

19.Hamid S. Aziz: And thus have they proved you liars for what you say, and you cannot avert or obtain help. And he among you who does wrong, We will make him taste great torment

20.Hamid S. Aziz: We have not sent before you any messengers, but lo! They ate food and walked in the markets; but We have made some of you a test for others: will you be steadfast? your Lord is ever Seer

21.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who look not for a meeting with Us say, "Why are angels not sent down to us, or we do not see our Lord?" Assuredly they have an arrogant conceit of themselves and excessive is their insolence

22.Hamid S. Aziz: On the day when they behold the angels, there will be no good tidings for the guilty; and the angels will say, "There is a forbidden barrier for you."

23.Hamid S. Aziz: And We will turn on to the works which they have done, and make them like dust scattered

24.Hamid S. Aziz: The companions of the Garden on that day shall be in a better abiding-place and a better noonday rest

25.Hamid S. Aziz: The day the heavens shall be cleft asunder with the clouds, and the angels shall be sent down, descending in ranks

26.Hamid S. Aziz: The true kingdom (sovereignty, dominion) on that day shall belong to the Beneficent, and it shall be a hard day for the disbelievers

27.Hamid S. Aziz: And the day when the wrongdoers shall bite his hands and say, "O, would that I had chosen the way with the Messenger

28.Hamid S. Aziz: "O, woe is me! Would that I had not taken such a one for a friend

29.Hamid S. Aziz: "He verily led me astray from the Reminder after it had reached me. Satan is ever a deserter of men."

30.Hamid S. Aziz: And the Messenger says, "My Lord! Verily, my own people have made this Quran of no account."

31.Hamid S. Aziz: Thus have We made for every prophet an opponent from among the guilty; but your Lord is sufficient as good guide and helper

32.Hamid S. Aziz: Those who disbelieve said, "Why is not the Quran sent down to him all at once (in one piece)?" It is revealed as it is so that We may strengthen your heart therewith, and We have rehearsed it to you gradually, in well-arranged stages

33.Hamid S. Aziz: And they bring you no similitude but We reveal the truth and the best interpretation thereof (or a better argument)

34.Hamid S. Aziz: They who shall be gathered upon their faces into hell, such are worse in plight and further from the path

35.Hamid S. Aziz: And We did give to Moses the Book, and placed with him his brother, Aaron, as a minister (or Priest)

36.Hamid S. Aziz: And We said, "Go you together to the people who have denied Our revelations. Then We destroyed them with utter destruction."

37.Hamid S. Aziz: And the people of Noah, when they denied the messenger, We drowned them, and made them a sign for mankind. We prepared for the wrongdoers a grievous woe

38.Hamid S. Aziz: And (the tribes of) A´ad and Thamud and the people of Ar´Rass, and many generations between them

39.Hamid S. Aziz: For each of them We set forth parables and examples, and each one have We utterly ruined

40.Hamid S. Aziz: Indeed, they have come past the cities which were rained on with an evil rain; have they not seen them? Nay, but they fear not the Resurrection (or hope not for resurrection)

41.Hamid S. Aziz: And when they see you (Muhammad) they only took you for a jest, "Is this he whom Allah has sent as a Messenger

42.Hamid S. Aziz: "He well-nigh leads us astray from our gods, had we not been constant to them." But they shall know, when they see the torment, who errs most from the path

43.Hamid S. Aziz: Have you considered him who takes for his god his own lusts (prejudices, fantasies, superstitions)? Would you then be guardian over him

44.Hamid S. Aziz: Or do you think that most of them hear or understand? They are but like the cattle, nay, they are further astray in the path

45.Hamid S. Aziz: Have you not seen how your Lord spreads the shadow? Had He willed He could have made it still - We make the sun its guide

46.Hamid S. Aziz: Then We contract it towards Us with a gradual contraction in easy stages

47.Hamid S. Aziz: And He it is who made the night a covering for you; and sleep for repose, and made the day a resurrection

48.Hamid S. Aziz: And He it is who sent the winds as glad tidings heralding His mercy; and We send down purifying water from the sky

49.Hamid S. Aziz: That We may quicken therewith the dead land, and slake the thirst of the things We have created - beasts and men in great numbers

50.Hamid S. Aziz: And verily, We have repeated it (the lesson) in various ways among them that they may remember; but most of mankind begrudge aught save ingratitude

51.Hamid S. Aziz: But, had We pleased, We could have raised a Warner in every village (or population centre)

52.Hamid S. Aziz: So obey not the disbelievers, but strive against them herewith (with the Quran) with great endeavour

53.Hamid S. Aziz: He it is who has set free the two bodies of water (rivers and seas), one palatable and sweet, and the other salty and bitter, and has set a barrier between them, forbidding passage

54.Hamid S. Aziz: And He it is who has created man from water, and has appointed for him kindred by blood and kindred by marriage for your Lord is ever Powerful

55.Hamid S. Aziz: Yet they worship beside Allah what can neither profit them nor harm them; but the disbeliever is ever a partisan of evil against his Lord

56.Hamid S. Aziz: We have only sent you to give glad tidings and as a Warner

57.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "I ask you for no reward for this, save that whoever will may choose a way unto his Lord."

58.Hamid S. Aziz: And rely you upon the Living One who dies not; and celebrate His praise; He is sufficient as Knower about the faults of His servants

59.Hamid S. Aziz: He who created the heavens and the earth, and what is between them, in six days, and then mounted the Throne; the Beneficent! Ask any one who is aware concerning Him

60.Hamid S. Aziz: And when it is said unto them, "Adore you the Beneficent", they say, "What is the Beneficent? Shall we adore what you do order us?" And it only increases their aversion

61.Hamid S. Aziz: Blessed be He who placed in the heavens mansions (constellations) of stars, and has placed therein a great lamp and an illuminating moon

62.Hamid S. Aziz: And He it is who made the night and the day alternating, for him who desires to remember or who desires thankfulness

63.Hamid S. Aziz: And the faithful servants of the Beneficent are those who walk upon the earth modestly, and when the ignorant (or foolish) address them, answer, "Peace!"

64.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who pass the night before their Lord, prostrate and standing

65.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who say, "Our Lord! Avert from us the doom of hell; verily, its wrath is indeed a grievous affliction

66.Hamid S. Aziz: "Verily, indeed an evil abode and state."

67.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who when they spend are neither extravagant nor miserly, but who always take their stand between the two

68.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who call not upon another god with Allah; nor take the life which Allah has forbidden save in justice; nor commit adultery (or fornication) - for he who does that shall pay the penalty

69.Hamid S. Aziz: The penalty will be doubled for him on the Day of Judgment, and he will abide therein despised forever

70.Hamid S. Aziz: Save he who repents and believes and does righteous work; for such Allah will change their evil deeds to good deeds. Allah is ever Forgiving, Merciful

71.Hamid S. Aziz: And he who repents and does good, verily, he has turned to Allah with true conversion

72.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who will not witness vanity (frivolous, foolish, ignorant, futile and useless things, falsehood); and when they pass by vain (frivolous, foolish, futile, ignorant, false) discourse, pass by with dignity

73.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who when they are reminded of the revelations of their Lord, fall not deaf and blind thereat

74.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who say, "Our Lord! Grant us comfort and cheer from our wives and offspring, and make us models for all those who ward off evil (or to lead the righteous)."

75.Hamid S. Aziz: These shall be rewarded with a high place for that they were steadfast: and they will meet therein with welcome and peace

76.Hamid S. Aziz: Abiding therein for ever; a happy abode and state

77.Hamid S. Aziz: Say (to the rejecters), "My Lord is not concerned (or uneased) because of you if you call not on Him (in prayer); but you have denied (Him or the Truth), therefore will there be judgment."

3.Hamid S. Aziz: It may be that you are tormenting your soul that they will not be believers

6.Hamid S. Aziz: They have indeed rejected the message, but soon enough will come to them the truth of that at which they mocked

7.Hamid S. Aziz: Have they not looked to the earth, how We caused to grow therein of every noble kind

10.Hamid S. Aziz: And when your Lord called Moses, saying, "Go to the iniquitous people

13.Hamid S. Aziz: "And my breast will be straitened, and my tongue is not fluent; so send then unto Aaron (or send them Aaron)

14.Hamid S. Aziz: "For they have a crime against me. And I fear that they may kill me."

15.Hamid S. Aziz: Said He, "Not so; but go, both, with Our signs; verily, We are with you listening

20.Hamid S. Aziz: Moses said, "I did commit this, and I was of those who erred

21.Hamid S. Aziz: "And I fled from you when I feared you. But my Lord granted me better judgment, and made me one of His messengers

22.Hamid S. Aziz: "And this is the favour you have reproached me with, that you have enslaved the children of Israel!"

26.Hamid S. Aziz: Moses said, "(He is) your Lord and the Lord of your fathers from the beginning."

27.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he (Pharaoh), "Verily, the messenger who is sent to you is surely mad!"

28.Hamid S. Aziz: Moses said, "(He is) The Lord of the East and of the West, and of all that is between the two, if you did but understand."

29.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he (Pharaoh), "If you do take a god besides me I will surely place you among the prisoners."

33.Hamid S. Aziz: And he plucked out his hand, and, behold, it was white to the spectators

34.Hamid S. Aziz: He (Pharaoh) said to the chiefs around him, "Verily, this is a knowing (expert) magician (sorcerer, wizard)

35.Hamid S. Aziz: "He desires to turn you out of your land. What is it then you counsel (advise, suggest)"

36.Hamid S. Aziz: They said, "Put him off a while, him and his brother, and send into the citie

37.Hamid S. Aziz: "To collect and bring to you every knowing (expert) magician."

38.Hamid S. Aziz: And the magicians assembled at the appointed time on a well-known day (a festival day)

39.Hamid S. Aziz: And it was said to the people, "Are you assembling?"

40.Hamid S. Aziz: (They said), "Aye, so that we may follow the magicians if they win."

41.Hamid S. Aziz: And when the sorcerers came they said unto Pharaoh, "Will we have a sure reward if we win?"

42.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "Yes; and, verily, you shall then be of those who are brought nigh to me (or to my throne in affection and rank)."

43.Hamid S. Aziz: And Moses said to them, "Throw down what you have to throw."

44.Hamid S. Aziz: So they threw down their ropes and their rods and said, "By Pharaoh´s might, verily, it is we who shall be the winners."

45.Hamid S. Aziz: And Moses threw down his rod, and, lo, it swallowed up what they had falsely devised

46.Hamid S. Aziz: And the magicians threw themselves down, in obeisance

47.Hamid S. Aziz: Saying, "We believe in the Lord of the Worlds

48.Hamid S. Aziz: "The Lord of Moses and Aaron."

49.Hamid S. Aziz: Said Pharaoh, "Do you believe in Him ere I give you permission? Surely, he is your leader (in a conspiracy) who has taught you sorcery. But soon you shall know. I will surely cut off your hands and your feet from opposite sides, and I will crucify y

50.Hamid S. Aziz: They said, "No matter! Verily, unto our Lord do we (or "will we" or "in any case") return

51.Hamid S. Aziz: "Verily, we ardently hope that our Lord will forgive us our sins, for we are the foremost of believers!"

52.Hamid S. Aziz: And We inspired Moses, saying, "Journey by night with my servants; verily, you are pursued."

53.Hamid S. Aziz: And Pharaoh sent into the cities summoners

54.Hamid S. Aziz: (Who said) "Verily, these are a small company

55.Hamid S. Aziz: "And, verily, they are offenders against us

56.Hamid S. Aziz: "But we are a multitude and wary

57.Hamid S. Aziz: (") So we (or We) expelled them out of gardens and springs

58.Hamid S. Aziz: (") And treasures, and noble positions.("

59.Hamid S. Aziz: Thus it was, but We made the children of Israel inheritors of these things

60.Hamid S. Aziz: And they pursued them at dawn

61.Hamid S. Aziz: And when the two hosts saw each other, the companions of Moses said, "Verily, we are overtaken!"

62.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "Not so; verily, my Lord is with me. He will guide me."

63.Hamid S. Aziz: And We inspired Moses, saying, "Strike the sea with your rod." And it was cleft asunder, and each part was like a mighty mountain

64.Hamid S. Aziz: And then We brought the others thither

65.Hamid S. Aziz: And We saved Moses and those with him, every one

66.Hamid S. Aziz: We drowned the others

67.Hamid S. Aziz: Lo! Herein is indeed a sign: but most of them are not believers

68.Hamid S. Aziz: And, verily, your Lord, He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful

69.Hamid S. Aziz: And recite unto them the story of Abraham

70.Hamid S. Aziz: When he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?"

71.Hamid S. Aziz: They said, "We worship idols, and we are devoted to them."

72.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "Can they hear you when you call

73.Hamid S. Aziz: "Or benefit you, or harm you?"

74.Hamid S. Aziz: They said, "No; but we found our fathers doing thus."

75.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "Have you considered that which you worship (or serve)

76.Hamid S. Aziz: "You  and your forefathers

77.Hamid S. Aziz: "Verily, they are foes unto me, save only the Lord of the Worlds

78.Hamid S. Aziz: "Who created me and does guide me

79.Hamid S. Aziz: "And who feeds me food and waters me

80.Hamid S. Aziz: "And when I am sick He heals me

81.Hamid S. Aziz: "He who causes me to die, and then gives me life again

82.Hamid S. Aziz: "And who, I ardently hope, will forgive me my sins on the Day of Judgment

83.Hamid S. Aziz: "My Lord, grant me wisdom (or judgment), and let me join the righteous

84.Hamid S. Aziz: "And give me a good report amongst the later generations

85.Hamid S. Aziz: "And place me among the heirs of the Garden of Delight

86.Hamid S. Aziz: "And forgive my father. Verily, he is of those who err

87.Hamid S. Aziz: "And disgrace me not on the Day when they are raised

88.Hamid S. Aziz: "The Day when wealth shall profit not, nor sons

89.Hamid S. Aziz: "But only he who comes to Allah with a whole (sound) heart

90.Hamid S. Aziz: "And the Garden will be brought near to the righteous

91.Hamid S. Aziz: "And Hell shall be brought forth plainly to those who go astray

92.Hamid S. Aziz: "And it will be said unto them, ´Where is all that you used to worship

93.Hamid S. Aziz: "Beside Allah? Can they help you, or help themselves?´

94.Hamid S. Aziz: "Then they shall be hurled therein, they and the seducers

95.Hamid S. Aziz: "And the hosts of Iblis all together

96.Hamid S. Aziz: "They shall say, while they quarrel therein

97.Hamid S. Aziz: "´By Allah! In truth, we were in manifest error

98.Hamid S. Aziz: "´When we made you equal to the Lord of the Worlds

99.Hamid S. Aziz: "´It was only the guilty who led us astray

103.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, in this is indeed a sign, yet most of them are not believers

105.Hamid S. Aziz: The people of Noah denied the messengers

106.Hamid S. Aziz: When their brother Noah said to them, "Will you not fear (Allah and avoid evil)

107.Hamid S. Aziz: "Verily, I am a faithful messenger to you

108.Hamid S. Aziz: "So keep your duty to Allah, and obey me

109.Hamid S. Aziz: "I ask you for it no wages; my wage is only the concern of the Lord of the Worlds

111.Hamid S. Aziz: They said, "Shall we believe in you, when the meanest follow you?"

112.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "What knowledge have I of what they were doing

113.Hamid S. Aziz: "Their account is only with my Lord, if you but understood

114.Hamid S. Aziz: "And I am not here to drive away the believers

116.Hamid S. Aziz: They said, "Verily, if you desist not, O Noah! you shall surely be of those who are stoned!"

117.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "My Lord! Verily, my own people reject me

118.Hamid S. Aziz: "Judge you between us openly, and deliver me and those of the believers who are with me."

119.Hamid S. Aziz: So We saved him and those with him in the laden ark

121.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, in this indeed is a sign, yet most of them are not believers

122.Hamid S. Aziz: And, verily, your Lord, He is indeed the Mighty, the Merciful

123.Hamid S. Aziz: And (the people of) A´ad denied the messengers

124.Hamid S. Aziz: When their brother Hud said to them, "Will you not fear

125.Hamid S. Aziz: "Verily, I am to you a faithful messenger

126.Hamid S. Aziz: "So keep your duty to Allah and obey me

127.Hamid S. Aziz: "I ask of you no fee for it; my wage is only the concern of the Lord of the Worlds

128.Hamid S. Aziz: "Do you build on every height a monument of vain delight

129.Hamid S. Aziz: "And build you fine strong buildings that per chance (or possibly) you may be immortal

130.Hamid S. Aziz: "And when you seize by force, assault you like tyrants

132.Hamid S. Aziz: And keep your duty to Him who has bestowed on you freely all that you know

133.Hamid S. Aziz: And has aided you with cattle and son

135.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, I fear for you the retribution of an awful day!"

32.Hamid S. Aziz: Thrust your hand into your bosom, it shall come out white, without hurt; and then fold again your wing, that you do now stretch out through dread (i.e. guard your heart from fear); for these are two signs from your Lord to Pharaoh and his chiefs. Verily,

33.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "My Lord! Verily, I have killed a person amongst them, and I fear that they will kill me

34.Hamid S. Aziz: "My brother Aaron, he is more eloquent of tongue than I; send him then with me to verify (confirm, support) me. Verily, I fear that they will deny me."

35.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "We will strengthen your arm with your brother; and We give you both authority (or power), and they shall not reach (touch) you for Our signs (they will make you triumphant). You  two and those who follow you shall gain the upper hand."

36.Hamid S. Aziz: And when Moses came to them with Our manifest signs, they said, "This is naught but invented magic; we have not heard of this amongst our forefathers."

37.Hamid S. Aziz: Moses said, "My Lord is best aware of who comes with guidance from Him, and whose end shall be the best. Verily, the unjust shall not be successful."

38.Hamid S. Aziz: And Pharaoh said, "O you chiefs! I know of no God for you except me; then set me a Fire, O Haman! To bake some clay and make for me a tower, so that I may mount up to the God of Moses; for, verily, I think he is of those who lie!"

39.Hamid S. Aziz: And he became inflated with pride, he and his armies in the land, without justification; and thought that they would not be returned to Us

40.Hamid S. Aziz: And We overtook him and his army, and We flung them into the sea; behold, then, what was the end of the unjust

41.Hamid S. Aziz: But We made them models (examples or leaders) calling (or leading) to the fire; and on the Day of Resurrection they shall not be helped

42.Hamid S. Aziz: And We followed them up in this world with a curse; and on the Day of Resurrection they shall be among the abhorred

43.Hamid S. Aziz: And We gave Moses the Book, after that We had destroyed the former generations, to give insight to mankind, and a guidance and a mercy; per chance (or possibly), they may reflect

44.Hamid S. Aziz: You (Muhammad) were not upon the Western side when We expounded unto Moses his mission, nor were you of the witnesses (of those events

45.Hamid S. Aziz: But We raised up other generations, and long were the ages that passed over them; but you were not a dweller among the people of Midian, reciting to them Our signs; but We kept sending our Messengers

46.Hamid S. Aziz: Nor were you by the side of the mountain when We called; yet are you sent as a mercy from your Lord, that you may warn a people to whom no Warner has come before you  that per chance (or possibly) they may be give heed

47.Hamid S. Aziz: Otherwise, if a disaster should befall them for what their hands have sent before, they should say, "Our Lord! Why did Thou not send to us a messenger that we might have followed Thy revelations and been of the believers?"

48.Hamid S. Aziz: But when the truth comes to them from Us they say, "Why are not signs given to him the like of what Moses was given." Did they not disbelieve in what Moses was given before? They say, "Two works of sorcery back up each other (The Torah and

49.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Bring, then, a book from Allah which shall be a better guide than both that I may follow it, if you are truthful."

50.Hamid S. Aziz: And if they cannot answer you, then know that they follow their own lusts (prejudices, fantasies, superstitions); and who is more in error than he who follows his own lust without guidance from Allah? Verily, Allah guides not a wrong doing people

51.Hamid S. Aziz: And We caused the Word to reach them, per chance (or possibly) they may be mindful

52.Hamid S. Aziz: Those to whom We gave the Book before it (the Quran), they believe therein

53.Hamid S. Aziz: And when it is recited to them they say, "We believe in it. It is the Truth from Our Lord. Verily, we were, even before it came, of those who Surrender (or were Muslim)."

54.Hamid S. Aziz: These shall be given their reward twice over, because they were steadfast, and repelled evil with good, and spend of what We have bestowed upon them

55.Hamid S. Aziz: And when they hear vain talk, they turn away from it and say, "We have our works, and you have your works. Peace be upon you! We do not seek the ignorant."

56.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, you can not guide whom you do like, but Allah guides whom He wills; for He knows best who are to be guided

57.Hamid S. Aziz: And they say, "If we follow the Guidance we shall be snatched away from the land." Have We not established for them a safe sanctuary, to which are imported the fruits of all things as a provision from Us? But most of them know not

58.Hamid S. Aziz: How many a community have We destroyed that exulted in its means of subsistence? Yonder are their dwellings which have not been inhabited after them, except for a while. And We, even We, are the inheritors

59.Hamid S. Aziz: But your Lord would never destroy a community until He has sent to its centre a messenger to recite to them Our signs; nor would We destroy populations unless their people practiced iniquity

60.Hamid S. Aziz: Whatever thing you may be given, it is a provision for the life of this world and the adornment thereof; but that which Allah has is better and more enduring. Have you then no sense

61.Hamid S. Aziz: Is He to whom We have promised a goodly promise, which he shall meet with, like him to whom We have given the enjoyment in the life of this world, and who on the Day of Resurrection shall be of the arraigned (brought up to deserve punishment )

62.Hamid S. Aziz: And on the Day when He will call them and say, "Where are My partners which you imagined?"

63.Hamid S. Aziz: And those concerning whom the Word will have come true shall say, "Our Lord! These are those whom we have seduced away; we seduced them as we were seduced ourselves: but we declare our innocence before Thee  - they did not worship us."

64.Hamid S. Aziz: And it will be said, "Call upon your pretend partners; and they will call upon them, but they will not answer them, and they shall see the Doom. Ah, would that they had been guided right

65.Hamid S. Aziz: And on the Day when He shall call unto them and say, "What was it you answered the messengers?"

66.Hamid S. Aziz: And history shall be obscure to them on that day, nor shall they ask each other

67.Hamid S. Aziz: But, as for him who repents and believes and does right, it may be that he will be among the successful

68.Hamid S. Aziz: For your Lord brings to pass what He pleases and chooses; they have never the choice! Glorified be Allah and exalted above all they associate with Him

69.Hamid S. Aziz: Your Lord knows what they conceal in their breasts and what they manifest

70.Hamid S. Aziz: He is Allah; there is no God but He; to Him belongs all praise, in the first place (or state) and the last; and His is the command; and unto Him shall you return

71.Hamid S. Aziz: Have you considered, if Allah were to make for you the night endless until the Day of Resurrection, who is the god, but Allah, to bring you light? Will you not then hear

72.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Have you considered, if Allah were to make for you the day endless until the Day of Judgment, who is the god, except Allah, to bring you the night to rest therein? Can you not then see?"

73.Hamid S. Aziz: But of His mercy He has made for you the night and the day, that you may rest therein, and crave of His grace, per chance (or possibly) you may give thanks

74.Hamid S. Aziz: And the day when He shall call them and say, "Where are my partners whom you did pretend were such?"

75.Hamid S. Aziz: And We will pluck from every nation a witness; and We will say, "Bring your proof and know that the truth belongs to Allah". And that which they had devised shall stray away from them

76.Hamid S. Aziz: Qarun (Korah) was of the people of Moses, but he behaved insolently (oppressed them); and We gave him so much treasure that the keys thereof would have been a burden on men endowed with strength. When his people said to him, "Exult not; verily, Allah loves not those who exult in riches,

77.Hamid S. Aziz: "But seek the abode of the Hereafter through what Allah has given you, and forget not your portion in this world, and do good as Allah has done good to you; and seek not corruption in the earth; verily, Allah loves not corrupters."

78.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "I have only been given it because of the knowledge which I possess." Knew he not that Allah had destroyed before him many generations of those who were mightier than he in strength and greater in following? But the guilty are not aske

79.Hamid S. Aziz: And he went out amongst the people in his pomp. Those who desired the life of this world said, "O would that we had the like of what Qarun has been given! Verily, he is lord of mighty fortune!"

80.Hamid S. Aziz: But those who had been given knowledge said, "Woe to you! The reward of Allah is better for him who believes and does right; but none shall obtain it except the steadfast

81.Hamid S. Aziz: So We caused the earth to open up and swallow him with his house; and he had no troop to help him against Allah, nor was he of those who could save themselves."

82.Hamid S. Aziz: And on the morrow those who had yearned for his place the day before said, "Ah! Allah enlarges provision to whom He pleases of His servants, or He restricts it for whom He will. Had not Allah been gracious unto us, the earth would have cleft open an

83.Hamid S. Aziz: That Home of the Hereafter, We assign it unto those who seek not arrogant oppression in the earth, nor yet corruption, and the end is for the righteous

84.Hamid S. Aziz: He who brings a good deed shall have better than it; and he who brings an evil deed - those who do evil deeds shall only be rewarded for that which they have done

85.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, He who hath ordained the Quran for you will surely bring you back to the Place of Return (Mecca or Home in Heaven). Say, "My Lord knows best who brings guidance, and who is in error manifest

86.Hamid S. Aziz: You  had no hope that the Book (Scripture) would be inspired in you, but it is a mercy from your Lord! Be not, therefore, a helper of those who disbelieve

87.Hamid S. Aziz: And let them not divert you from the revelations of Allah after they have been sent down to you; but call mankind unto your Lord and be not of the idolaters

88.Hamid S. Aziz: And call not upon any other God along with Allah; there is no God but He. Everything is perishable (or will perish), except His countenance. His is the command, and unto Him shall you return

1.Hamid S. Aziz: ALIF LAM MIM

2.Hamid S. Aziz: Do men imagine that they will be left alone because they say, "We believe," and not be tested

3.Hamid S. Aziz: We did try those who were before you, and Allah will surely know those who are sincere, and He will surely know those who feign

4.Hamid S. Aziz: Do those who do evil reckon that they can outstrip Us? Evil is it that which they judge

5.Hamid S. Aziz: He who looks forward to the meeting with Allah, - verily, the appointed time is surely nigh, and He is the Hearer and Knower

6.Hamid S. Aziz: And he who strives, strives only for his own soul; for verily, Allah is altogether Independent of (His) creatures (or the worlds)

7.Hamid S. Aziz: Those who believe and do right, We will surely blot out all evil from (or in) them; and reward them according to the best of their deeds (or with better than their deeds)

8.Hamid S. Aziz: We have enjoined on man kindness to parents; but if they strive to make you join with Me that of which you have no knowledge, then obey them not. Unto Me is your return, and I will inform you of that which you did

9.Hamid S. Aziz: But those who believe and do right, We will surely make them enter amongst the righteous

10.Hamid S. Aziz: And there are those among men who say, "We believe in Allah!" but when they suffer for the sake of Allah, they mistake the persecution of men for the punishment of Allah; but if help come from your Lord they will say, "Verily, we were with

11.Hamid S. Aziz: Allah surely knows those who believe, and surely knows the hypocrites

12.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who disbelieved said to those who believed, "Follow our way (religion), we will bear your sins. But they cannot bear aught of their sins; verily, they are liars

13.Hamid S. Aziz: But they shall surely bear their own burdens, and other burdens besides their own; and they shall surely be questioned on the Day of Resurrection concerning what they devised

14.Hamid S. Aziz: And We sent Noah to his people, and he dwelt among them for a thousand save fifty years; and the deluge engulfed them while they persisted in evil-doing

15.Hamid S. Aziz: But We saved him and the company of the ark, and made it a sign unto the worlds (all peoples or creatures)

16.Hamid S. Aziz: And Abraham, when he said to his people, "Serve Allah and fear Him, that is better for you if you did but know

17.Hamid S. Aziz: "You  serve instead of Allah only idols and you only invent a lie; verily, those whom you serve beside Allah own (control) no provision for you. So seek your provision from Allah, and serve Him, and give thanks to Him; unto Him shall you return

18.Hamid S. Aziz: But if you deny this, then know that nations before you have denied it. The messenger has only to convey the message plainly."

19.Hamid S. Aziz: See they not how Allah produces creation, and then reproduces it? Verily, for Allah it is easy

20.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Travel you in the earth, and behold how Allah originated creation; so will He produce a later creation. Verily, Allah has power over all things."

21.Hamid S. Aziz: "He punishes whom He will, and bestows mercy on whom He will; and towards Him are you turned

22.Hamid S. Aziz: "You cannot make Him powerless (escape Him) in the earth, nor in the heavens; nor have you beside Allah a friend or a helper

23.Hamid S. Aziz: "And those who disbelieve in the revelations of Allah and in their meeting with Him, these shall despair of My mercy; and for these is grievous woe."

24.Hamid S. Aziz: But the answer of his people was only to say, "Kill him" or "Burn him!" But Allah saved him from the fire; verily, in that are signs unto a people who have faith

25.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "Verily, you take beside Allah idols, through mutual friendship in the life of this world; but on the Day of Judgment you shall deny each other, and shall curse each other, and your resort shall be the fire, and you shall have none to help.

26.Hamid S. Aziz: And Lot believed him and said, "Verily, I flee unto (or for the sake of) my Lord! Verily, He, only He, is the Mighty, the Wise."

27.Hamid S. Aziz: And We granted Abraham Isaac and Jacob; and We placed in his seed the Prophethood and the Scriptures; and We gave him his reward in this world; and, verily, in the Hereafter he shall be among the righteous."

28.Hamid S. Aziz: And Lot! (Remember) When he said to his people, "Verily, you commit an abomination such as no creature did before you

29.Hamid S. Aziz: "Do you approach men? And cut off the highway? And practice wickedness in your assemblies?" But his people gave no answer but this, "Bring us the Wrath of Allah, if you speak the truth."

30.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "My Lord! Help me against a people who do evil!"

31.Hamid S. Aziz: And when Our messengers came to Abraham with the glad tidings, they said, "We are about to destroy the people of these cities. Verily, the people thereof are evil-doers."

32.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "Verily, in it is Lot." They said, "We are best aware of who is therein; we shall of a surety save him and his people, except his wife, who is of those who lag behind."

33.Hamid S. Aziz: And when Our messengers came to Lot, he was troubled on account of them, and felt powerless to protect them. But they said, "Fear not, neither grieve; we are about to save you and your people, except your wife, who is of those who lag behind

34.Hamid S. Aziz: "Verily, we are about to send down upon the people of this city a horror from heaven, for that they are evil-livers."

35.Hamid S. Aziz: And, verily, of that We have left a manifest sign unto a people who have sense

36.Hamid S. Aziz: And unto Midian We sent their brother Shu´eyb, and he said, "My people, serve Allah, and fear the Last Day; and do not evil, making mischief in the land, (despoiling it)."

37.Hamid S. Aziz: But they denied him; and the convulsion seized them, and on the morrow they lay prostrate in their dwellings

38.Hamid S. Aziz: And A´ad and Thamud! But their fate is plain to you from their ruined habitations. Satan made their deeds fair seeming unto them, and turned them from the Way, gifted with intelligence and skill though they were

39.Hamid S. Aziz: And Korah, Pharaoh and Haman! Moses did come to them with clear signs, but they were inflated with pride in the earth. Yet they could not outstrip Us

40.Hamid S. Aziz: And each of them We seized in his sin; and of them were some against whom We sent a sandstorm; and some were caught by a mighty Blast; and some We caused the earth to swallow; and some We drowned. It was not Allah who injured (or oppressed, wronged) them

41.Hamid S. Aziz: The similitude of those who choose other patrons than Allah, is as the likeness of a spider, that takes to himself a house; and, lo! The frailest of all houses is the spider´s house, if they but knew

42.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, Allah knows whatever thing they call upon beside Him; for He is the Mighty, the Wise

43.Hamid S. Aziz: As for these similitudes (parables), We have coined for mankind, but none will understand them, save the wise

44.Hamid S. Aziz: Allah created the heavens and the earth with truth. Verily, in this is a sign for those have faith

45.Hamid S. Aziz: Recite what has been inspired in you of the Book; and establish worship. Verily, worship preserves from shameful deeds and iniquity, but surely the remembrance (or mention) of Allah is more important; and Allah knows what you do

46.Hamid S. Aziz: And argue not with the people of the Book, unless with better means; except with those who have done wrong amongst them and say, "We believe in what is sent down to us, and what has been sent down to you; our God and your God is One, and unto Him we

47.Hamid S. Aziz: Thus did We send down to you the Book; and those unto whom We gave the Book (Scriptures) before will believe therein, and of these (Pagan Arabs) also there are some who believe therein. None reject Our revelations save disbelievers

48.Hamid S. Aziz: You  (Muhammad) could not recite before this any Book (or Scripture), nor write it with your right hand, for then, indeed, might those who deal (or talk) in vanities (trivialities, falsehoods, irrelevancies) have doubted

49.Hamid S. Aziz: Nay, but it is a clear revelation in the heart of those who are endowed with knowledge, and none deny Our revelations save the wrongdoers (or unjust)

50.Hamid S. Aziz: And still they say, "Why have not signs been sent down upon him from his Lord." Say, "Verily, signs are with Allah only, and I am but a plain Warner."

51.Hamid S. Aziz: Is it not enough for them that We have sent down to you the Book which you do recite to them? Verily, in that is a mercy and a reminder to a people who believe

52.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Allah is sufficient witness between me and you. He knows what is in the heavens and what is in the earth; and those who believe in vanities (falsehoods, frivolities) and disbelieve in Allah, they it is who are the losers."

53.Hamid S. Aziz: They will wish you to hasten on the doom (punishment); but were it not that a term had been appointed, the doom would have come upon them ere now. And verily it will come upon them suddenly when they perceive not

54.Hamid S. Aziz: They ask you to hurry on the doom, but, verily, hell encompasses the disbelievers

55.Hamid S. Aziz: On the Day when the Doom (or Wrath) shall overwhelm them from above them and from beneath their feet, and He will say, "Taste that which you have done."

56.Hamid S. Aziz: O my servants who believe! Verily, My earth is spacious enough; therefore serve Me only

57.Hamid S. Aziz: Every soul must taste of death, then unto Us shall you return

58.Hamid S. Aziz: Those who believe and act right, We will surely house them in lofty (or upper) chambers of the Garden beneath which rivers flow; to dwell therein secure (or for ever) - an excellent reward for the toilers (workers of good)

59.Hamid S. Aziz: Those who persevere and put their trust in (or rely on) their Lord

60.Hamid S. Aziz: How many a beast cannot carry its own provision! Allah provides for it and for you; He is the Hearer, the Knower

61.Hamid S. Aziz: And if you should ask them, "Who created the heavens and the earth, and subjected the sun and the moon?" they will surely say, "Allah!" how then can they turn away

62.Hamid S. Aziz: Allah extends provision to whomsoever He will of His servants, or restricts it; verily, Allah is aware of all things

63.Hamid S. Aziz: And if you should ask them, "Who causes water to come down from the sky and revives therewith the earth after its death?" they will surely say, "Allah!" Say, "And praise be to Allah!" But most of them have no sense

64.Hamid S. Aziz: This life of the world is nothing but a pastime and game (or a sport and a play); but, verily, the abode of the Hereafter, that is life, if they did but knew

65.Hamid S. Aziz: And when they ride in the ship they call upon Allah, making their religion seem sincere to Him; but when He delivers them safely to the shore, behold, they associate others with Him

66.Hamid S. Aziz: Disdaining ungratefully Our gifts; and that they may have some worldly enjoyment: but soon they shall come to know

67.Hamid S. Aziz: Have they not seen that We have made a Safe Sanctuary whilst people are being snatched away around them? Is it then that they believe in falsehood, and disbelieve the bounty of Allah

68.Hamid S. Aziz: But who is more unjust than he who devises against Allah a lie, or rejects the truth when it comes to him? Is there not in hell a home for the disbelievers

69.Hamid S. Aziz: But those who strive in Our cause, We will surely guide them into Our Way, for, verily, Allah is with those who do right

1.Hamid S. Aziz: Alif Lam Mim

2.Hamid S. Aziz: The Romans are vanquished

3.Hamid S. Aziz: In a near land, and they, after being vanquished, shall be victorious

4.Hamid S. Aziz: Within a few years. - Allah´s is the command before and after; and on that day the believers shall rejoice

5.Hamid S. Aziz: With the help of Allah; He helps whom He pleases; and He is the Mighty, the Merciful

6.Hamid S. Aziz: It is Allah´s promise! Allah will not fail His promise, but most of mankind know not

7.Hamid S. Aziz: They know only the outward (appearance) in the life of this world, but of the Hereafter they are heedless

8.Hamid S. Aziz: Do they not reflect within themselves: Allah did not create the heavens and the earth and what is between them but with Truth, and for an appointed term (or destined end)? But truly most of the people are disbelievers in the meeting with their Lord

9.Hamid S. Aziz: Have they not travelled in the earth and seen how was the end of those before them? They were stronger than these were in power and prowess, and they dug up the earth, and built on it in greater abundance than these have built. There came to them their m

10.Hamid S. Aziz: Then evil was the end of those who did evil, because they rejected the revelations of Allah and used to mock them

11.Hamid S. Aziz: Allah originates creation, then reproduces it, then to Him will you be returned

12.Hamid S. Aziz: In the Day when the Hour shall come the guilty shall be in despair

13.Hamid S. Aziz: And they shall not have any intercessors from among their gods they have joined with Allah, and they shall be deniers of their associate-gods

14.Hamid S. Aziz: In the Day when the Hour shall come, at that Day they shall be separated

15.Hamid S. Aziz: Then as to those who believed and did good works, they shall be made happy in a Garden

16.Hamid S. Aziz: And as to those who disbelieved and rejected Our revelations and the meeting of the Hereafter, these shall be brought to the chastisement

17.Hamid S. Aziz: Therefore glory be to Allah when you enter the night and when you enter morning

18.Hamid S. Aziz: Unto Him belongs praise in the heavens and the earth, and at the sun´s decline and in the midday

19.Hamid S. Aziz: He brings forth the living from the dead and brings forth the dead from the living, and He revives the earth after its death, and even so shall you be brought forth

20.Hamid S. Aziz: And one of His signs is this, that He created you from dust, then lo! You are mortals, scattered widely

21.Hamid S. Aziz: And one of His signs is this that He created mates for you from yourselves that you may find rest in them, and He put between you love and compassion; herein, indeed, are signs for a people who reflect

22.Hamid S. Aziz: And one of His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the diversity of your tongues and colours; herein, indeed are signs for the learned (men who have knowledge)

23.Hamid S. Aziz: And one of His signs is your sleeping by night and your seeking of His Bounty (livelihood, benefits and treasures) by day; herein, indeed, are signs for a people who heed (pay attention, are aware or conscious)

24.Hamid S. Aziz: And one of His signs is this, that He shows you the lightning for fear and for hope, and sends down water from the clouds thereby quickens the earth after its death; herein, indeed, are signs for a people who understand

25.Hamid S. Aziz: And one of His signs is this that the heaven and the earth subsist by His command, then when He calls you with a single call, lo! From out of the earth, you emerge

26.Hamid S. Aziz: And His is whoever is in the heavens and the earth; all are obedient to Him

27.Hamid S. Aziz: And He it is Who originates the creation, then reproduces it, and it is easy for Him; and His is the Sublime Similitude (or the most exalted attributes) in the heavens and the earth, and He is the Mighty, the Wise

28.Hamid S. Aziz: He sets forth to you a similitude (parable) relating to yourselves (and your own experience): Have you among those whom your right hands possess (slaves) partners in what We have given you for sustenance, to share as equals; do you fear them as you fear

29.Hamid S. Aziz: Nay! Those who are unjust follow their low desires without any knowledge; so who can guide him whom Allah causes to err? And they shall have no helpers

30.Hamid S. Aziz: Then set your purpose for religion as a man upright by nature - the nature made by Allah in which He has made men; there is no altering (the laws of) Allah´s creation; that is the right religion, but most people do not know

31.Hamid S. Aziz: Turning to Him only, and be careful of your duty to Him and keep up prayer and be not of those who ascribe partners to Him (polytheists)

32.Hamid S. Aziz: Of those who split their religion and became schismatic, every sect rejoicing in its own tenets

33.Hamid S. Aziz: And when harm afflicts men, they call upon their Lord, turning to Him, then when He makes them taste of mercy from Him, lo! Some of them begin to associate (others) with their Lord

34.Hamid S. Aziz: So as to be ungrateful for what We have given them; (unto such it is said) "Enjoy yourselves for a while, for you shall soon come to know (the truth)"

35.Hamid S. Aziz: Or, have We sent down upon them an authority so that it speaks of that which they associate with Him

36.Hamid S. Aziz: And when We make people taste of mercy they rejoice in it, and if an evil befall them for what their hands have already wrought, lo! They are in despair

37.Hamid S. Aziz: Do they not see that Allah makes ample provision for whom He pleases, or restricts it? Herein, indeed, are signs for a people who believe

38.Hamid S. Aziz: Then give to the near of kin his due, and to the needy and the wayfarer; this is best for those who desire Allah´s countenance (presence, pleasure), and these it is who are successful

39.Hamid S. Aziz: And whatever you lay out as usury, so that it may increase in the property of men, it has no increase with Allah; but that which you give in charity, desiring Allah´s countenance (presence, pleasure) has increase manifold

40.Hamid S. Aziz: Allah is He Who created you, then gave you sustenance, then He causes you to die, then brings you to life. Is there any of your associate-gods who does aught of it? Glory be to Him, and exalted be He above what they associate (with Him)

41.Hamid S. Aziz: Corruption has appeared in the land and the sea on account of what the hands of men have wrought, that He may make them taste a part of that which they have done, so that they may return

42.Hamid S. Aziz: Say: Travel in the land, then see how was the end of those before you; most of them were idolaters

43.Hamid S. Aziz: So set your purpose resolutely to the right religion, before there come from Allah the day which cannot be averted (or is inevitable). On that day they will be sundered

44.Hamid S. Aziz: Whoever disbelieves, must bear the consequences for his disbelief, and whoever does good makes provision for his own soul

45.Hamid S. Aziz: That He may reward those who believe and do good out of His Bounty; surely He loves not the disbelievers

46.Hamid S. Aziz: And one of His signs is this, that He sends forth the winds bearing good news, and that He may make you taste of His mercy, and that the ships may run by His command, and that you may seek of His favour, and that you may be grateful

47.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily We sent before you messengers to their own people. They came to them with clear arguments. Then We gave the punishment to those who were guilty; and helping believers is ever incumbent on Us

48.Hamid S. Aziz: Allah is he Who sends forth the winds so they raise a cloud, then He spreads it forth in the sky as He pleases, and He breaks it up so that you see the rain coming forth from within it; then when He causes it to fall upon whom He pleases of His servants,

49.Hamid S. Aziz: Though they were before this, even before it was sent down upon them, in sure despair

50.Hamid S. Aziz: Look then at the signs of Allah´s mercy, how He gives life to the earth after its death; most surely He will raise the dead to life; and He has power over all things

51.Hamid S. Aziz: And if We send a wind and they see it to yellow (scorch the crop), they would after that certainly continue in their disbelief

52.Hamid S. Aziz: For surely you can not make the dead to hear and you can not make the deaf to hear the call when they have turned away (or their backs to flee)

53.Hamid S. Aziz: Nor can you lead away the blind out of their error. you can not make to hear any but those who believe in Our revelations so that they Surrender (in Islam)

54.Hamid S. Aziz: Allah is He Who created you from a state of weakness then He gave strength after weakness, then ordained weakness and grey hair after strength. He creates what He will, and He is the Knower, the Mighty

55.Hamid S. Aziz: And on the day when the Hour shall come, the guilty shall swear that they did not tarry but an hour - thus are they ever deceived

56.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who are given knowledge and faith will say, "Certainly (indeed, in truth) you tarried according to the ordinance of Allah till the Day of Resurrection, so this is the Day of Resurrection, but you were not aware."

57.Hamid S. Aziz: But on that day their excuse shall not profit those who were unjust, nor shall they be allowed to make amends

58.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, We have set forth for men every kind of similitude (parable, example) in this Quran; and, indeed, if you should bring them a miracle, those who disbelieve would certainly say: You are naught but false claimants

59.Hamid S. Aziz: Thus does Allah set a seal on the heart of those who know not

60.Hamid S. Aziz: Therefore be patient; surely the promise of Allah is true and let not those who have no certainty of faith shake your firmness

1.Hamid S. Aziz: ALIF LAM MIM

2.Hamid S. Aziz: These are the verses (revelations) of the Wise Book

3.Hamid S. Aziz: A guidance and a mercy to those who do good

4.Hamid S. Aziz: Those who establish regular prayer and give charity, and who are sure of the Hereafter

5.Hamid S. Aziz: These are in true guidance from their Lord, and these are the Successful

6.Hamid S. Aziz: But amongst men are those who purchase (pay for) idle tales without knowledge (or meaning), to lead astray men from the path of Allah, and to make a jest of it; for them is shameful woe

7.Hamid S. Aziz: And when Our signs are recited to such a one, he turns away in arrogance as though he heard them not, as if there was deafness in both his ears. Announce to him a grievous penalty

8.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, those who believe and do right, for them are Gardens of Bliss

9.Hamid S. Aziz: Wherein they will abide; it is a promise of Allah in truth, and He is the Mighty, the Wise

10.Hamid S. Aziz: He created the heavens without supports that you can see, and He placed upon the earth firm mountains lest it should shake with you; and He dispersed therein all kinds of beasts; and We send down from the heavens water, and We caused plants of every nobl

11.Hamid S. Aziz: This is the Creation of Allah; show me that which others beside Him have created. Nay, the unjust are in obvious error

12.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, We did give unto Luqman wisdom, saying, "Thank Allah; for he who thanks Allah is only thankful for his own soul; and he who is ungrateful - verily, Allah is Absolute (Independent, Self-sufficient), Owner of all praise."

13.Hamid S. Aziz: And (remember) when Luqman said to his son while admonishing him, "O my boy! Associate none with Allah, for, verily, such association is a mighty wrong."

14.Hamid S. Aziz: For We have commended his parents to men - his mother bore him with travail upon travail; and it took two years to wean him - "Be thankful to Me and to your parents; for unto Me is the journeying

15.Hamid S. Aziz: "But if they strive with you to make you ascribe unto Me partners of which you have no knowledge, then obey them not. Consort with them in the world with kindness, and follow the way of him who turns repentant unto Me. Then unto Me is your return, a

16.Hamid S. Aziz: (Said Luqman) "O my dear son! Verily, if there were the weight of a grain of mustard seed and it were hidden in the rock, or in the heaven, or in the earth, Allah would bring it forth. Verily, Allah is Subtle, Aware

17.Hamid S. Aziz: "O my dear son! Establish worship, and enjoin what is just and forbid iniquity; be patient (constant) whatever befalls you, verily, that is of the steadfast heart of affairs

18.Hamid S. Aziz: "And twist not your cheek in scorn towards folk, nor walk haughtily (or insolently) in the land; verily, Allah loves not any arrogant boaster

19.Hamid S. Aziz: "But be modest in your bearing and subdue your voice; lo! The harshest of all voices is the voice of the ass."

20.Hamid S. Aziz: Have you not seen that Allah has subjected to you what is in the heavens and what is in the earth, and has poured down upon you His favours, outwardly and inwardly? But amongst men are those who wrangle about Allah, without knowledge, and without guidanc

21.Hamid S. Aziz: And when it is said to them, "Follow what Allah has sent down;" they say, "Nay! We will follow wherein we found our fathers." - What! Even if Satan calls them to the torment of the blaze

22.Hamid S. Aziz: But he who Surrenders his purpose unto Allah (i.e. becomes a Muslim), and does good, he has grasped the firm handle; with Allah rests the issue of all affairs

23.Hamid S. Aziz: But he who disbelieves, let not his disbelief grieve you; to Us is their return, and We will inform them of what they did; for, verily, Allah is aware of what is in the heart of men

24.Hamid S. Aziz: We will let them enjoy themselves a little; then We will force them to the unrelenting doom

25.Hamid S. Aziz: And if you should ask them who created the heavens and the earth, they will surely say, "Allah." Say, "Praise be to Allah!" but most of them know not

26.Hamid S. Aziz: Unto Allah belongs all that is in the heavens and that is in the earth; verily, Allah, He is the Absolute, the Owner of praise

27.Hamid S. Aziz: And were the trees that are in the earth pens, and the sea ink with seven more seas to swell it, the Words of Allah would not be exhausted; verily, Allah is Mighty, Wise

28.Hamid S. Aziz: Your creation and your rising again are but as that of a single soul; verily, Allah is Hearer, Seer

29.Hamid S. Aziz: Have you not seen that Allah joins the night to the day, and joins the day to the night, and has subjected the sun and the moon, each running unto an appointed time? And that Allah is well informed of what you do

30.Hamid S. Aziz: That is because Allah, He is Truth (or the only Reality), and because what you call on beside Him is the False, and because Allah, He is the Sublime, the Great

31.Hamid S. Aziz: Do you not see that the ship rides on in the sea by the favour of Allah, that He may show you of His wonders? Verily, in that are signs to every grateful heart

32.Hamid S. Aziz: And when a wave like a shadow covers them, they call on Allah, being sincere in their religion; and when He saves them to the shore, then amongst them are some who halt between two opinions. But none denies Our signs save every perfidious disbeliever

33.Hamid S. Aziz: O mankind! Fear (keep your duty to) your Lord and dread the Day when the parent shall not be able to avail the child in aught, nor shall the child avail aught for its parent. Lo! the promise of Allah is true! Say, "Let not the life of this world beg

34.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, Allah, with Him is the knowledge of the Hour; He sends down the rain; and He knows that which is in the wombs. No soul knows what it is that it shall earn to-morrow; and no soul knows in what land it will die. Verily, Allah is Knower, Aware

32.SurahEnglishNames: The Prostration, Worship, Adoration, The Adoration

1.Hamid S. Aziz: 32:1 Alif Lam Mim

2.Hamid S. Aziz: The revelation of the Book, wherein there is no doubt, is from the Lord of the Worlds

3.Hamid S. Aziz: Or do they say, "He (Muhammad) has invented it? Nay! It is the truth from your Lord that you may warn a people to whom no Warner has come before you, that they may follow the right direction

4.Hamid S. Aziz: Allah is He Who created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six Days (periods), and He mounted the Throne (of authority); you have not besides Him any guardian or any intercessor, will you not then remember

5.Hamid S. Aziz: He directs the ordinance (regulates all affairs) from the heaven to the earth; then shall it ascend to Him in a Day the measure of which is a thousand years of what you count

6.Hamid S. Aziz: This is the Knower of the unseen and the seen, the Mighty the Merciful

7.Hamid S. Aziz: Who made good everything that He has created, and He began the creation of man from dust

8.Hamid S. Aziz: Then He made his progeny of an extract, of a fluid held in low esteem

9.Hamid S. Aziz: Then He fashioned him and breathed into him of His spirit, and made for you the faculties of hearing, and sight and heart; little is it that you give thanks

10.Hamid S. Aziz: And they say: What! When we have become lost in the earth, shall we then certainly be a new creation? Nay! They are disbelievers in the meeting with their Lord

11.Hamid S. Aziz: Say: The angel of death who is given charge of you shall cause you to die, then to your Lord you shall be returned

12.Hamid S. Aziz: And could you but see when the guilty shall hang down their heads before their Lord: (saying) "Our Lord! We have seen and we have heard, therefore send us back, we will work righteousness; surely (now) we are certain."

13.Hamid S. Aziz: And if We had pleased We would certainly have given to every soul its guidance, but the word (which had gone forth about evil-doers) from Me was just this: "I will certainly fill hell with the jinn and men together."

14.Hamid S. Aziz: So taste (the evil of your deeds), because you neglected the meeting of this day of yours; surely We forsake you; and taste the abiding chastisement for what you used to do

15.Hamid S. Aziz: Only they believe in Our revelations who, when they are reminded of them, fall down prostrate (in obeisance) and celebrate the praise of their Lord, and they are not proud
