16.Hamid S. Aziz: Their sides draw away from their beds, they call upon their Lord in fear and in hope, and they spend (benevolently) out of what We have given them

17.Hamid S. Aziz: No soul knows what is hidden for them of that which will refresh the eyes (give them joy); a reward for what they did

18.Hamid S. Aziz: Is he then who is a believer like him who is an evil-liver (transgressor)? They are not alike (equal)

19.Hamid S. Aziz: As for those who believe and do good, the Gardens are their homes - a hospitable welcome for what they did

20.Hamid S. Aziz: And as for those who transgress, their abode is the Fire; whenever they desire to go forth from it they shall be brought back into it, and it will be said to them, "Taste the chastisement of the fire which you called a lie."

21.Hamid S. Aziz: And most certainly We will make them taste of the Lesser (or Nearer) Chastisement (i.e. in this life) before the Greater Chastisement (in the Hereafter) that per chance (or possibly) they may turn

22.Hamid S. Aziz: And who is more unjust than he who is reminded of the revelations of his Lord, then he turns away from them? Surely We will requite the guilty

23.Hamid S. Aziz: And certainly We gave the Book to Moses, so be not in doubt concerning the receiving of it, and We made it a guide for the children of Israel

24.Hamid S. Aziz: And We made of them Imams (religious or spiritual leaders) to guide by Our command when they were patient, and they were certain of Our revelations

25.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Resurrection concerning that wherein they differ

26.Hamid S. Aziz: Does it not point out to them the right way, how many of the generations, in whose abodes they go about, did We destroy before them? Most surely there are signs in this; will they not then hear

27.Hamid S. Aziz: Do they not see that We drive the water to a land having no herbage, then We bring forth thereby crops of which their cattle and they themselves eat; will they not then see

28.Hamid S. Aziz: And they ask: "When will this judgment take place, if you are truthful?"

29.Hamid S. Aziz: Say: "On the Day of Judgment the faith of those who (now) disbelieve will not profit them, nor will they be reprieved."

30.Hamid S. Aziz: Therefore turn away from them and wait: surely they too are waiting

33.SurahEnglishNames: The Clans, The Coalition, The Combined Forces, The Allies

1.Hamid S. Aziz: O Prophet! Be careful of (your duty to) Allah and do not comply with the wishes of the disbelievers and the hypocrites; surely Allah is Knower, Wise

2.Hamid S. Aziz: And follow that which is inspired (revealed) to you from your Lord; surely Allah is Aware of what you do

3.Hamid S. Aziz: And rely on (or trust in) Allah; and Allah is sufficient for a Protector

4.Hamid S. Aziz: Allah has not made for any man two heart within him; nor has He made your wives, whose backs you liken to the backs of your mothers (whom you have divorced) as your mothers, nor has He made those whom you assert to be your sons your real sons; these are

5.Hamid S. Aziz: Proclaim their real relationship to their fathers; this is more equitable with Allah; but if you do not know their fathers, then they are your brethren in faith and your friends; and there is no blame on you concerning that in which you make mistakes, bu

6.Hamid S. Aziz: The Prophet is closer to (has a greater claim on) the faithful than they have on themselves, and his wives are (as) their mothers; and the possessors of (genetic) relationship have the better claim in the ordinance of Allah to inheritance, one with respe

7.Hamid S. Aziz: And when We made a covenant with the prophets and with you (Muhammad), and with Noah and Abraham and Moses and Jesus, son of Mary, We made with them a strong (solemn) covenant

8.Hamid S. Aziz: That He may question the Custodians of Truth about the truth (or the Loyal about loyalty), and He has prepared for the unfaithful a painful doom

9.Hamid S. Aziz: O you who believe! Call to mind the favour of Allah to you when there came down upon you hosts, so We sent against them a strong wind and hosts that you saw not, and Allah is Seer what you do

10.Hamid S. Aziz: When they came upon you from above you and from below you, and when the eyes turned dull, and the heart rose up to the throats, and you began to think vain thoughts of Allah

11.Hamid S. Aziz: There the believers were sorely tried and they were shaken with severe shaking

12.Hamid S. Aziz: And when the hypocrites and those in whose heart was a disease began to say, "Allah and His Apostle did not promise us nothing but delusion."

13.Hamid S. Aziz: And when a party of them said, "O people of Yathrib! there is no place to stand for you (here), therefore go back"; and a party of them asked permission of the Prophet, saying. "Surely our houses are exposed"; and they were not expose

14.Hamid S. Aziz: And if the enemy had entered upon them from the outlying parts of it, and they had been exhorted to treachery, they would certainly have done it, and they would have hesitated but little

15.Hamid S. Aziz: And certainly they had made a covenant with Allah before, that they would not turn their backs; and Allah´s covenant shall be answered for

16.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Flight shall not avail you if you flee from death or slaughter, and then you dwell in comfort but a little."

17.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, " Who is it that can withhold you from Allah if He intends to do you harm, or He intends to show you mercy? And they will not find for themselves besides Allah any friend or helper."

18.Hamid S. Aziz: Allah knows indeed those among you who hinder others and those who say to their brethren, "Come to us"; and they come not to the fight but a little

19.Hamid S. Aziz: Being niggardly in their help to you; but when fear comes, you will see them looking to you, their eyes rolling like one swooning unto death; but when the fear is gone they smite you with sharp tongues, being covetous of the goods (spoils of war). These

20.Hamid S. Aziz: They think the confederates (enemy clans) have not gone, and if the confederates should come (again) they would fain be in the deserts with the wandering Arabs (Bedouins) asking for news about you, and if they were among you they would not fight save a l

21.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, you have in the Messenger of Allah an excellent example for him who hopes in Allah and the Last Day and remembers Allah much

22.Hamid S. Aziz: And when the believers saw the Confederates, they said, "This is what Allah and His Apostle promised us, and Allah and His Apostle spoke the truth"; and it only increased them in faith and surrender (or obedience)

23.Hamid S. Aziz: Of the believers are men who are true to the covenant which they made with Allah: so of them is he who accomplished his vow, and of them is he who yet waits, and they have not changed in the least

24.Hamid S. Aziz: That Allah may reward the truthful for their truth, and punish the hypocrites if He please or relent towards them (mercifully); surely Allah is Forgiving, Merciful

25.Hamid S. Aziz: And Allah turned back the disbelievers in their rage; they did not obtain any advantage, and Allah sufficed the believers in their fight. Allah is Strong, Mighty

26.Hamid S. Aziz: And He brought down those of the People of the Book (Jews) who supported them, from their fortresses and He cast panic into their heart; some you killed and some you took captive

27.Hamid S. Aziz: And He made you heirs to their land and their dwellings and their property, and to a land which you have not yet trodden, and Allah has power over all things

28.Hamid S. Aziz: O Prophet! Say to your wives, "If you desire this world´s life and its adornment, then come, I will give you a provision and allow you to depart in a goodly manner

29.Hamid S. Aziz: "And if you desire Allah and His Messenger and the abode of the Hereafter, then surely Allah has prepared for the doers of good among you a mighty reward."

30.Hamid S. Aziz: O wives of the prophet! Whoever of you commits an open indecency, the punishment shall be increased to her doubly; and this is easy to Allah

31.Hamid S. Aziz: And whoever of you is obedient to Allah and His Messenger and does good, We will give to her a double reward, and We have prepared for her an honourable sustenance

32.Hamid S. Aziz: O wives of the Prophet! You are not like any other women; If you will be on your guard, then be not soft in your speech, lest he in whose heart is a disease yearn for you; and utter goodly (just, polite) speech

33.Hamid S. Aziz: And stay in your houses and do not display your finery like the displaying of the ignorance of yore; and keep up prayer, and pay the poor-rate, and obey Allah and His Messenger. Allah only desires to keep away uncleanness from you, O people of the Househ

34.Hamid S. Aziz: And keep in mind what is recited in your houses of the revelations of Allah and the wisdom. Verily, Allah is Subtile, Aware

35.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, men who surrender and the women who surrender, and the believing men and the believing women, and the obeying men and the obeying women, and the truthful men and the truthful women, and the patient men and the patient women and the humble men and

36.Hamid S. Aziz: And it behoves not a believing man and a believing woman that they should have any choice in their matter when Allah and His Messenger have decided a matter; and whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger, he surely goes astray in manifest error

37.Hamid S. Aziz: And when you said to him to whom Allah had shown favour and to whom you had shown a favour, "Keep your wife to yourself and be careful of (your duty to) Allah"; and you concealed in your soul what Allah would bring to light, and you feared men,

38.Hamid S. Aziz: There is no harm in the Prophet doing that which Allah has ordained for him; such has been the course of Allah with respect to those who have gone before; and the command of Allah is a decree that is made absolute

39.Hamid S. Aziz: Those who deliver the messages of Allah and fear Him, and do not fear any one but Allah; and Allah is sufficient to take account

40.Hamid S. Aziz: Muhammad is not the father of any of your men, but he is the Messenger of Allah and the Last of the prophets; and Allah is Aware of all things

41.Hamid S. Aziz: O you who believe! Remember Allah, remembering frequently

42.Hamid S. Aziz: And glorify Him morning and evening

43.Hamid S. Aziz: He it is Who sends His blessings on you, and so do His angels, that He may bring you forth out of utter darkness into the light; and He is Merciful to the believers

44.Hamid S. Aziz: Their salutation on the day that they meet Him shall be, "Peace", and He has prepared for them an honourable reward

45.Hamid S. Aziz: O Prophet! Surely We have sent you as a witness, and as a bearer of good news and as a Warner

46.Hamid S. Aziz: And as one inviting to Allah by His permission, and as a light-giving Lamp

47.Hamid S. Aziz: And give to the believers the good news that they shall have a great bounty from Allah

48.Hamid S. Aziz: And incline not to the disbelievers and the hypocrites. Disregard their annoying talk, and rely on Allah; and Allah is sufficient as a Trustee

49.Hamid S. Aziz: O you who believe! When you marry the believing women, and then divorce them before you touch them, then you have in their case no term (of waiting) to reckon; so make some provision for them and send them forth in a goodly manner

50.Hamid S. Aziz: O Prophet! Surely We have made lawful to you your wives whom you have given their dowries, and those whom your right hand possesses out of those whom Allah has given to you as prisoners of war, and the daughters of your paternal uncles and the daughters

51.Hamid S. Aziz: You may put off whom you please of them, and you may take to you whom you please, and whom you desire of those whom you had separated provisionally; no blame attaches to you; this is most proper, so that their eyes may be cool and they may not grieve, an

52.Hamid S. Aziz: It is not lawful to you to marry more women afterwards, nor that you should change them for other wives, though their beauty be pleasing to you, except what your right hand possesses and Allah is Watchful over all things

53.Hamid S. Aziz: O you who believe! Enter not the dwellings of the Prophet for a meal without waiting for the proper time, unless permission is given to you. But if you are invited, enter, and when the meal is ended, then disperse. Linger not for vain conversation; surel

54.Hamid S. Aziz: If you do a thing openly or do it in secret, then surely Allah is Aware of all things

55.Hamid S. Aziz: There is no blame on them in respect of their fathers, nor their brothers, nor their brothers´ sons, nor their sisters´ sons nor their own women, nor of what their right hands possess; and be careful of your duty to Allah; surely Allah is a w

56.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely Allah and His angels bless the Prophet; O you who believe! Call for Divine blessings on him and salute him with a becoming salutation

57.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely, those who speak evil things of Allah and His Messenger, Allah has cursed them in this world and the Hereafter, and He has prepared for them a humiliating chastisement

58.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who speak evil things of the believing men and the believing women undeservedly, they are guilty indeed of a false accusation and a manifest sin

59.Hamid S. Aziz: O Prophet! Say to your wives and your daughters and the women of the believers that they let down upon them their over-garments (cloaks); this will be more proper, that they may be known, and not be molested; and Allah is Forgiving, Merciful

60.Hamid S. Aziz: If the hypocrites and those in whose heart is a disease and the agitators in the city do not desist, We shall most certainly set you over them, then they shall not be your neighbours in it but for a little while

61.Hamid S. Aziz: Cursed: wherever they are found they shall be seized and slain without mercy

62.Hamid S. Aziz: (Such has been) the course of Allah with respect to those who have gone before; and you shall not find any change in the course of Allah

63.Hamid S. Aziz: Men ask you about the hour; say, "The knowledge of it is only with Allah, and what will make you understand?" - The Hour may be nigh

64.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely Allah has cursed the disbelievers and has prepared for them a blazing Fire

65.Hamid S. Aziz: Wherein they will abide forever (or a long time); they shall find no protecting friend or helper

66.Hamid S. Aziz: On the day when their faces shall be turned back into the fire, they shall say, "O would that we had obeyed Allah and obeyed the Messenger!"

67.Hamid S. Aziz: And they shall say, "O our Lord! Surely we obeyed our leaders and our great men, so they led us astray from the path

68.Hamid S. Aziz: "O our Lord! Give them a double punishment and curse them with a great curse."

69.Hamid S. Aziz: O you who believe! Be not like those who spoke evil things of Moses, but Allah cleared him of what they said, and he was worthy of regard with Allah

70.Hamid S. Aziz: O you who believe! Be careful of your duty to Allah and speak straight to the point

71.Hamid S. Aziz: He will put your deeds into a right state (correctly adjust, harmonise, make whole) for you, and forgive you your faults; and whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger, he indeed achieves a mighty success

72.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, We offered the trust to the heavens and the earth and the mountains, but they refused to undertake it, being afraid of it; but man undertook it. Lo! He has proved a tyrant and a fool

73.Hamid S. Aziz: So Allah will chastise the hypocritical men and the hypocritical women and the idolatrous men and the idolatrous women, and Allah will turn to (forgive and help) the believing men and women, and Allah is Forgiving, Merciful

1.Hamid S. Aziz: All praise is due to Allah, unto Whom belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth, and His is the praise in the Hereafter; and He is the Wise, the Aware

2.Hamid S. Aziz: He knows that which goes down into the earth and that which comes out of it, and that which comes down from the heaven and that which goes up to it; and He is the Merciful, the Forgiving

3.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who disbelieve say, "The hour shall not come upon us." Say, "Yea! By my Lord, the Knower of the Unseen, it shall certainly come upon you; not the weight of an atom becomes absent from Him, in the heavens or in the earth, and neit

4.Hamid S. Aziz: "That He may reward those who believe and do good; these it is for whom is forgiveness and a most generous sustenance."

5.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who strive hard in opposing Our revelations, these it is for whom is a painful and humiliating chastisement

6.Hamid S. Aziz: And those to whom knowledge has been given see that which has been revealed unto you from your Lord, that it is the truth, and it guides into the path of the Mighty, the Owner of Praise

7.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who disbelieve say, "Shall we point out to you a man who informs you that when you have disintegrated into dust and become scattered, even then you shall be created anew

8.Hamid S. Aziz: "He has forged a lie against Allah or there is madness in him. "Nay! Those who do not believe in the Hereafter are in torment and in great error

9.Hamid S. Aziz: Do they not then consider what is before them and what is behind them of the heaven and the earth? If We will We can make them disappear in the land or bring down upon them a portion from the heaven; most surely in this is a sign for every servant who tu

10.Hamid S. Aziz: And certainly We gave David grace from Us, saying, "O mountains! Echo his psalms of praise with him, and you birds also; and We made the iron pliant unto him

11.Hamid S. Aziz: Saying, "Make ample (coats of mail), and measure (balance well) the links, and do right; surely I am Seer of what you do

12.Hamid S. Aziz: And We made the wind (subservient) unto Solomon, which made a month´s journey in the morning and a month´s journey in the evening, and We made a fountain of molten copper to flow out for him, and of the Jinn (foreigners or ingenious skilled w

13.Hamid S. Aziz: They made for him what he pleased of temples and images, and bowls (large) as watering-troughs and cooking-pots that will not move from their place; give thanks, O family of David! Few of My servants are grateful

14.Hamid S. Aziz: But when We decreed death for him, naught showed them his death but a creature of the earth that ate away his staff; and when he fell down, the Jinn came to know plainly that if they had known the unseen, they would not have continued in abasing toil

15.Hamid S. Aziz: Certainly there was a sign for Sheba in their abode; two gardens on the right and the left; (as if to say) "Eat of the provisions of your Lord and give thanks to Him - a good land and an Indulgent Lord!"

16.Hamid S. Aziz: But they turned away, so We sent upon them a flood from Dams, and We converted their two gardens into two gardens yielding bitter fruit and tamarisk and a few lote-trees

17.Hamid S. Aziz: We requited them with this because they were ungrateful; do We ever punish any but the ungrateful

18.Hamid S. Aziz: And We set between them and the towns which We had blessed, other towns to be easily seen (in prominent positions), and for the journey between then We appointed proportional stages, (saying) "Travel through them secure by nights and days."

19.Hamid S. Aziz: And they said, "O our Lord! Make the spaces longer between our journeys.". They were unjust to themselves (wronged themselves) so We made them as stories (by words, legends) and dispersed them with an utter scattering; most surely there are sig

20.Hamid S. Aziz: And certainly Satan found true his calculations concerning them, so they follow him, except a party of the believers

21.Hamid S. Aziz: And he has no authority over them, but that We may distinguish him who believes in the Hereafter from him who is in doubt concerning it; and your Lord is the Watcher (Preserver) of all things

22.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Call upon those whom you assert (or set up) besides Allah; they do not control the weight of an atom in the heavens or in the earth nor have they any partnership in either, nor has He among them any one to help Him

23.Hamid S. Aziz: "And intercession will not avail at all with Him save of him whom He permits. Until when fear shall be removed from their heart, they shall say, ´What is it that your Lord said?´ They shall say, ´The truth.´ And He is the Mos

24.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Who gives you the sustenance from the heavens and the earth?" Say, "It is Allah. And most surely we or you are on a right way or in manifest error!"

25.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "You will not be questioned as to what we are guilty of, nor shall we be questioned as to what you do."

26.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Our Lord will gather us together, then will He judge between us with the truth; and He is the greatest Judge, the All-knowing."

27.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Show me those whom you have joined with Him as partners; by no means (can you do it). Nay! He is Allah, the Mighty, the Wise."

28.Hamid S. Aziz: And We have not sent you (Muhammad) but to all mankind (or as a Universal Messenger) as a bearer of good news and as a Warner, but most men know not

29.Hamid S. Aziz: And they say, "When will this promise be (fulfiled) if you are truthful?"

30.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "You have the appointment of a Day which you cannot hold back for an hour, nor can you bring it forward."

31.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who disbelieve say, "By no means will we believe in this Quran, nor in that which is before it "Could you but see when the unjust shall be made to stand before their Lord, casting blame one another! Those who were reckoned weak (or de

32.Hamid S. Aziz: Those who were proud shall say to those who were deemed weak (or despised), "Did we turn you away from the guidance after it had come to you? Nay, you (yourselves) were guilty."

33.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who were deemed weak (despised) shall say to those who were proud, "Nay, it was your scheming night and day when you told us to disbelieve in Allah and to set up rivals with Him." And they shall declare repentance when they see the pe

34.Hamid S. Aziz: And We never sent a Warner to a town but those who led lives in ease in it said, "We are surely disbelievers in what you are sent with

35.Hamid S. Aziz: And they say, "We have more wealth and children, and we shall not be punished."

36.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Surely my Lord amplifies the means of subsistence for whom He pleases and restricts it (for whom He pleases), but most men know not."

37.Hamid S. Aziz: It is not your wealth nor your children which bring you near Us in station, but whoever believes and does good, these it is for whom is a double reward for what they do, and they shall be secure in the highest places

38.Hamid S. Aziz: And as for those who strive in opposing Our revelations, they shall be brought to the chastisement

39.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Surely my Lord amplifies the means of subsistence for whom He pleases of His servants and restricts them (for whom He wills). And whatever you spend, He replaces it, and He is the best of Providers

40.Hamid S. Aziz: And on the Day when He will gather them all together, then will He say to the angels, "Did these people worship you?"

41.Hamid S. Aziz: They shall say, "Glory be to Thee! Thou art our Guardian, not they; nay! they worshipped the Jinn; most of them were believers in them."

42.Hamid S. Aziz: So on that day one of you shall not control profit or harm for another, and We will say to those who were unjust, "Taste the chastisement of the Fire which you denied."

43.Hamid S. Aziz: And when Our clear communications are recited to them, they say, "This is naught but a man who desires to turn you away from that which your fathers worshipped." And they say, "This is naught but a lie that is forged." And those who d

44.Hamid S. Aziz: And We have not given them (Arabs) any Books (Scripture) which they read, nor did We send to them before you a Warner

45.Hamid S. Aziz: And those before them rejected the truth, and these have not yet attained a tenth of what We gave them, yet they rejected My messenger, how terrible, then, was My rejection (abhorrence of them)

46.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "I exhort you only to one thing that you awake for Allah´s sake (or stand up before Allah) in twos or singly, then ponder: there is no madness in your companion (or comrade, fellow-citizen); he is only a Warner to you before a severe doom

47.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "I ask no reward for myself (Or whatever reward I have asked of you, is yours or is only for yourselves); my reward is only with Allah, and He is a witness of all things."

48.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Surely my Lord utters the truth (or castes the truth (over His servants)), He is the Knower of the unseen (or hidden)."

49.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "The truth has come, and the falsehood shall vanish and shall not return (or falsehood neither creates nor restores)."

50.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, " If I err, I err only against my own soul, and if I follow a right direction, it is because of what my Lord reveals to me; surely He is Hearing, Nigh

51.Hamid S. Aziz: Could you but see when they are terrified with no escape and are seized upon from near at hand

52.Hamid S. Aziz: And they shall say, "We believe in it (now)." But how can they reach faith from a position so far away from it

53.Hamid S. Aziz: (Seeing) they disbelieved in it before. And they aim at the unseen from afar off (with far out conjectures

54.Hamid S. Aziz: And a barrier shall be placed between them and that which they desire, as was done with the likes of them before: surely they are in hopeless (disquieting, distressing) doubt

1.Hamid S. Aziz: All praise is due to Allah, the Originator of the heavens and the earth, the Maker of the angels, messengers flying on wings, two, and three, and four (pairs); He increases in creation what He pleases; surely Allah has power over all things

2.Hamid S. Aziz: Whatever Allah grants to men of His mercy, there is none to withhold it, and what He withholds there is none to send it forth after that, and He is the Mighty, the Wis

3.Hamid S. Aziz: O men! Call to mind the favour of Allah on you; is there any creator besides Allah who gives you sustenance from the heaven and the earth? There is no God but He; whither are you then turned

4.Hamid S. Aziz: And if they call you a liar, truly messengers before you were called liars, and to Allah are all affairs returned

5.Hamid S. Aziz: O men! Surely the promise of Allah is true, therefore let not the life of this world deceive you, and let not the arch deceiver deceive you respecting Allah

6.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely Satan is your enemy, so take him for an enemy; he only invites his party to be inmates of the flaming Fire

7.Hamid S. Aziz: 35:7 As for those who disbelieve, they shall have a severe punishment, and as for those who believe and do good, they shall have forgiveness and a great reward

8.Hamid S. Aziz: What! Is he whose evil deed is made fair-seeming to him so that he considers it good (other than Satan´s dupe)? Now surely Allah sends astray whom He will and guides aright whom He will, so let not your soul waste away in grief (expire in sighing)

9.Hamid S. Aziz: And Allah is He Who sends the winds so they raise a cloud, then We drive it on to a dead country, and therewith We give life to the earth after its death; even so is the Resurrection

10.Hamid S. Aziz: Whoever desires power (or honour), then to Allah belongs the power (or honour) wholly. Unto Him do ascend good words, and good deeds does He exalt; and as for those who plan evil deeds, they shall have a severe chastisement; and their plans shall fail

11.Hamid S. Aziz: And Allah created you of dust, then of the life-germ, then He made you pairs; and no female bears, nor does she bring forth, except with His knowledge; and no one whose life is lengthened has his life lengthened, nor is aught diminished of one´s li

12.Hamid S. Aziz: And the two seas are not alike: the one fresh, sweet, pleasant to drink; and the other salt, that burns by its saltiness; yet from each of them you eat fresh flesh and bring forth ornaments which you wear; and you see the ships cleave through it that you

13.Hamid S. Aziz: He causes the night to enter in upon the day, and He causes the day to enter in upon the night, and He has made subservient the sun and the moon; each one follows its course to an appointed time; this is Allah, your Lord, His is the kingdom; and those wh

14.Hamid S. Aziz: If you call on them they shall not hear your call, and even if they could hear they shall not answer you; and on the Day of Resurrection they will deny your associating them (with Allah); and none can inform you like the One Who is Aware

15.Hamid S. Aziz: O men! You are they who are poor (stand in need of Allah), and Allah is He Who is the Self-sufficient (Absolute), the Owner of Praise

16.Hamid S. Aziz: If He will, He can remove you, and bring, instead a new creation

17.Hamid S. Aziz: And this is not hard for Allah

18.Hamid S. Aziz: And no burdened soul can bear the burden of another and if one weighed down by burden should cry (for help) to another, not aught of it shall be lifted, even though he be near of kin. You warn only those who fear their Lord in secret and keep up prayer;

19.Hamid S. Aziz: And the blind and the seeing are not alik

20.Hamid S. Aziz: Nor the darkness and the light

21.Hamid S. Aziz: Nor the shade and the heat

22.Hamid S. Aziz: Neither are the living and the dead alike. Surely Allah makes whom He pleases hear, and you cannot make those hear who are in the graves

23.Hamid S. Aziz: You  (Muhammad) are naught but a Warner

24.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely We have sent you (Muhammad) with the truth as a bearer of good news and a Warner; and there is not a people but a Warner has gone among them

25.Hamid S. Aziz: And if they call you a liar, so did, indeed, those before them (call their messengers a liar); their Messengers had come to them with clear arguments, and with scriptures, and with the illuminating book

26.Hamid S. Aziz: Then did I punish those who disbelieved, so how intense was My disapproval

27.Hamid S. Aziz: Do you not see that Allah sends down water from the cloud, then We bring forth therewith fruits of various colours; and in the mountains are streaks, white and red, of various hues and (others) intensely black

28.Hamid S. Aziz: And of men and beasts and cattle are likewise of various hues (or species). Only those of His servants who are possessed of knowledge fear Allah alone; surely Allah is Mighty, Forgiving

29.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely they who recite the Book of Allah and keep up prayer and spend out of what We have given them secretly and openly, hope for a gain which will not perish

30.Hamid S. Aziz: That He may pay them back fully their rewards and give them more out of His grace: surely He is Forgiving, Responsive (or Appreciative)

31.Hamid S. Aziz: And that which We have revealed to you of the Book, that is the Truth, confirming (verifying) that which was revealed before it; verily, Allah is Aware, Seer of His servants

32.Hamid S. Aziz: Then We gave the Book for an inheritance to those whom We chose from among Our servants; but of them is he who makes his soul to suffer a loss, and of them is he who takes a middle course, and of them is he who is foremost in deeds of goodness by Allah&a;

33.Hamid S. Aziz: Gardens of Eternity, they shall enter; they shall be made to wear therein bracelets of gold and pearls, and their dress therein shall be silk

34.Hamid S. Aziz: And they shall say: (All) praise is due to Allah, Who has made grief to depart from us; most surely our Lord is Forgiving, Bountiful

35.Hamid S. Aziz: Who has settled (established) us in Mansions of Eternity by His grace; toil touches us not therein, nor can fatigue afflict us

36.Hamid S. Aziz: And as for those who disbelieve, for them is the Fire of hell; it shall not finish them entirely so that they die, nor shall the chastisement thereof be lightened to them: even thus do We recompense every ungrateful one

37.Hamid S. Aziz: And they shall cry therein for succour, "O our Lord! Take us out, we will do good deeds, not the wrong which we used to do." Did We not preserve you alive long enough for him who reflected to reflect? And (also) Warners came to you; therefore t

38.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, Allah is the Knower of what is unseen in the heavens and the earth; surely He is Aware of what is in the heart

39.Hamid S. Aziz: He it is Who made you regents (inheritors and vicegerents) in the land; therefore whoever disbelieves, his disbelief is against himself; and their disbelief does not increase the disbelievers with their Lord in anything but hatred; and their disbelief do

40.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Have you considered the associates which you call upon besides Allah? Show me what part of the earth they have created, or have they any share in the heavens; or, have We given them a book so that they follow a clear argument thereof? Nay, the

41.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely Allah sustains the heavens and the earth lest they fail (deviate, collapse); and if they should fail, there is none who can uphold them after Him; surely He is the Forbearing, the Forgiving

42.Hamid S. Aziz: And they swore by Allah with the strongest of their oaths that if there came to them a Warner they would be better guided than any other nations; but when a Warner came to them, it increased them in nothing but aversion

43.Hamid S. Aziz: (Shown in their) behaving arrogantly in the land and in evil planning; and the evil plans beset none save the authors of it. Then should they wait for anything except the way of the former people? You will not find any alteration in the treatment of Alla

44.Hamid S. Aziz: Have they not travelled in the land and seen how was the end of those before them while they were stronger than these in power? And Allah is not such that any thing in the heavens or in the earth should escape Him; surely He is Knowing, Powerful

45.Hamid S. Aziz: And were Allah to punish men for what they deserve, He would not leave any creature on the surface of the earth, but He reprieves them till an appointed term; so when their doom shall come, then surely Allah is Seer of His servants

1.Hamid S. Aziz: Ya Seen

2.Hamid S. Aziz: I swear by the Quran full of wisdo

3.Hamid S. Aziz: Most surely you are one of the Messenger

4.Hamid S. Aziz: On a Straight Way

5.Hamid S. Aziz: A revelation of the Mighty, the Merciful

6.Hamid S. Aziz: That you may warn a people whose fathers were not warned, and so they are heedless

7.Hamid S. Aziz: Already has the word proved true of most of them, for they do not believe

8.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely We have placed chains on their necks, and these reach up to their chins, so they are stiff-necked

9.Hamid S. Aziz: And We have made before them a barrier and a barrier behind them, then We have covered them over so that they see not

10.Hamid S. Aziz: And it is alike to them whether you warn them or warn them not: they believe not

11.Hamid S. Aziz: You can only warn him who follows the Reminder (the Quran) and fears the Beneficent Allah in secret; so announce to him forgiveness and an honourable reward

12.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely We give life to the dead, and We write down what they have sent before and their footprints, and We have recorded everything in a Clear Record

13.Hamid S. Aziz: And set out to them a similitude: The ´Companions of the City´, when the messengers came to it

14.Hamid S. Aziz: When We sent to them two, they rejected both of them, then We strengthened (them) with a third, and they said, "Surely we are messengers to you."

15.Hamid S. Aziz: They said, "You are naught but mortals like ourselves, nor has the Beneficent Allah revealed anything; you only lie."

16.Hamid S. Aziz: They said, "Our Lord knows that we are most surely messengers to you

17.Hamid S. Aziz: "And nothing devolves on us but a clear deliverance (of the message)."

18.Hamid S. Aziz: They said, "Surely we augur (fear) evil from you; if you do not desist, we will certainly stone you, and there shall certainly afflict you a painful chastisement from us."

19.Hamid S. Aziz: They said, "Your evil omen (expectation, foreboding) is with yourselves. What! Is it because you are reminded? Nay, you are a people that transgress all bounds."

20.Hamid S. Aziz: And from the remote part of the city there came a man running, he said, "O my people! Follow the messengers

21.Hamid S. Aziz: "Follow him who does not ask you for reward, and who are the followers of the right course

22.Hamid S. Aziz: "And what reason have I that I should not serve Him Who brought me into existence? And to Him you shall be brought back

23.Hamid S. Aziz: "What! Shall I take besides Him gods whose intercession, if the Beneficent Allah should desire to afflict me with harm, shall not avail me aught, nor shall they be able to deliver me

24.Hamid S. Aziz: "Then truly I shall manifest (clear, obvious) error

25.Hamid S. Aziz: "Verily, I believe in your Lord, therefore hear me."

26.Hamid S. Aziz: It was said (unto him), "Enter the garden." He said, "O would that my people kne

27.Hamid S. Aziz: "Of that on account of which my Lord has forgiven me and made me of the honoured ones!"

28.Hamid S. Aziz: And We sent not down upon his people after him any hosts from heaven, nor do We need to send

29.Hamid S. Aziz: It was naught but a single Shout, and lo! They were still and silenced (extinct)

30.Hamid S. Aziz: Alas for the servants! There comes not to them a messenger but they mock at him

31.Hamid S. Aziz: Do they not consider how many of the generations have We destroyed before them, because they do not turn to them (the messengers) (or which return not unto the people)

32.Hamid S. Aziz: And all of them shall surely be brought before Us

33.Hamid S. Aziz: And a sign to them is the dead earth: We give life to it and bring forth from it grain so they eat of it

34.Hamid S. Aziz: And We make therein orchards of palms and grapevines and We make springs to flow forth in it,

35.Hamid S. Aziz: that they may eat of the fruit thereof, and their hands did not make it; will they not then be grateful

36.Hamid S. Aziz: Glory be to Him Who created pairs of all things, of what the earth grows, and of their kind and of what they know not

37.Hamid S. Aziz: And a sign to them is the night: We draw forth from it the day, then lo! They are in the dark

38.Hamid S. Aziz: And the sun runs on to a term appointed for it; that is the ordinance of the Mighty, the Knowing

39.Hamid S. Aziz: And as for the moon, We have ordained for it stages till it becomes again as an old dry palm leaf

40.Hamid S. Aziz: Neither is it allowable to the sun that it should overtake the moon, nor can the night outstrip the day; and all float on in their own orbits

41.Hamid S. Aziz: And a sign to them is that We bear their offspring in the laden vessels (or their race in an ark through the flood)

42.Hamid S. Aziz: And We have created for them the like of it, in which they ride

43.Hamid S. Aziz: And if We please, We can drown them, then there shall be no helper for them, nor shall they be rescued

44.Hamid S. Aziz: Unless by mercy from Us and for enjoyment for a time

45.Hamid S. Aziz: And when it is said to them, "Guard against what is before you and what is behind you, that per chance (or possibly) you may find mercy.... (they are heedless

46.Hamid S. Aziz: And there comes not to them a sign from among the signs of their Lord but they turn away from it

47.Hamid S. Aziz: And when it is said to them, "Spend of that which Allah has given you", those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Shall we feed him whom, if Allah please, He could feed? You are in naught but clear error."

48.Hamid S. Aziz: And they say, "When will this threat come to pass, if you are truthful?"

49.Hamid S. Aziz: They wait not for aught but a single Shout (or Blast) which will surprise them while they yet dispute with one another

50.Hamid S. Aziz: So they shall not be able to make a bequest, nor shall they return to their families

51.Hamid S. Aziz: And the trumpet shall be blown, when lo! From their graves they shall hasten on to their Lord

52.Hamid S. Aziz: They shall say, "O woe to us! Who has raised us up from our sleeping-place? This is what the Beneficent Allah promised and the messengers told the truth."

53.Hamid S. Aziz: It will be naught but a single Shout (or Blast), when lo! They shall all be brought before Us

54.Hamid S. Aziz: So this day no soul shall be dealt with unjustly in the least; and you shall not be rewarded aught but that which you did

55.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely the Companions of the Garden shall on that day be in happy occupation

56.Hamid S. Aziz: They and their wives (companions) shall be in shades, reclining on thrones of dignity

57.Hamid S. Aziz: They shall have fruits therein, and they shall have whatever they desire

58.Hamid S. Aziz: "Peace" - a word from a Merciful Lord

59.Hamid S. Aziz: "And get you hence this Day, O guilty ones!"

60.Hamid S. Aziz: "Did I not charge you, O children of Adam! That you should not serve Satan? Verily, he is your open enemy

61.Hamid S. Aziz: "And that you should serve only Me; this is the Straight Way."

62.Hamid S. Aziz: "And he certainly led astray a multitude of people from among you. What! Could you not then understand

63.Hamid S. Aziz: "This is the hell of which you were oft warned

64.Hamid S. Aziz: "Enter into it this day because you persisted in disbelief."

65.Hamid S. Aziz: On that Day We will set a seal upon their mouths, and their hands shall speak to Us, and their feet shall bear witness of what they earned

66.Hamid S. Aziz: And if We please We would certainly put out their eyes, then they would run about groping for the way, but how should they see

67.Hamid S. Aziz: And if We please We would surely transform them in their place, then they would not be able to go on, nor will they return (after error)

68.Hamid S. Aziz: And whomsoever We cause to live long, We reduce him to an abject state in constitution; do they not then understand

69.Hamid S. Aziz: And We have not taught him poetry, nor is it meet for him; it is nothing but a reminder and a plain (clarifying) Quran

70.Hamid S. Aziz: That it may warn him who would have life, and that the word may prove true against the disbelievers

71.Hamid S. Aziz: Do they not see that We have created cattle for them, out of what Our hands have wrought, so they are their masters

72.Hamid S. Aziz: And We have subjected them to them, so some of them they have to ride upon, and some of them they have for food

73.Hamid S. Aziz: And therein they have advantages and drinks; will they not then be grateful

74.Hamid S. Aziz: And they have taken gods besides Allah that they may be helped

75.Hamid S. Aziz: But they shall not be able to assist them, and they shall be a host brought up before them

76.Hamid S. Aziz: Therefore let not their speech grieve you; surely We know what they do in secret and what they do openly

77.Hamid S. Aziz: Does not man see that We have created him from a small seed? Then lo! He is an open disputant

78.Hamid S. Aziz: And he strikes out a likeness for Us and forgets his own creation. Says he, "Who will give life to the bones when they have decomposed?"

79.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "He will give life to them Who brought them into existence in the first place, and He is Knower of all (modes of) creation

80.Hamid S. Aziz: "He Who has made for you the fire from the green tree, so that with it you kindle (your own fire)

81.Hamid S. Aziz: Is not He Who created the heavens and the earth able to create the like of them? Yea! And He is the Creator (of all), the Knower

82.Hamid S. Aziz: His command, when He intends anything, is only to say to it, " Be", and it is

83.Hamid S. Aziz: Therefore glory be to Him in Whose hand is the kingdom of all things, and to Him you shall be brought back

37.SurahEnglishNames: Those Who Set The Ranks, Drawn up in Ranks, The Rangers

1.Hamid S. Aziz: I swear by those who draw themselves out in ranks

2.Hamid S. Aziz: Then those who drive away (evil or the wicked) with reproof (or strength)

3.Hamid S. Aziz: Then those who recite (proclaim), with mindfulness

4.Hamid S. Aziz: "Verily, verily your God is One

5.Hamid S. Aziz: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and what is between them, and Lord of the Easts (i.e. all the sun´s rising point)."

6.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely We have adorned the nearest heaven with an adornment, the stars

7.Hamid S. Aziz: And (there is) a safeguard against every rebellious Satan

8.Hamid S. Aziz: They cannot listen to the exalted assembly and they are thrown at from every side

9.Hamid S. Aziz: Being driven off, and for them is a perpetual chastisement

10.Hamid S. Aziz: Except him who snatches a fragment by stealth, then there follows him a brightly shining flame

11.Hamid S. Aziz: Then ask them whether they are stronger in creation or those (others) whom We have created. Surely We created them of plastic (malleable) clay

12.Hamid S. Aziz: Nay! You wonder while they mock

13.Hamid S. Aziz: And when they are reminded, they mind (heed) not

14.Hamid S. Aziz: And when they see a sign they incite one another to scoff

15.Hamid S. Aziz: And they say, "This is nothing but clear magic

16.Hamid S. Aziz: "What! When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then certainly be raised

17.Hamid S. Aziz: "Or our fathers of past times (ancestors)?"

18.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Aye! And you shall be abject (humiliated)."

19.Hamid S. Aziz: So it shall only be a single Shout, when lo! They shall see

20.Hamid S. Aziz: And they shall say, "O woe to us! This is the Day of Judgment."

21.Hamid S. Aziz: (A voice will say,) "This is the Day of the Judgment which you called a lie

22.Hamid S. Aziz: "Gather together those who were unjust and their associates, and what they used to worshi

23.Hamid S. Aziz: "Besides Allah, then lead them to the way to hell

24.Hamid S. Aziz: "And stop them, for they must be questioned

25.Hamid S. Aziz: "What ails you that you do not help each other?"

26.Hamid S. Aziz: Nay! On that day they shall be submissive

27.Hamid S. Aziz: And some of them shall advance towards others, questioning each other

28.Hamid S. Aziz: They shall say, "Surely you used to come to us from the right hand side."

29.Hamid S. Aziz: They shall say, "Nay, you (yourselves) were not believers

30.Hamid S. Aziz: "And we had no authority over you, but you were a wayward people

31.Hamid S. Aziz: "So the sentence of our Lord has come to pass against us: we shall surely taste (punishment)

32.Hamid S. Aziz: "We led you astray, for we were ourselves erring."

33.Hamid S. Aziz: So they shall on that day be sharers in the chastisement one with another

34.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely thus do We deal with the guilty

35.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely they used to behave arrogantly when it was said to them, "There is no God but Allah."

36.Hamid S. Aziz: And said, "What! Shall we indeed give up our gods for the sake of a mad poet?"

37.Hamid S. Aziz: Nay, he has come with the truth and verified the (messages of) the Messengers sent before him

38.Hamid S. Aziz: Most surely you will taste the painful punishment

39.Hamid S. Aziz: And you shall not be punished except for what you did

40.Hamid S. Aziz: Save the servants of Allah, the purified ones

41.Hamid S. Aziz: For them is a determined sustenance

42.Hamid S. Aziz: Fruits, and they shall be highly honoured

43.Hamid S. Aziz: In Gardens of Felicity

44.Hamid S. Aziz: On Thrones (of Dignity), facing each other

45.Hamid S. Aziz: A bowl shall be made to go round them from water running out of clear springs

46.Hamid S. Aziz: Crystal-white, delicious to those who drink

47.Hamid S. Aziz: There shall be no distress in it, nor shall they be exhausted therewith

48.Hamid S. Aziz: And with them shall be those of modest gaze with large beautiful eyes

49.Hamid S. Aziz: As if they were delicate eggs carefully protected

50.Hamid S. Aziz: Then shall some of them turn to others, questioning each other

51.Hamid S. Aziz: A speaker from among them shall say, "Surely I had a comrade on earth

52.Hamid S. Aziz: "Who said, ´What! are you indeed of those who bear witness to (the truth)

53.Hamid S. Aziz: "´What! When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then, indeed, be brought to judgment?´"

54.Hamid S. Aziz: (A voice) Will say, "Will you look down?"

55.Hamid S. Aziz: Then he looked down and saw him in the midst of hell

56.Hamid S. Aziz: He shall say (to the sceptic), "By Allah! You had almost caused me to perish

57.Hamid S. Aziz: "And had it not been for the grace of my Lord, I would certainly have been among those brought there

58.Hamid S. Aziz: "Is it then true that we shall not die

59.Hamid S. Aziz: "Except our previous death? And that we shall not be chastised?"

60.Hamid S. Aziz: Most surely this is the supreme achievement

61.Hamid S. Aziz: For the like of this then let the workers work

62.Hamid S. Aziz: Is this better as an entertainment or the tree of Zaqqum (having bitter fruit)

63.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely We have made it to be a trial to the unjust

64.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely it is a tree that grows in the bottom of hell

65.Hamid S. Aziz: Its produce is as it were the heads of the serpents (or devils)

66.Hamid S. Aziz: Then verily, they shall eat of it and fill (their) bellies with it

67.Hamid S. Aziz: Then afterwards they shall drink a mixture prepared in boiling water

68.Hamid S. Aziz: Then most surely their return shall be to hell

69.Hamid S. Aziz: Certainly, they found their fathers going astray

70.Hamid S. Aziz: So in their footsteps they hasten on

71.Hamid S. Aziz: And certainly most of the ancients went astray before them

72.Hamid S. Aziz: And certainly We sent among them Warners

73.Hamid S. Aziz: Then see what was the end of those who were warned

74.Hamid S. Aziz: Except the servants of Allah, the purified ones

75.Hamid S. Aziz: And Noah did certainly call upon Us, and the most gracious of Hearer of prayer are We

76.Hamid S. Aziz: And We delivered him and his followers from the mighty distress

77.Hamid S. Aziz: And We made his offspring the survivors

78.Hamid S. Aziz: And We perpetuated to him praise among the later generations

79.Hamid S. Aziz: (This blessing) "Peace and salutation to Noah among the nations"

80.Hamid S. Aziz: Thus do We surely reward the doers of good

81.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely he was of Our believing servants

82.Hamid S. Aziz: Then did We drown the other

83.Hamid S. Aziz: And most surely Abraham followed his way

84.Hamid S. Aziz: When he came to his Lord with a whole (sound, pure) heart

85.Hamid S. Aziz: When he said to his father and his people, " What is it that you worship?"

86.Hamid S. Aziz: "Is it lies - gods besides Allah - that you desire

87.Hamid S. Aziz: "What is then your idea about the Lord of the Worlds?"

88.Hamid S. Aziz: Then he looked at the stars, looking up once

89.Hamid S. Aziz: Then he said, "Verily, I am sick (at heart of your worshipping these)."

90.Hamid S. Aziz: So they turned their backs and went away

91.Hamid S. Aziz: Then he turned to their gods secretly and said, "What! Do you not eat

92.Hamid S. Aziz: "What is the matter with you that you do not speak?"

93.Hamid S. Aziz: Then he attacked them, smiting them with his right hand

94.Hamid S. Aziz: So they (people) advanced towards him, hastening

95.Hamid S. Aziz: Said he, "Worship you what you yourselves carve out

96.Hamid S. Aziz: "When Allah has created you and what you make?"

97.Hamid S. Aziz: They said, "Build for him a furnace, then cast him into the burning fire."

98.Hamid S. Aziz: And they designed a plot against him, but We brought them low

99.Hamid S. Aziz: And he said, "Surely I flee to my lord; He will guide me

100.Hamid S. Aziz: "My Lord! Grant me those who do good deeds."

101.Hamid S. Aziz: So We gave him the good news of a gentle son

102.Hamid S. Aziz: And when his son was old enough to work with him, he said, "O my son! Surely I have seen in a dream that I should sacrifice you; consider then what do you think." He said. "O my father! Do what you are commanded; if Allah wills, you will f

103.Hamid S. Aziz: So when they had both Surrendered (unto Allah in Islam) and he threw him down upon his face

104.Hamid S. Aziz: And We called out to him saying, "O Abraham

105.Hamid S. Aziz: You have indeed fulfiled the vision; surely thus do We reward the doers of good

106.Hamid S. Aziz: Most surely this is a manifest trial

107.Hamid S. Aziz: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice

108.Hamid S. Aziz: And We perpetuated to him among the later generations

110.Hamid S. Aziz: Thus do We reward the doers of good

111.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely he was one of Our believing servants

112.Hamid S. Aziz: And We gave him the good news of Isaac, a prophet among the righteous

113.Hamid S. Aziz: And We showered Our blessings on him and on Isaac; and of their offspring are some who do good, and also some who are clearly unjust to their own souls

114.Hamid S. Aziz: And certainly We conferred a favour on Moses and Aaron

115.Hamid S. Aziz: And We delivered them both and their people from the mighty distress

116.Hamid S. Aziz: And We helped them, so they became the victors

117.Hamid S. Aziz: And We gave them both the Book that clarifies

118.Hamid S. Aziz: And We guided them both on the Straight Way

119.Hamid S. Aziz: And We perpetuated to them among the later generations

120.Hamid S. Aziz: (This blessing) "Peace be on Moses and Aaron"

121.Hamid S. Aziz: Even thus do We reward the doers of good

122.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely they were both of Our believing servants

123.Hamid S. Aziz: And Elias was most surely one of those sent

124.Hamid S. Aziz: When he said to his people, "Do you not guard (against evil)

125.Hamid S. Aziz: "What! Do you call upon Baal and forsake the best of Creators

126.Hamid S. Aziz: "Allah, your Lord and the Lord of your fathers of past times (ancestors)?"

127.Hamid S. Aziz: But they called him a liar, therefore they shall most surely be brought forth (to the doom)

128.Hamid S. Aziz: But not the servants of Allah, the purified ones

129.Hamid S. Aziz: And We perpetuated to him among the later generations

131.Hamid S. Aziz: Even thus do We reward the doers of good

132.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely he was one of Our believing servants

133.Hamid S. Aziz: And Lot was most surely one of those sent

134.Hamid S. Aziz: When We delivered him and his followers, everyon

135.Hamid S. Aziz: Except an old woman who was amongst those who lingered behind

137.Hamid S. Aziz: And most surely you pass by their (ruins) in the morning

138.Hamid S. Aziz: And at night; do you not then understand

139.Hamid S. Aziz: And Jonah was most surely of those sent

140.Hamid S. Aziz: When he ran away to a ship completely laden

141.Hamid S. Aziz: Then he drew lots, but was of those rejected

142.Hamid S. Aziz: And the fish swallowed him while he was blameworthy

143.Hamid S. Aziz: But had it not been that he was of those who glorify (Us)

144.Hamid S. Aziz: He would certainly have tarried in its belly to the day when they are raised

145.Hamid S. Aziz: Then We cast him on to the desert shore while he was sick

146.Hamid S. Aziz: And We caused a gourd plant to grow above him

147.Hamid S. Aziz: And We sent him to a hundred thousand folk or more

148.Hamid S. Aziz: And they believed; therefore, We gave them provision for a time

149.Hamid S. Aziz: Now ask them (O Muhammad) has your Lord daughters while they have sons

150.Hamid S. Aziz: Or did We create the angels females while they were witnesses

151.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, it is of their own lies that they say

152.Hamid S. Aziz: "Allah has begotten"; and most surely they are liars

153.Hamid S. Aziz: Has He chosen daughters in preference to sons

154.Hamid S. Aziz: What ails you, how is it that you judge

156.Hamid S. Aziz: Or have you a clear authority

157.Hamid S. Aziz: Then bring your book (writ, record), if you are truthful

158.Hamid S. Aziz: And they assert a relationship between Him and the Jinn; and certainly the Jinn do know that they shall surely be brought forth

159.Hamid S. Aziz: Glory be to Allah from all that they attribute (unto Him)

160.Hamid S. Aziz: But not so the servants of Allah, the purified ones

161.Hamid S. Aziz: So surely you and what you worship

162.Hamid S. Aziz: Cannot lead into temptation anyone against Him

163.Hamid S. Aziz: Save him who will go to hell

164.Hamid S. Aziz: (The angels or those who are ranged in ranks say,) "And there is none of us but has an assigned place

165.Hamid S. Aziz: "Verily, we, even we, are they who draw out in ranks

166.Hamid S. Aziz: "Verily, we, even we, are they who declare the glory (of Allah)."

167.Hamid S. Aziz: And there are those who used to say

168.Hamid S. Aziz: "Had we a reminder from those of yore

169.Hamid S. Aziz: "We would certainly have been the single-minded servants of Allah

170.Hamid S. Aziz: But (now that it is come) they disbelieve in it; but they will come to know

171.Hamid S. Aziz: And certainly Our word has already gone forth before this unto Our servants sen

172.Hamid S. Aziz: That most surely they shall be helpe

173.Hamid S. Aziz: And most surely Our host alone shall be the victorious ones

174.Hamid S. Aziz: Therefore, turn away from them till a time

175.Hamid S. Aziz: And watch, for they will soon come to see

176.Hamid S. Aziz: What! Would they then hasten Our chastisement

177.Hamid S. Aziz: But when it descends on them, evil will then be the morning for those who have been warned

178.Hamid S. Aziz: And turn away from them for a tim

179.Hamid S. Aziz: And watch, for they will soon come to see

180.Hamid S. Aziz: Glorified be your Lord, the Lord of Majesty, above all that which they attribute (unto Him)

181.Hamid S. Aziz: And peace be unto those who are sent

182.Hamid S. Aziz: And all praise be to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds

1.Hamid S. Aziz: Sad. (I swear) By the Quran, full of Zikr (remembrance in reverence and praising Allah, admonition, reciting, teaching, giving the message)

2.Hamid S. Aziz: Nay! But those who disbelieve are in self-exaltation (pride) and separatism (schism)

3.Hamid S. Aziz: How many generations did We destroy before them, then they cried when there was no longer time to escape

4.Hamid S. Aziz: And they marvel that there has come to them a Warner from among themselves, and the disbelievers say: "This is an enchanter, a liar"

5.Hamid S. Aziz: What! Makes he a single God out of the many gods? A strange thing is this, to be sure

6.Hamid S. Aziz: And the leaders among them go about exhorting, "Go and remain constant to your gods; for this is most surely a thing designed against you

7.Hamid S. Aziz: "We never heard of this in the former faith; this is nothing but an invention

8.Hamid S. Aziz: "Has the reminder been revealed to him alone from among us?" Nay! They are in doubt as to My reminder. Nay! They have not yet tasted My chastisement

9.Hamid S. Aziz: Or is it that they have the treasures of the mercy of your Lord, the Mighty, the Bestower

10.Hamid S. Aziz: Or is it that theirs is the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and what is between them? Then let them ascend by rope

11.Hamid S. Aziz: But there they shall be put to flight, even as a confederated host

12.Hamid S. Aziz: The people of Noah before them denied the messengers and so did the people of A´ad, and Pharaoh, the Lord of Stakes (of stability)

13.Hamid S. Aziz: And the people of Thamud and the people of Lot and the Companions of the Woods; these were the factions

14.Hamid S. Aziz: There was none of them but denied the messengers, therefore, just was My retribution

15.Hamid S. Aziz: These wait aught but a single Shout, which brooks no delay

16.Hamid S. Aziz: And they say, "Our Lord! Hasten on to us our portion before the Day of Reckoning."

17.Hamid S. Aziz: Bear patiently what they say, and remember Our servant David, the possessor of power; surely he was frequent in turning (to Allah)

18.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely We made the mountains sing the glory (of Allah) in unison with him at nightfall and sunrise

19.Hamid S. Aziz: And the birds gathered together; all joined in singing with him

20.Hamid S. Aziz: And We strengthened his kingdom and We gave him wisdom and a clear judgment

21.Hamid S. Aziz: And has there come to you the story of the Disputants (litigants), when they made an entry into the private chamber by ascending over the walls

22.Hamid S. Aziz: When they entered in upon David and he was frightened by them, they said, "Fear not; we are two litigants, of whom one has acted wrongfully towards the other, therefore decide between us with justice, and do not act unjustly, and guide us to the rig

23.Hamid S. Aziz: "Lo! This is my brother; he has ninety-nine ewes and I have but one; but he said, ´Give to me´, and he has prevailed against me in discourse."

24.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "Surely he has been unjust to you in demanding your ewe (to add) to his own ewes. Lo! Many partners act wrongfully towards one another, except those who believe and do good, and very few are they." And David was sure that We had tried

25.Hamid S. Aziz: Therefore, We rectified for him this lapse, and most surely he had nearness to Us and an excellent journey´s end (return)

26.Hamid S. Aziz: "O David! Surely We have made you a Vicegerent in the land; so judge between men with justice and follow not desire, lest it should lead you astray from the path of Allah. Lo! Those who go astray from the path of Allah, they shall surely have a seve

27.Hamid S. Aziz: And We create not the heaven and the earth and that which is between them in vain; that is the opinion of those who disbelieve; then woe to those who disbelieve because of the Fire

28.Hamid S. Aziz: Shall We treat those who believe and do good like the mischief-makers in the earth? Or shall We make those who guard (against evil) like the wicked

29.Hamid S. Aziz: (It is) a Book We have revealed to you abounding in good that they may ponder over its verses, and that those endowed with understanding may reflect

30.Hamid S. Aziz: And We bestowed on David, Solomon, a most excellent servant! Surely he was frequent in turning (to Allah)

31.Hamid S. Aziz: Lo! There were brought to him. in the evening, horses still when standing, swift when running

32.Hamid S. Aziz: And he said, "Surely I have preferred the good things (of the world) over (or because of) the remembrance of my Lord." - until they were taken out of sight behind a veil (or the sun was hidden behind the veil of night)

33.Hamid S. Aziz: (Then he said,) "Bring them back to me"; and he began to slash (or stroke) their legs and necks

34.Hamid S. Aziz: And certainly We tried Solomon, and We put on his throne a mere (soulless) body; then did he repent

35.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "My Lord! Do you forgive me and grant me a kingdom which (may be) suits not anyone after me; for you are the Bestower of Bounties

36.Hamid S. Aziz: Then We made the wind subservient to him; it made his command to run gently wherever he desired

37.Hamid S. Aziz: And the devils (the unruly), every builder and diver

38.Hamid S. Aziz: And others fettered in chains

39.Hamid S. Aziz: (Saying,) "These are Our Bounties (gift), therefore give freely or withhold, without reckoning."

40.Hamid S. Aziz: And most surely he had a nearness to Us and an excellent journey´s end (return)

41.Hamid S. Aziz: And remember Our servant Job, when he called upon his Lord saying, "The devil has afflicted me with distress and torment."

42.Hamid S. Aziz: (It was said unto him) "Strike with your foot; here is a cool, refreshing washing-place and a drink."

43.Hamid S. Aziz: And We gave him back his people and doubled their number, as a mercy from Us, and as a reminder to those possessed of understanding

44.Hamid S. Aziz: And (It was said,) "Take in your hand a green branch (or grass) and beat her (his rebellious wife gently) with it (rather than with cruelty), and break not your oath. Surely We found him patient; a most excellent servant! Surely he was frequent in t

45.Hamid S. Aziz: And remember Our servants Abraham and Isaac and Jacob, men of power and vision

46.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely, We purified them with a pure thought, the remembrance of the Home of the Hereafter

47.Hamid S. Aziz: And most surely they were, in Our sight, of the company of the elect, the excellent

48.Hamid S. Aziz: And remember Ishmael and Elisha and Zul-Kifl - all were of the Company of the Good (or Chosen)

49.Hamid S. Aziz: This is a reminder; and most surely there is an excellent destination for those who guard (against evil)

50.Hamid S. Aziz: The Gardens of Eternity, whose doors are opened for them

51.Hamid S. Aziz: Wherein reclining, they call for many fruits and cool drink therein

52.Hamid S. Aziz: And with them shall be those restrained (modest) eyes, companions equal in age

53.Hamid S. Aziz: This is what you are promised for the Day of Reckoning

54.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, this in truth is Our provision which will never fail

55.Hamid S. Aziz: This (shall be so for the righteous). And lo! There is an evil destination for the transgressors

56.Hamid S. Aziz: Hell; they will burn in it, an evil resting-place

57.Hamid S. Aziz: This (shall be so); then shall they taste it, boiling and intensely cold

58.Hamid S. Aziz: And other (punishment) of similar kind in pairs (of the two extremes)

59.Hamid S. Aziz: Here is an army plunging in without consideration along with you; no welcome for them; surely they shall burn in the Fire

60.Hamid S. Aziz: They shall say, "Nay! Thee too! No welcome for you: it is you who have brought this upon us; evil is this resting-place."

61.Hamid S. Aziz: They shall say, "Our Lord! Whoever prepared it first for us, add you to him a double chastisement in the Fire."

62.Hamid S. Aziz: And they shall say, "What ails us that we do not see men whom we used to count among the wicked

63.Hamid S. Aziz: "Was it that we took them wrongly in scorn, or have our eyes missed them

64.Hamid S. Aziz: Verily, this is the truth - the mutual wrangling of the inmates of the fire

65.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "I am only a Warner, and there is no God but Allah, the One, the Absolute (or Supreme and Irresistible)

66.Hamid S. Aziz: "The Lord of the heavens and the earth and that which is between them, the Mighty Enforcer, the most Forgiving

67.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "It is a message of great importance

68.Hamid S. Aziz: "From which you are turning away

69.Hamid S. Aziz: "1 had no knowledge of the Exalted Chiefs (in heaven) when they discussed (affairs)

70.Hamid S. Aziz: "Naught is revealed to me save this, that I am a plain Warner."

71.Hamid S. Aziz: Behold, your Lord said to the angels; Surely I am going to create a mortal from dust (or clay)

72.Hamid S. Aziz: So when I have fashioned him in due proportions and breathed into him of My spirit, then fall down making obeisance unto him

73.Hamid S. Aziz: And the angels did obeisance, all of them

74.Hamid S. Aziz: But not Iblis: he was too proud and became one of the disbelievers

75.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "O Iblis! What prevented you from doing obeisance to him whom I created with My two hands? Are you too proud or are you of the Exalted Ones?"

76.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "I am better than he; Thou hast created me of Fire, and him Thou did create of dust (or clay)."

77.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "Then get you hence, for lo! you are outcast

78.Hamid S. Aziz: "And surely My curse is on you till the Day of Judgment."

79.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "My Lord! then reprieve me till the day that they are raised."

80.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "Surely you are of the reprieved ones

81.Hamid S. Aziz: "Until the Day of the time appointed."

82.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "Then by Thy Might I will surely beguile (tempt them to evil), every one

83.Hamid S. Aziz: "Except Thy single-minded servants from among them, the purified ones."

84.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "The Truth Is, and the Truth I speak

85.Hamid S. Aziz: "That I will most certainly fill hell with you and with those among them who follow you, every one."

86.Hamid S. Aziz: Say (O Muhammad unto mankind), "I do not ask you for any reward for it; nor am I of the impostors

87.Hamid S. Aziz: "Lo! It (the Quran) is nothing but a reminder for all peoples (nations)

88.Hamid S. Aziz: "And you will, in time, come to know the truth thereof."

1.Hamid S. Aziz: The revelation of this Book is from Allah, the Mighty, the Wise

2.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely We have revealed to you the Book with the truth, therefore serve Allah, being sincere to Him in obedience (or making religion pure for Him only)

3.Hamid S. Aziz: Now, surely, sincere obedience (or pure religion) is due to Allah alone and those who take guardians besides Him, say, "We serve them only that they may bring us nearer to Allah". Surely Allah will judge between them in that in which they diffe

4.Hamid S. Aziz: If Allah desire to take a son to Himself, He will surely choose those He pleases from what He has created. Glory be to Him: He is Allah, the One, the Absolute

5.Hamid S. Aziz: He has created the heavens and the earth with Truth; He makes the night cover the day and makes the day overtake the night, and He has made the sun and the moon subservient; each one runs on to an assigned term; now surely is He not the Mighty, the great

6.Hamid S. Aziz: He has created you from a single being, then made its mate of the same (kind), and He has made for you eight of the cattle in pairs. He creates you in the wombs of your mothers, a creation after a creation, in triple darkness; that is Allah your Lord, Hi

7.Hamid S. Aziz: If you are ungrateful, then surely Allah is Independent (or self-sufficient) above all need of you; though He does not like ungratefulness in His servants; and if you are grateful, He is pleased with you; and no bearer of burden shall bear the burden of

8.Hamid S. Aziz: And when distress afflicts a man he calls upon his Lord turning to Him frequently; then when He makes him possess a favour from Him, he forgets that for which he called upon Him before, and sets up rivals to Allah that he may cause (men) to stray off His

9.Hamid S. Aziz: What! Is he who is obedient during hours of the night, prostrating himself and standing, takes heed of the Hereafter and hopes for the mercy of his Lord (like one who does not)! Say: Are those who know and those who do not know alike? But only the men of

10.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "O my servants who believe! Be careful of (your duty to) your Lord; for those who do good in this world there is good, and Allah´s earth is spacious; only the patient will be paid a reward without measure."

11.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "I am commanded that I should worship (serve) Allah, being sincere to Him in obedience (or making religion pure for Him only)

12.Hamid S. Aziz: And I am commanded that I shall be the foremost of those who Surrender (in Islam)."

13.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "I would, if I disobey my Lord, indeed fear the chastisement of a grievous Day."

14.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Allah (it is Whom) I serve, being sincere to Him in my exclusive devotion

15.Hamid S. Aziz: "Serve you what you like besides Him." Say, "The losers surely are those who shall have lost their own souls and their people on the Day of Resurrection; now surely that is the real (or manifest) loss."

16.Hamid S. Aziz: They shall have coverings (layers) of fire above them and coverings (layers) beneath them; with this, Allah appals His servants, so be careful of (your duty to) Me, O My servants

17.Hamid S. Aziz: And as for those who put away false gods, lest they should worship them and turn to Allah, they shall have good news. Therefore give good news to My servants

18.Hamid S. Aziz: Those who listen to the Word (or advice) then follow the best (meaning) of it; those are they whom Allah has guided, and those it is who are the men of understanding

19.Hamid S. Aziz: What! Is he against whom the sentence of chastisement is justly due (equal to one who avoids evil): What! Can you save him who is in the Fire

20.Hamid S. Aziz: But those who are careful of (their duty to) their Lord, they shall have high places, above them are built higher places, beneath which rivers flow - (this is) the promise of Allah: Allah will not fail in (His) promise

21.Hamid S. Aziz: Do you not see that Allah sends down water from the cloud, then makes it go along in the earth in springs, then brings forth therewith herbage of various colours, then it withers so that you see it becoming yellow, then He makes it dry up and crumble? Mo

22.Hamid S. Aziz: What! Is he whose heart Allah has opened to the Surrender (Islam) so that he is in a light from his Lord (like him who is hard-hearted)? Nay, woe to those whose heart are hard against the remembrance of Allah; those are in clear error

23.Hamid S. Aziz: Allah has revealed the best of announcements (messages), a Scripture self-consistent in its various parts, repeating, whereat do shudder (or thrill) the skins of those who fear their Lord, so that their skins and their heart soften (or become pliant) to

24.Hamid S. Aziz: Is then he who has to face the awful doom on the Day of Resurrection (as he who does right)? And it will be said to the unjust, "Taste what you earned."

25.Hamid S. Aziz: Those before them (also) denied (the prophets or the revelation, the message), therefore there came to them the chastisement from whence they perceived not

26.Hamid S. Aziz: So Allah made them taste disgrace (or humiliation) in the life of this world, and certainly the punishment of the Hereafter is greater; did they but know

27.Hamid S. Aziz: And certainly We have set forth to men in this Quran similitudes of every sort that they may reflect

28.Hamid S. Aziz: A Lecture (Quran) in Arabic, without any crookedness, that they may guard (against evil)

29.Hamid S. Aziz: Allah sets forth a similitude: There is a slave who belongs to several partners, differing (or quarrelling) with one another, and there is another slave wholly owned by one man. Are the two alike in condition? (All) praise is due to Allah. Nay! most of t

30.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely you shall die and they too shall surely die

31.Hamid S. Aziz: Then lo! On the Day of Resurrection your disputes will be settled before your Lord

32.Hamid S. Aziz: Who is then more unjust than he who utters a lie against Allah and he who gives the lie to the truth when it comes to him; is there not in hell an abode for the disbelievers

33.Hamid S. Aziz: And he who brings the truth and he who accepts it as the truth, these are they that guard (against evil)

34.Hamid S. Aziz: They shall have with their Lord what they please; that is the reward of the doers of good

35.Hamid S. Aziz: So that Allah will do away with the worst of what they did and give them their reward for the best of what they do

36.Hamid S. Aziz: Is not Allah sufficient for His servant? And they seek to frighten you with those besides Him; and whomsoever Allah sends astray, there is no guide for him

48.Hamid S. Aziz: And away from them shall go what they called upon before, and they shall know for certain that there is no escape for them

49.Hamid S. Aziz: Man is never tired of praying for good, and if evil touch him, then he is despairing, hopeless

50.Hamid S. Aziz: And verily, if We make him taste mercy from Us after distress that has touched him, he would say, "This is of me, and I do not think the Hour will come to pass, and if I am sent back to my Lord, I shall have with Him sure good." But We will mos

51.Hamid S. Aziz: And when We show favour to man, he turns aside and withdraws himself; and when evil touches him, he makes lengthy supplications

52.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Bethink you: if it is from Allah and you reject it, who is in greater error than he who is in open feud (or schism or opposition)

53.Hamid S. Aziz: We will soon show them Our signs on the horizons (in the Universe) and within themselves (or their own souls), until it become manifest unto them that it is the truth. Is not your Lord sufficient , since He is Witness over all things

54.Hamid S. Aziz: What! Are they still in doubt about the meeting with their Lord? What! Does He not encompass (surround and penetrate) all things

1.Hamid S. Aziz: Ha Mim. (Two mystical letters in Arabic

2.Hamid S. Aziz: Ain Sin Qaf. (Three more mystical letters
