6.Hamid S. Aziz: And as for those who take guardians besides Him, Allah watches over them, and you are not in charge over them

7.Hamid S. Aziz: And thus have We revealed to you an Arabic Lecture (Quran), that you may warn the Mother City (Mecca) and those around it, and that you may give warning of the Day of Gathering wherein is no doubt; when some will be in the Garden and some in the burning

8.Hamid S. Aziz: And if Allah had willed He would surely have made them a single community, but He makes whom He wills enter into His mercy, and the unjust it is that shall have no guardian or helper

9.Hamid S. Aziz: Or have they taken guardians besides Him? But Allah, He is the Guardian, and He gives life to the dead, and He has power over all things

10.Hamid S. Aziz: And in whatever thing you disagree, the judgment thereof is in the hands of Allah; such is Allah, my Lord, on Him do I trust and to Him do I turn

11.Hamid S. Aziz: The Originator of the heavens and the earth, He made pairs for you from among yourselves, and pairs of the cattle too, multiplying you thereby. There is no thing like unto Him; and He is the Hearer, the Seer

12.Hamid S. Aziz: His are the treasures of the heavens and the earth; He expands or restricts the means of subsistence for whom He wills; verily, He is Aware of all things

13.Hamid S. Aziz: He has ordained for you the religion which He enjoined upon Noah and that which We have revealed to you (Muhammad) and that which We enjoined upon Abraham and Moses and Jesus, saying, "Establish religion (obedience) and be not divided therein. Dread

14.Hamid S. Aziz: And they did not become divided until after knowledge had come to them out of rivalry among themselves; and had not a Word already gone forth from your Lord for an appointed term, certainly judgment would have been given between them; and those who were

15.Hamid S. Aziz: Therefore, unto this (scripture) then go on inviting, and be you upright and steadfast as you are commanded, and follow not their vain desires, and say, "I believe in what Allah has revealed of the Book, and I am commanded to do justice between you:

16.Hamid S. Aziz: And as for those who dispute about Allah after that obedience has been rendered to Him, their dispute is futile with their Lord, and upon them is wrath, and for them is a terrible penalty

17.Hamid S. Aziz: Allah it is Who revealed the Book with truth, and the Balance, and what shall make you realise that perhaps the Hour be nigh

18.Hamid S. Aziz: Those who do not believe in it would hasten it on, and those who believe are in awe of it, and they know that it is the truth. Now most surely those who dispute obstinately concerning the Hour are in a great error

19.Hamid S. Aziz: Gracious is Allah to His servants; He gives sustenance to whom He pleases, and He is the Strong, the Mighty

20.Hamid S. Aziz: Whoever desires the tilth (means of harvest, gain) of the Hereafter, We will give him increase in it; and whoever desires the tilth (means of harvest, gain) of this world, We give him of it, and in the Hereafter he has no portion

21.Hamid S. Aziz: Or have they partners for Allah who have prescribed for them a religion that Allah permits not? Had it not been for the Word of Decision judgment would have certainly been given between them; but verily the wrong-doers shall have a painful doom

22.Hamid S. Aziz: you see  the wrong-doers fearful on account of what they have earned, and it must necessarily befall them; and those who believe and do good shall be in the luxurious meadows of the Gardens; they shall have what they please with their Lord: that is the g

23.Hamid S. Aziz: That is of which Allah gives the good news to His servants, those who believe and do good deeds. Say (O Muhammad), "I do not ask of you any reward for it but love for my near relatives"; and whoever earns good, We give him more of good therein;

24.Hamid S. Aziz: Or do they say, "He has forged a lie against Allah"? But if Allah pleased, He would seal your heart; and Allah will blot out the falsehood and confirm the truth with His words; verily, He is Aware of what is in the breasts

25.Hamid S. Aziz: And He it is Who accepts repentance from His servants and pardons the evil deeds and He knows all that you do

26.Hamid S. Aziz: And He answers those who believe and do good deeds, and gives increase unto them of His bounty; and as for the unbelievers, they shall have a severe punishment

27.Hamid S. Aziz: And if Allah were to enlarge (increase, improve, enrich) the provision for His servants they would certainly transgress beyond bounds through the earth; but He sends it down in due measure as He pleases; surely He is Aware of, a Seer (Watchful) of His se

28.Hamid S. Aziz: And He it is Who sends down the saving rain after they have despaired, and He unfolds (scatters) His mercy; and He is the Guardian, the Praiseworthy

29.Hamid S. Aziz: And one of His signs is the creation of the heavens and the earth and the living creatures He has spread forth through them; and He has all power to gather them together when He wills

30.Hamid S. Aziz: And whatever affliction befalls you, it is on account of what your hands have wrought, and yet He pardons much

31.Hamid S. Aziz: And you cannot escape in the earth, and you shall not have a guardian or a helper besides Allah

32.Hamid S. Aziz: And among His signs are the ships in the sea, tall as mountains

33.Hamid S. Aziz: If He pleases, He causes the wind to become still so that they lie motionless on its back; most surely there are signs in this for every patient, grateful one

34.Hamid S. Aziz: Or He may make them perish for what they have earned, though He forgives much

35.Hamid S. Aziz: And that those who dispute about Our revelations may know that they have no refuge

36.Hamid S. Aziz: So whatever thing you are given, that is only a provision of the life of this world, and that which is with Allah is better and more lasting for those who believe and put their trust in their Lord

37.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who. shun the great sins and indecencies, and whenever they are angry they forgive

38.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who respond to their Lord and establish prayer, and whose conduct their affairs by mutual consultation, and who spend out of what We have given them

39.Hamid S. Aziz: And those who, when great wrong afflicts them, defend themselves

40.Hamid S. Aziz: And the recompense of evil is punishment like it, but whoever forgives and amends, he shall have his reward from Allah; surely He does not love the unjust

41.Hamid S. Aziz: And whoever defends himself after he has been wronged (or been oppressed), for such there is no blame against them

42.Hamid S. Aziz: The blame is only against those who oppress men and revolt (insolently exceed all bounds) in the earth unjustly; these shall have a painful punishment

43.Hamid S. Aziz: And whoever is patient and forgiving, these most surely are actions of courage and resolution

44.Hamid S. Aziz: And whomsoever Allah makes err, he has no guardian after Him; and you shall see the unjust, when they see the punishment, saying, "Is there any way to return?"

45.Hamid S. Aziz: And you shall see them brought before it (the Fire) humbled by disgrace, looking with veiled eyes (or furtively). And those who believe shall say, "Surely the true losers are they who have lost themselves and their followers on the Day of Resurrecti

46.Hamid S. Aziz: And they shall have no friends to help them instead of Allah; whomsoever Allah sends astray, for him there is no road

47.Hamid S. Aziz: Hearken to your Lord before there comes the Day from your Lord which there is no averting; you shall have no refuge on that Day, nor shall there be room for denial

48.Hamid S. Aziz: But if they turn away, We have not sent you as a warder over them; yours is only to deliver (the message). Surely when We make man taste mercy from Us, he rejoices there at; and if an evil afflicts them on account of what their hands have already done, t

49.Hamid S. Aziz: Unto Allah belongs the sovereignty (or kingdom) of the heavens and the earth; He creates what He wills; He bestows daughters to whom He will and bestows sons to whom He will

50.Hamid S. Aziz: Or He mingles them, male and female; and He makes barren whom He wills; verily, He is the Knower, Powerful

51.Hamid S. Aziz: And it is not for any mortal that Allah should speak to them unless it be by revelation or from behind a veil, or He sends a messenger to reveal what He will by His leave. Lo, He is Exalted, Wise

52.Hamid S. Aziz: And thus did We reveal to you (Muhammad) an inspired Book by Our command. You did not know what the Book was, nor what the faith was, but We made it a light, guiding thereby whom We will of Our servants; and most surely you guide unto the Straight Way

53.Hamid S. Aziz: The Way of Allah, to Whom belongs whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth; now surely to Allah do all affairs eventually come

1.Hamid S. Aziz: Ha Mim. (two mystical letters

11.Hamid S. Aziz: And Who sends down water from the cloud according to a measure, then We raise to life thereby a dead land, even thus shall you be brought forth

12.Hamid S. Aziz: And He Who created pairs of all things, and made for you of the ships and the cattle that you ride on

13.Hamid S. Aziz: That you may firmly sit on their backs, then remember the favour of your Lord when you are firmly seated thereon, and say, "Glory be to Him Who made this subservient to us, for we could not do it by ourselves

33.Hamid S. Aziz: And were it not that all mankind might have become of a single (evil) community (or way of life), We might well have assigned to those who blaspheme against the Beneficent silver for the roofs of their houses and the stairs by which they ascend

36.Hamid S. Aziz: And whoever turns himself away from the remembrance of the Beneficent (Allah), We appoint for him a devil (or a Satan), who becomes his comrade

44.Hamid S. Aziz: And most surely it (the Quran) is a Reminder for you and your people, and you shall soon be questioned

45.Hamid S. Aziz: And ask those of Our messengers whom We sent before you: Did We ever appoint gods to be worshipped besides the Beneficent

47.Hamid S. Aziz: But when he came to them with Our signs, lo! They laughed at them

55.Hamid S. Aziz: Then when they displeased Us, We inflicted a retribution on them, so We drowned them every one

74.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely the guilty shall abide in the chastisement of hell

78.Hamid S. Aziz: Certainly We have brought you the Truth, but most of you are averse to the Truth

79.Hamid S. Aziz: Or have they settled affairs? But it is We who are the Settlers

80.Hamid S. Aziz: Or do they think that We do not hear what they conceal and their secret discourses? Indeed We do, and Our messengers are with them, recording

82.Hamid S. Aziz: Glorified be the Lord of the heavens and the earth, the Lord of the Throne (of Authority), from what they describe

22.Hamid S. Aziz: Certainly you were heedless of it, but now We have removed from you your veil, and piercing is your sight this day

23.Hamid S. Aziz: And his companions (the Driver and the Witness) shall say, "Here (his Record) is ready with me

24.Hamid S. Aziz: "So cast into Hell every ungrateful, rebellious one

25.Hamid S. Aziz: "Forbidder of good, exceeder of limits, doubter

26.Hamid S. Aziz: "Who sets up another God with Allah; cast him into severe chastisement."

27.Hamid S. Aziz: His companion will say, "Our Lord! I did not lead him into transgression but he himself was in great error."

28.Hamid S. Aziz: He will say, "Do not quarrel in My presence, and indeed I gave you the warning beforehand

29.Hamid S. Aziz: "My word shall not be changed, nor am I in the least unjust to My servants."

30.Hamid S. Aziz: On the day that We will say to Hell, "Are you filled up?" And it will say, "Are there any more?"

31.Hamid S. Aziz: And the Garden shall be brought near to those who guard against evil, not far off

32.Hamid S. Aziz: This is what you were promised, (it is) for every one who turned (to Allah or was repentant), and kept His limits (or Law)

33.Hamid S. Aziz: Who fears the Beneficent One in secret (or unseen or inwardly) and comes with a penitent (or devoted) heart

34.Hamid S. Aziz: "Enter you therein in peace, this is the day of Eternal Life (or Immortality)."

35.Hamid S. Aziz: They have therein all that they wish and with Us is even more

36.Hamid S. Aziz: And how many a generation did We destroy before them who were mightier in prowess than they. Then they wander through (or overrun) the land; but was there for them a place of refuge (when the Judgment came)

37.Hamid S. Aziz: Most surely there is a reminder in this for him who has a heart or he gives ear and is a witness (or understands intelligently)

38.Hamid S. Aziz: And certainly We created the heavens and the earth and what is between them in six periods and there touched Us not any fatigue (Allah required no rest)

39.Hamid S. Aziz: Therefore be patient of what they say, and sing the praise of your Lord before the rising of the sun and before its setting

40.Hamid S. Aziz: And glorify Him in the night and after the prescribed prostrations

41.Hamid S. Aziz: And listen for the Day when the Caller shall cry from a near place

42.Hamid S. Aziz: The Day when they shall hear the Call (or Cry or Blast) in truth; that is the day of coming forth

43.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely We give life and cause to die, and to Us is the final destination (or goal)

44.Hamid S. Aziz: The day on which the earth shall be rent asunder from under them, they will hasten forth; that will be a gathering together easy to Us

45.Hamid S. Aziz: We know best what they say, and you (O Muhammad) are not one to compel them; but admonish by means of the Quran him who fears My warning

1.Hamid S. Aziz: (I swear) By the wind that scatters far and wide

2.Hamid S. Aziz: And those that lift and bear heavy loads

3.Hamid S. Aziz: And those that flow with ease and gentleness

4.Hamid S. Aziz: And those that distribute and apportion by Our command

18.Hamid S. Aziz: And in the morning they prayed for forgiveness

19.Hamid S. Aziz: And in their wealth a portion was allotted for him who asked (the needy) and to him who was denied (the outcast, the deprived person or the one who could not ask)

20.Hamid S. Aziz: And in the earth there are signs for those who have sure faith

21.Hamid S. Aziz: And also in your own souls; will you not then see

22.Hamid S. Aziz: And in the heaven is your sustenance and that which you are promised

23.Hamid S. Aziz: And by the Lord of the heavens and the earth! It is most surely the truth, even as you speak

24.Hamid S. Aziz: Has there come to you information about the honoured guests of Abraham

25.Hamid S. Aziz: When they entered his presence they said, "Peace. Peace." Said he, "What a strange people."

26.Hamid S. Aziz: Then he turned aside to his family secretly and brought a fat (roasted) calf

27.Hamid S. Aziz: And placed it before them. He said, "What! Will you not eat?"

28.Hamid S. Aziz: (When they did not eat) he conceived in his mind a fear of them. They said, "Fear not." And they gave him the good news of a son endowed with knowledge

29.Hamid S. Aziz: Then his wife came up in great grief, and she struck her face and said, "An old barren woman!"

30.Hamid S. Aziz: They said, "Thus says your Lord: Surely He is the Wise, the Knowing."

31.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "What is your errand then, O Messengers!"

32.Hamid S. Aziz: They said, "Surely we are sent to a guilty people

33.Hamid S. Aziz: "That we may send down upon them stone of clay (or brimstones)

34.Hamid S. Aziz: "Sent forth from your Lord for the extravagant (those who transgress beyond bounds)."

35.Hamid S. Aziz: Then We brought forth such believers as were therein

36.Hamid S. Aziz: But We found not therein but one house of those who had Surrendered (Muslims)

37.Hamid S. Aziz: And We left therein a sign for those who fear the grievous penalty

38.Hamid S. Aziz: And in Moses (was another sign). When We sent him to Pharaoh with clear authority

39.Hamid S. Aziz: But he turned away with his forces and said, "A sorcerer or a mad man."

40.Hamid S. Aziz: So We seized him and his hosts and hurled them into the sea and his was the blame

41.Hamid S. Aziz: And in A´ad (was another sign). When We sent upon them the destructive wind

42.Hamid S. Aziz: It spared naught on which it blew, but made it like dust

43.Hamid S. Aziz: And in Thamud (was another sign). When it was said to them, "Enjoy yourselves for a while."

44.Hamid S. Aziz: But they revolted against the commandment of their Lord, so the rumbling (thunderbolt or stunning noise of an earthquake) overtook them while they looked

45.Hamid S. Aziz: And they were not able to rise up, nor could they defend themselves

46.Hamid S. Aziz: And the people of Noah (were also a sign) before that, surely they were a transgressing people

47.Hamid S. Aziz: And the heaven, We raised it high with power, and it is We that expand the vastness of space (or We are the expanders of it)

48.Hamid S. Aziz: And the earth, We have spread it out; how gracious was the Spreader thereof

49.Hamid S. Aziz: And of all things have We created pairs, that you may reflect (or receive instruction)

50.Hamid S. Aziz: Therefore flee unto Allah, surely I am a plain Warner to you from Him

51.Hamid S. Aziz: And set not up with Allah another God: surely I am a plain Warner to you from Him

52.Hamid S. Aziz: Thus there did not come to those before them a messenger but they said, "(He is) A sorcerer or a mad man."

53.Hamid S. Aziz: Is this the legacy (or tradition) they have transmitted to each other? Nay! They are a people extravagant (transgressing beyond bounds)

54.Hamid S. Aziz: Then turn your back upon them for you are not to blame

55.Hamid S. Aziz: And continue to teach (or remind), for surely the reminder profits the believers

56.Hamid S. Aziz: And I have not created the jinn and mankind except to worship (serve) Me

57.Hamid S. Aziz: No sustenance do I require from them, nor do I require that they should feed Me

58.Hamid S. Aziz: Surely it is Allah Who is the Bestower of sustenance, the Lord of Power, the ever Steadfast

59.Hamid S. Aziz: And lo! Those who do wrong shall have a portion like the portion of those of earlier generations, therefore let them not ask Me to hasten

60.Hamid S. Aziz: Woe to those who disbelieve because of their Day which they are promised

31.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Wait (expect) ye! I too with you am waiting (expecting)."

33.Hamid S. Aziz: Or do they say, "He has forged it." Nay! They will not believe

35.Hamid S. Aziz: Or were they created out of nothing, or are they themselves the creators

36.Hamid S. Aziz: Or did they create the heavens and the earth? Nay! They have no certainty

48.Hamid S. Aziz: And wait patiently for the decree (command, judgment) of your Lord, for verily you are in Our eyes; and hymn the praise of your Lord when you rise

1.Hamid S. Aziz: Lo! We sent Noah to his people, saying, "Warn your people before there come upon them a painful doom."

2.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "O my people! Surely I am a plain Warner to you

3.Hamid S. Aziz: "That you should serve Allah and be careful of your duty to Him and obey me

4.Hamid S. Aziz: "He will forgive you some of your faults and grant you a delay for an appointed term; surely the term of Allah when it comes is not postponed; did you but know

5.Hamid S. Aziz: He said, "O my Lord! Surely I have called my people by night and by day

6.Hamid S. Aziz: "But my call has only increased their flight (from truth)

7.Hamid S. Aziz: "And whenever I have called them that you may forgive them, they put their fingers in their ears, cover themselves with their garments, grow obstinate and puffed up with pride

8.Hamid S. Aziz: "So I called to them aloud

9.Hamid S. Aziz: "And lo! I have made public proclamations unto them, and I have appealed to them in private

10.Hamid S. Aziz: "And I have said, ´Ask forgiveness of your Lord, surely He is the most Forgiving

11.Hamid S. Aziz: 71:11."´He will send down upon you an abundance of rain

12.Hamid S. Aziz: "´And help you with wealth and sons, and bestow on you gardens, and bestow on you rivers

13.Hamid S. Aziz: "´What ails you that you fear not the greatness of Allah

14.Hamid S. Aziz: "´Seeing that He has created you through various stages

15.Hamid S. Aziz: "´Do you not see how Allah has created the seven heavens, one above another (or in harmony)

16.Hamid S. Aziz: "´And made the moon therein a light, and made the sun a lamp

17.Hamid S. Aziz: "´And Allah has made you out of the earth as a gradual growth

18.Hamid S. Aziz: "´Then He returns you to it, and then will He bring you forth a new bringing forth

19.Hamid S. Aziz: "´And Allah has made for you the earth a wide expanse

20.Hamid S. Aziz: "´ That you may go about in it in spacious paths (or valleys).´"

21.Hamid S. Aziz: Noah said, "My Lord! Surely they have disobeyed me and followed him whose wealth and children have added to him nothing but loss

22.Hamid S. Aziz: "And they devised a mighty plot

23.Hamid S. Aziz: "And they say (to each other), ´By no means leave your gods, abandon neither Wadd, nor Suwa, nor Yaghut, and Yauq and Nasr (their gods).´

24.Hamid S. Aziz: "And indeed they have led astray many, and do not increase the unjust in aught but error

25.Hamid S. Aziz: Because of their wrongs they were drowned, then made to enter Fire, so they did not find any helpers besides Allah

26.Hamid S. Aziz: And Noah said, "My Lord! Leave not upon the land any dweller from among the unbelievers

27.Hamid S. Aziz: "For surely if you leave them they will lead astray Thy servants, and will not beget any but immoral, ungrateful ones."

28.Hamid S. Aziz: "My Lord! Forgive me and my parents and him who enters my house believing, and the believing men and the believing women; and do not increase the unjust in aught but perdition

1.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "It has been revealed to me that a company of the jinn listened, and they said, "Surely we have heard a wonderful Recital (Quran)

2.Hamid S. Aziz: "Guiding to the right way. So we believe in it, and we will not join any one with our Lord (in worship)

3.Hamid S. Aziz: "And that He, exalted be the majesty of our Lord, has not taken a consort, nor a son

4.Hamid S. Aziz: "The foolish amongst us used to invent extravagant things against Allah

5.Hamid S. Aziz: "And lo! We thought (or think) that men and jinn did not (or ought not to) utter a lie against Allah

6.Hamid S. Aziz: "And, indeed, persons from among men used to seek refuge with persons from among jinn, so they increased them in wrongdoing (or folly or revolt)

7.Hamid S. Aziz: "And they thought as you think, that Allah would not raise anyone (to be judged)

8.Hamid S. Aziz: "And we sought to reach heaven, but we found it filled with strong guards and flaming fires (or meteors)

9.Hamid S. Aziz: "And we used to sit in some high hidden places therein to steal a hearing, but he who would try to listen now would find a flame lying in wait for him

10.Hamid S. Aziz: "We know not whether evil is meant for those who are on earth or whether their Lord means to bring them good

11.Hamid S. Aziz: "And some of us are righteous and others of us are far from that: we are sects following different ways

12.Hamid S. Aziz: "But we know that we cannot escape (or frustrate) Allah in the earth, nor can we escape (or frustrate) Him by flight

13.Hamid S. Aziz: "And when we heard the guidance, we believed in it (or accepted it); whoever believes in his Lord, he neither fears loss nor oppression (injustice or disgrace)

14.Hamid S. Aziz: "Some of us are those who have Surrendered (to Allah), and some of us are deviators. Those who have Surrender have surely taken the right path purposefully

15.Hamid S. Aziz: "As for the deviators, they are the fuel of Hell:"

16.Hamid S. Aziz: If they should keep to the right way, We would certainly give them to drink of abundant water

17.Hamid S. Aziz: "So that We might test them therewith. And whoever turns aside from the remembrance of his Lord, He will afflict him with a severe penalty

18.Hamid S. Aziz: The places of worship are only Allah´s, therefore call not upon any one along with Allah

19.Hamid S. Aziz: And yet when the servant of Allah stood up in prayer to Him, they crowded almost stifling him

20.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "I only call upon my Lord, and I do not associate any one with Him."

21.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "I do not control for you evil or good."

22.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "Surely no one can protect me against Allah, nor can I find besides Him any place of refug

23.Hamid S. Aziz: 72:23."Unless I proclaim what I receive from Allah and His messages; and whoever disobeys Allah and His Messenger surely he shall have the fire of Hell to abide therein for ever

24.Hamid S. Aziz: Until when they see what they are promised, then shall they know who it is that is weaker in helpers and fewer in number

25.Hamid S. Aziz: Say, "I do not know whether that which you are promised be nigh or whether my Lord will appoint for it a distant term

26.Hamid S. Aziz: He is the Knower of the unseen! And He reveals unto none His secrets

27.Hamid S. Aziz: Except messengers whom He has chosen; and then He makes a guard to go before him and after him

28.Hamid S. Aziz: So that He may know that they have truly delivered the messages of their Lord. He encompasses what is with them and He keeps count of all things
